It started with the waitress.. My bf and I sat outside to eat. I could NOT hear a single thing the waitress said or asked. She spoke so soft and quietly that it was impossible to hear her. I repeatedly asked her to speak up and repeat herself.  Secondly, we asked her a question about the menu and she seemed like she didn't know how to reply to our question so she just read everything word by word from the menu she took for me, after we ordered she questioned our orders... "Are you sure you want that?".. we said yes. She went in to enter in the order and about 5-10 mins later, she comes to our table and tells us that one of our orders was out for the night and we had to switch it out or something else. After we ordered our food, two tables came in. They got their orders before we did... waited 30 mins for our food. When the food finally came out, they brought it out to the wrong table...... the waiter brought it back in and a min later, brings it out to us. Half way into our food, our waitress came to ask us if we needed anything, I asked for straws and it took her 5 mins to get two straws.... I felt like the waitress just wanted to waste our time and she took her time for everything...  At the end of the meal, we asked for our check. She brings it out and stands next to us for a minute and waits for us to get our money... she just stood there while we took our payment out.. I mean normally your supposed to just leave it on the table and let the customers take their time with the check, but not her. When she returned the check to us, she slid the check on the table and said "goodnight" and just walked away... not even looking at us..  Food here is mediocre as stated before. We both got the fried chicken and it was cold and hard. They gave me half of a wing and counted it as 1 piece of chicken. The corn bread is hard and dry... mac and cheese have a very odd after taste.  I can not stop ranting about this place because of the horrible service I received.. I'm sorry, but you're honestly better off eating Bojangles. It is 20 better than this place.

pyPjh7UWlSrihVZYHOfOhQ.text: As others have said, the concept is great.  Kudos to those who have put together and executed thus operation.  That said, the food is disappointing.  Three of us went for lunch there recently.  All of us left less than impressed.  First the good:   1.  The whole concept of the restaurant is wonderful!  Giving folks a second chance and giving them meaningful work experience is truly something that we all should strive to do. 2.  Our server was very friendly. 3.  The macaroni and cheese was excellent.  Now for the less than good: 1.  While he was quite friendly, our server was also very over-worked.  It took forever for him to take our order. 2.  None of us was overly impressed with the food.  One person had the meat loaf and she said it was dry.  Another had a chicken sandwich and the bread that it was on was seared, but came to the table quite cold. 3.  I had the veggie plate which, for $12, came with four veggies and a piece of cornbread.  I expected for that price the portions to be substantial.  They were not.  If anything, they each were a bit on the small side.  The black eyed peas and cabbage that I had were simply OK- nothing special about them at all.  I could not eat the collards.  They were way too salty.  As mentioned before, the macaroni and cheese was quite good.  But that really was the only high point of the dishes that we all had.  I really was wanting to give this restaurant and excellent review, but I am afraid I cannot.

38zzid3e8XzhdsbcwPrsyw.text: Saw this place on yelp a while back but never got the chance to make it. Then I came across a two page feature in the airline magazine about Jim Noble as being early on the farm to table movement after a trip to Napa and I knew I needed to make a point to try it. The unassuming exterior opens to a nice clean restaurant. I realized this was a little more then your average southern restaurant when I noticed seared scallops on the menu. The meal started off with CORNBREAD yelp.com/biz_photos/VH3W... It was glistening as it came out, crisp on the top with corn kernels blended in. Quite unique. Ordered the FRIED OYSTERS with BACON VINAIGRETTE yelp.com/biz_photos/VH3W... It crunched the fork. Very good, both the bacon vinaigrette and the think and chunky cocktail sauce were excellent MEAT and THREE (Choice of meat and three sides) yelp.com/biz_photos/VH3W... Had a hard time deciding between the catfish (single entree) and the flounder (Meat & three option). The waiter recommended flounder it was very good as well... crisp, crunchy and flavorful. Got collard greens, mac & cheese, Rosa's green beans. Rosa's greens beans were the best although my friend got the creamed corn which he said was the best. PECAN PIE yelp.com/biz_photos/VH3W... A classic southern dessert, also the waiters recommendation. While I wouldn't say it was amazing the caramel sauce pulled everything together very well. Aside from the great food, King's kitchen is a not-for-profit restaurant. The profits go to feeding Charlotte's hungry and working with businesses, ministries, and non-profits to minister the gospel for Jesus Christ to helping to train troubled youth, rehab graduates and other members of the community who are in need of employment. It's the kind of place that you feel good both about the food and the establishment as a whole. Will definitely be back and looking forward to trying out Rooster, Jim Noble's other restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Anson Mills shrimp &amp; grits (minus surryano ham) ,spicy tomato
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hummingbird cake
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Creamy tomato bisque, basil

dZQ0J-dWRRu7d2XJ5voH2Q.text: Amazing Food! Amazing Mission! We came in for a birthday dinner knowing very little about this restaurant.  We left with our hearts warmed and our souls humbled when we find out their mission and purpose in supporting the Charlotte community.  The soul food is delicious, including the Fried Chicken, Mac & Cheese, Black Eyed Peas, Mushrooms, and Biscuits.  We ended our meal with their coconut cake which is a must try.  Definitely check this restaurant out when you have a chance, we loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

Q_IpS-TBABuqdIC2UC1phQ.text: I haven't been here in years, but 1) the mission is great - the place supports getting down and out people back to work and it works! 2) The fried chicken!!! OMG!!! 3) very good location, right in the heart of uptown.   The fried chicken sandwich will blow your mind. I mean, it is literally a giant fried chicken breast inside a sandwich with slaw and such..  I dare you to eat all that - I can't, but it's awesome.  I really like the chicken salad sandwich too.  And of course you can just be basic in the best way and order the fried chicken with some sides. The sides are classic southern fare. But they are SOOOOO yummy!  Collard greens, butter beans, cream corn. Like Mama makes, if Mama were a southern raised cook who knew how to make food taste sinful when it is something as innocent as beans or corn.

rn-59Pv0UMj1181xh6w0Xg.text: Amazing... the entire experience. The staff, the service, the food-fantastic. And the mission and helping our community in a positive manner. Its a win win all the way around. Definitely will be making this a regular stop.

yyV3hu_GfrmaJRCL9CjlkA.text: When visiting Charlotte for work, a local colleague took us to The King's Kitchen for dinner. The menu consisted of several traditional southern foods which sounded good. We actually all ordered the pan fried chicken, which comes with three sides. I selected the mashed potatoes, collard greens and a biscuit.   The chicken itself was amazing. Perfectly crispy. Amazing flavor, perfect texture. I devoured it. The biscuit was fabulous and ranks right up there with some that I loved in Nashville. I devoured it and wanted to order a second. The greens were awesome. Acidic and still crisp. Finally, the creamed potatoes with gravy were rich and creamy (as you'd expect by the name). I devoured them.   Also want to note that our service was impeccable. The waiter really knew the menu and food and he was super professional.   I highly recommend The King's Kitchen if you find yourself in Charlotte and you're hungry.

-qtjwphlv1Rb5tAJBIpIBw.text: We had an amazing dinner, best tomato bisque I've ever had.  My boyfriend loved the burger.  Great wine, staff (Paul) was on point, nice ambiance. Would definitely recommend. Thank you for having us!

MbZVYhWx6I2rJ5Euig4YXA.text: Things to know: - The chicken is so/so - The collard greens are really good - The macaroni and cheese is okay - The cornbread is salty - The potato salad is bland - Service is quick though I walked in to get food to go today. I ordered Aunt Beaut's Pan Fried Chicken with macaroni and cheese, collard greens, and potato salad, and cornbread. The collard greens were so good. In the past, I've ordered them at restaurants and they tasted spicy. I was worried these would be as well, but they weren't. They were perfect. The chicken was okay. I had a chicken breast and a wing. The wing was good and the breast was a little dry. As I was eating it, I dipped it in the collard green juice and thought about the following meme. LMBO. vids.onsizzle.com/when-t... Back to the review... The macaroni and cheese was okay. I've had better. The cornbread is what I was really looking forward to, only it turned out to be pretty salty. I wasn't expecting that. The potato salad tasted like it came straight from the tubs they sell at Food Lion. It was missing something. I'd be willing to give them another try and order a different meal. The only thing I'd order again is the collard greens. Service is quick though. I think I got my food within 10 minutes of ordering it. I also love the fact that they feed the poor.

3k5KiTKli3H97SSQVauUmw.text: The King's Kitchen was DELICIOUS! Every time I come to Charlotte I never get a chance to go and this time I made it a priority. My husband had the fried chicken w/ greens, corn, Mac & cheese + corn bread. Our friend had the Duck + side salad and I had the gumbo + corn bread. We all thought our food was delicious. But I wasn't really a fan of the corn bread. The bathroom was clean and the staff was pleasant; the manager for the night seemed really nice. Our server was a little dry at first and then he started to come around and I ended up really liking him. We ended up getting banana pudding for dessert and it was average. The price was moderate. I would say the parking is difficult if you are trying to get street parking but there are parking garages near by. Overall so grateful that we decided to have dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

Ce4lUzTTZXJE7HaAJLOpYg.text: Go to lunch downtown. Look at that fried chicken sandwich goodness. Perfect color, crispiness, juiciest meat. Love the color of the breading. Delete mayo, delete slaw.   Sides are also stars. The green beans are filled with so much smokey pork - it smells like a BBQ plate! Corn is simple, good and fresh. Bringing some August to my cold January day downtown.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

UeWVZfe_gV09Oh4Byz1H_Q.text: Very slick interior. Nice spacing. Food was all excellent. Love the mission aspect. Good service.

VAaO57bEvs35B9W20tLHDw.text: Fast service, friendly staff, very cool layout with a cool Christian theme to it and the story behind the restaurant is really cool. They serve the homeless any leftovers. I ordered the blackened salmon w/ 2 sides.. Everything was fresh and hot! Next time I'm in Charlotte i will make this one of the places I visit for dinner or having a meeting.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

eu75xR64wv4gvXiVJIHQhA.text: My husband and I absolutely loved this place!! The atmosphere was warm and welcoming. To our surprise they actually have Sunday church service which we thought was pretty cool especially in a big city. We ordered appetizers, we got the crab dip and as odd as it may sound, I asked for their potato salad as an appetizer. I love potato salad and it's really hard to find any without onions, when I asked and they responded that there weren't any onions in it....my selection was over. I tasted the potato salad first and I soon realized, the amount wasn't going to be enough, I was the second best potato salad (my favorite is my own homemade) i didn't even get a chance to take a picture of our apps bc they were so good. The crab dip was good. I will say they did inform me that it contained er onions but I was fine bc they are cooked however, the dip did have a strong onion flavor, it didn't slow me down! The shrimp and grits were very good, the grits were very creamy, just how I like them. The one downfall was the shrimp still had the tails intact which I do not prefer. My husband had the porkchop and he said it ranked in his top 3 of pork chops, he said the mushrooms were "real" mushrooms, which he said was awesome. And bc I only let him have a bite of my potato salad, he ordered his own and agreed with me on how good it was, and i stole a bite or two of his too lol. Great place, wishes they were open on the weekend for lunch bc we are only in Charlotte for the weekend bc o would come back for every meal!! A++ experience and food!!

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp &amp; Grits
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Porkchop Porterhouse with sauteed mushrooms and potato salad

j5mnAIXdhLEHxRn0tD921A.text: Great place!  The backstory alone makes it a stand out place.  However, the Fried Chicken was exceptional!  The collard greens were the best I have ever enjoyed.  They feature a full menu with steaks, fish, etc. and the price is very reasonable.  King's Kitchen is a not-for-profit restaurant that trainings people most deem unemployable and prepares them for a career providing Charlotte a great community service!

MZFn8hsmWuqfkVshUTFzrw.text: My husband and I got dinner here with another couple before we went to go see a show at the Belk Theater.  The food and service were fantastic. We weren't sure were to start so our server recommended the catfish and scallops. We got the pimento cheese as an appetizer (which was wonderful) the couple we were with got the scallops and shrimp and grits, my husband got gumbo and the burger with mac and cheese, and I got the catfish with frites and mac and cheese.  Everything was incredible and delicious. We will definitely be back.

FOtpsMH3k4chf_GjCQgzug.text: I took my cousins from Montreal here to show them good southern food for a good cause. We made a reservation online and they were limited on time slots, but we got there early and they sat us right away...and there were plenty of tables available. We sat at a kinda smallish table outside...not the greatest but we got over it. We tried a few local beers and our waiter was great at explaining the drink options.  For dinner, two of us got the chicken and waffles, one of us got the ribs, and I got the fried chicken with garden peas, fries, and mac and cheese with a biscuit. The chicken and waffles was incredible!! My cousin was floored with how good it was. My other cousin said the ribs were some of the best that he has ever had...and ribs are popular where he is from. They were so tender he was able to slide the bones out cleanly and eat it with a fork and knife so he didn't look like a savage (his words). My fried chicken was on point! I've had it before and just love it. The sides were just alright. The biscuit was soooooo good and the fries were great, but the other sides were just okay.  The food came out very quickly....perhaps too quickly? We were in and out in less than 45 minutes. But the food was tasty and the waiter was very friendly. I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ribs and slaw
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. fried chicken dark, biscuit, garden peas, and mac and cheese
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and a little waffle underneath

W2CvmYsYVIIwPxybvw_YKA.text: Honestly I've been wanting to go here for a very longtime but it always seemed to expensive for southern food.  Well I finally compromised with myself and went for lunch and I am so glad I did this because this was one of the best lunches I had in a while.  I had the Fried Chicken Sandwich with coleslaw on top and it was the best restaurant style chicken sandwich I've ever had.  For my side I had the mashed sweet potatoes and they were almost as amazing.  The only downside here is that I was uncomfortably full for quite a while afterward.  Inside was quite amazing as well and offered a very large dining area very meticulously decorated almost as if it was a Crate and Barrel department store.  I was very impressed all around and cannot wait to be back for dinner in the near future!    Food:  9/10 Atmosphere:  10/10 Service:  8/10 Value:  8/10    Will return!

qMfLZ3_4IpD81Ck6tkLh_w.text: Delicious pot roast, blsck eyed peas, mashed potatoes and mac n cheese. Be sure to get the banana pudding for dessert.

NeXRT3LA4-6VHhlY9NXKig.text: A friend and I decided to visit for dinner on a Saturday before heading to a movie. I made very last minute reservations for 5:15pm which is only 15 minutes after they open. When we arrived we were seated right away. There were a few tables occupied but it wasn't very busy at the moment. Our waitress came immediately and took our drink orders. As we reviewed the menu we wanted everything!! My friend settled on the Crab Dip & Pan Fried Chicken with Biscuit, Mashed Potatoes & Butter Beans, while I ordered the Crab Cake & Pan Fried Chicken with Corn Bread, Mac&Cheese, Green Beans & Collard Greens. Both of us were very pleased with our meal. The chicken was fried & seasoned just right, like your grandma fried it. The Mac&Cheese was my favorite. It's not often I visit a restaurant that makes it like my mom and leaves me leaving more but they accomplished this rare task. It was very cheesy and not watery and not dry, just perfectly baked with a nice crispy top & edges from the cheese, YUM!!! Everyone knows that the top is the best part of Mac&Cheese when it's made right and this was no different, I saved it for last as if I was home lol. The Collard Greens were perfect for me. Some may not like them because they had a bit of sweetness to them (Brown sugar), but I typically add sugar to my collards anyway. They cook those and the green beans in pork. Speaking of the Green Beans, those were the one thing that I did not like at all. My friend tasted them and we both tried to figure out where they went wrong. I could have been the seasoning because they were pretty bland. But there was still something off with the taste, as if the pork was bad or something. Anyway, I just swapped them out for more Mac&Cheese and I was happy again. You could tell the corn bread was REAL no Jiffy Mix here. I'm not a bread person so I like my corn bread to have a hint of sweetness to it. But those who love real corn bread will like this. It wasn't dry at all. The appetizers were also awesome. I'd order both again. Our waitress was also great! Very attentive. We were so excited when our food came that forgot to take pics lmbo. But i'll definately be returning soon & often. There are other items I need to give a try.

A77lM0eVWH6t8yp7d16_og.text: This is some good southern food! I've had the chicken, salmon, and chicken sandwich. All were cooked wonderfully and tasted yummy! Chicken sandwich was too messy to eat like a sandwich but nothing a fork and a knife can't fix.   It's usually pretty quiet for lunch. Service is quick and food is prepared in no time.   Their mac n cheese is very cheesy. It wasn't my favorite thing in the world so I'm excited to go back and try one of their other sides (large variety of options available).

69QHLTAN7ef0zZ7dU8JcXQ.text: Food was great and service was also great! Our waiter was incredibly polite and very attentive without being overbearing. Great Charlotte restaurant that is also does incredible mission and service to Charlotte folk who need some help!

UdqGNf7q8aFgPug000F5EA.text: Not too impressed with the menu selections. They have pork in the collard greens and green beans which are disgusting.   Everything was full of meat. If you are not a meat eater stay away.  The waiter is really nice though.

oy4s6uLNcuY0TavGgdZ9hg.text: Make reservations  - this place is busy on Saturday nights. We had to eat at the bar, but that as actually fun. The bar staff was very engaging! The kids enjoyed burgers. Hubby and I had pot roast, mac&cheese (amazing), green beans, collards, pot roast, and Charlotte Red Rice. All the flavors were great, though the Red Rice portion was small for the price. I love this restaurant most because of their not-for-profit mission to feed the poor and job-training for those who need a new start at life. They are good folks!

ew-Foa8kw2lQD7fGa-sfzA.text: So as my regular dinner plans got screwed up tonight, a few friends and I opted to check out Kings Kitchen.  The positives:  Very friendly staff, the purpose of the restaurant is wonderful, the collard greens are amazing, decent wine selection, and the willingness of the management to talk to you about things not working with your meal.    The not-so positives:    Spare ribs should be tender where they should be easy to pick off the bone.  These were very tough and I was fighting with them with the butter knife.  At least serve them with a better knife.    Water glasses were only refilled for some of the people at our table...seemed to be the pretty ones; the banana pudding - while the claim is it is the signature dessert - it was a bit runny and didn't seem to be set long enough.  I was disappointed with the ribs.  The waiter asked my truthful opinion and I told him.  He said it was taken care of and the manager came over and talked to me about it as well.  I appreciate this and the purpose of this restaurant and in order to make things right, the staff needs to know about these flaws.

MhCQ99VsgKRDzMqZWhVizw.text: Yummy they have the worlds best fried chicken meal. Great customer service. Super fast.

VsgfantZq6KJIistEdaYTw.text: The best fried chicken I've had in a restaurant! I came here without a reservation on a weeknight and it was the best decision I've made in a while. The fried chicken plate with collard greens and mac and cheese was the best meal I've had in a while. The greens were perfectly cooked and had a very smokey and sweet flavor that left me wanting more! I would recommend this place to anyone visiting Charlotte.  In addition to the great food this restaurant is also a non-profit. All of the profit goes to furthering the restaurants mission "to raise funds to feed the spiritual and physical needs of those who have the least in our community and to train and equip those previously unemployable in the restaurant trade." Amazing food and a MISSION!

YmCBhb65YnrJURXqum2kzQ.text: Stopped for a light lunch - just ordered a crab cake and gumbo. Service was fast and attentive. The crab cake was very good but not the best I have ever had. However, the crab was garnished with pickled red onion which was very good. Worth ordering: Yes. The gumbo was very good. Thick, a little spicy, and full of shrimp and sausage. Worth ordering: Definitely yes.

EdQ1wPEzi9NWAElpKosd6g.text: I like everything about The King's Kitchen. The food was great, the service friendly and knowledgeable, the atmosphere inviting and open, and the concept impressive.   There were 5 of us for a late dinner and desert, King's Kitchen did not disappoint. We started with the cheese plate and fried oysters. The oysters were perfectly cooked and served with a bacon balsamic dipping sauce. I had the shrimp and grits (with the tomato sauce on the side) and it was wonderful. The shrimp were grilled and perfectly spiced and the grits were possibly the best I've ever had. I stole a bite of my friends flank steak and cornbread panzanella while she wasn't looking and it was just as good.   We shared a couple deserts between the 5 of us, we had the pecan pie, coconut chess pie, banana pudding, and the brownie. They were all fantastic.   The service was very good. Our server did a good job of keeping our drinks full making sure we didn't need anything while not interrupting our conversations. That's a fine line to walk with 5 women who don't see each other very often. His knowledge of the menu was helpful when ordering, he knew the menu and dishes inside and out.   My favorite part of the King's Kitchen is that every penny of their profits are donated to help feeding the poor. As if that's not reason enough to give them your business, they also partner with area outreach programs to provide employment to those in need of a new beginning.   Between the delicious food and the knowledge that you're helping those in need, there is no reason to *not* enjoy a meal at The King's Kitchen. Often.

h095SwsY2g2EjEVe3HZnAw.text: Excellent food for dinner. Tomato bisque was awesome. Service was excellent. We walked away stuffed and happy.

DM9qrcKciSqLJw_id50CDw.text: Here's the breakdown:  3 stars for food 5 stars because of their overall mission Meet in the middle for a total of 4 outstanding stars!  Like others have mentioned, their mission is phenomenal! 100% of profit from sales is donated to feed the poor and they provide job opportunities for people in need. In addition, they create dishes using local ingredients.  The ambiance is very nice and spacious. They even have patio seating for those nice days and nights.   Spend your money here and it will go very far to help others!

4Ma1-BHtae09TRwJZkg__A.text: Food was only decent for the price. I ordered the shrimp and grits and my fiance ordered pot roast. Pot roast was a bit dry. Portions were a little small and cornbread was dry. Mac and cheese was very good but small portion!  We didn't have reservations so we had to sit at the bar. I guess reservations are preferred. There wasn't an option of putting our name on a list or taking one of the open tables.  The waiter at the bar was very nice and we were able to sit and order instantly so overall decent experience but nothing special.

SRYprG0iit73asq22He5oA.text: This place was amazing! I really enjoyed it. I had the fried chicken, mashed potatoes, green beans, and the Mac and cheese. The Mac and cheese was great I should have made that two of my sides. Food was quick to get out and the staff was all very friendly. A must stop!

T2Sf8HU0IN1mR1LImLAYwA.text: Overall, good food, noble mission... It's a place that you feel good about eating a meal at :)   I absolutely love the concept behind King's Kitchen. They are a not-for-profit restaurant that donates 100% of it's profits from sales to feed the community. Not only do they have a noble mission and vision, but they have tasty food!   I had a group interview in Uptown and a few of us were looking for a lunch spot close by. It was the one rainy, cold, windy day that week and we were on foot. Someone suggested Jimmy John's but I refused to walk too far.  Luckily, The King's Kitchen was at the corner of the block. We walked in and we took a peak at the menu. Everyone was satisfied with the selection so we asked to be seated. I got the chicken salad croissant sandwich which came with a side. I opted for a mixed greens salad with balsamic. The sandwich was excellent! The side salad was good, a simple mixed green salad with fresh ingredients. No complaints. The other selections at the table looked tasty as well! The prices were fair, $9-13 for the lunch menu.  The service was attentive and everyone was very polite. I would like to return to try their dinner selections.

W4kjF3FijgV2HH5Ay3ZiyA.text: I give The King's Kitchen a 4 on food and 2 on service for the first visit.  Maybe after the another visit, I'd be willing to bump up my rating.  First off, it's conveniently located downtown, with some nearby street parking or a garage right behind it.  The decor inside is very cute, with some old pots and pans scattered near the front, as well as some interesting home-made art.  I really appreciate their mission of giving the profits to the homeless.    The food was very good.  For the starter, we had the fried oysters, which came with a cocktail sauce and a bacon vinagrette.  They were delicious, and I am not usually a fan of oysters.  I had the fried chicken, with roasted carrots, mashed potatoes, and pan seared cabbage.  The fried chicken was awesome, and all the sides were quite tasty.  The bread they brought to the table had the perfect texture, more crunchy and chewy toward the outside and soft in the middle, with just a hint of sweetness.  They served with real butter, and it was fabulous.  My partner had the fried flounder and mac and cheese - both of these were also great.  Everything was cooked perfectly.  For dessert, we chocolate peanut butter crunch cake.  The cake itself was just ok, but they served it with some really delicious vanilla bean ice cream.  I feel bad complaining about the service, because our server was really nice and it wasn't entirely his fault.  We arrived there for dinner on a Saturday night at 6:00, and we left the restaurant at 7:48.  Our appetizer arrived quickly, but then our food order got lost.  Because our server was so busy, it was almost 7:00 before he realized we had not gotten our food.  He rushed the food, and we got it about 10 minutes later.  He apologized to us then and as we were leaving.  It look another long time before he came over to get our dessert order.  I think they were understaffed, because everybody was really rushing around.  I would definitely come back again, because the food was very good.  I am willing to give them the benefit of the doubt about the slow service.  I genuinely feel bad for looking a bit annoyed about our food being lost.  I would watch for slow service if you plan to come here on a busy weekend.

g7zuJJdi8WUa4bhlS3LwJA.text: Fantastic early dinner on the patio really impressed me! My family - with a 2 year old and infant - met friends here for dinner while we were visiting Charlotte. Our friends had highly recommended it and they did not disappoint.   We sat on the patio, so hopefully our mess wouldn't be too bad. It did get loud with some Friday afternoon traffic and busses, but it wasn't constant. Our waiter was very attentive and sweet to the kids.   My kids split a chicken tender kids meal and they both loved it. I am not a fried chicken fan, but after reading other reviews, I decided to try it, and I am SO GLAD I did! It was very lightly battered and so crispy. The sides were delicious. They were out of green beans, but the mashed potatoes, butter beans, and corn were perfect. My husband and friends had the herb roasted chicken and they thought it was great too. The biscuits were perfect and cornbread was delicious.   My husband had the blueberry cheesecake for dessert and it was gone before I could get a bite! I devoured the banana pudding. The toasted marshmallow on top was the perfect compliment!

WKkWOlatDlMuHVxj3MxUSQ.text: After recently accepting a new job, my previous Manager and some of my teammates took me to King's Kitchen for a farewell lunch. Although the service was again a little slow, the food was better than I remembered. We ordered a variety of items, from meatloaf, falafel salad, tomato bisque soup, fried chicken, and roast turkey. The portions were large and everything tasted great, clean plates all around. Top picks seemed to be the fried chicken & meatloaf. I do look forward to getting back and trying a few more sides, b/c there were a lot.

1pcvMjZNzquv870-rwOlLQ.text: We went to King's Kitchen last night to celebrate my mother's birthday. What a wonderful experience! I cannot say enough good things about this place. The food was amazing! We did not feel rushed, and had a very relaxed dinner. The fried chicken was amazing, and the beets were fantastic! Stuart was a wonderful server! Thanks so much!!

pgIJOe0WapahvFPd7j3fxA.text: My husband and I ate here for lunch and I had the oyster po boy and he had the fried chicken sandwich. Our food was good and we had a really nice waiter. I will definately go back for dinner.

G3yjBWBvToNuqIBVVuEaEg.text: This was my first visit to Kings Kitchen in some time.  We went as a large group and accommodations were good considering we did not have a reservation for 15 people.  I order a popular southern combination (all the entrees are southern) of cornbread, fried chicken, greens and yams.  I think the entrees was a little pricey.  The food was  good.  I would have preferred a little hotter plate but understand they wanted to serve us all at once.  The service was good.  I may return for another special visit.  I do appreciate what the Kings Kitchen provides for many of the workers.  It gives an opportunity where opportunity may not have existed.  Great cause!

7OsF-YSzhWA6DT8ExnaFyg.text: In town for business and was needing some good fried chicken. I saw great reviews so tried Kings. The place was pretty dead when I go there, but that was totally cool wit me since I was just eating at the bar and watching the Syracuse game (nice!). Before food arrived, I decided to wet the palette.. and what do we have here? Oh my, a double IPA! Well thank you very much, I'll have 3.   I went with the fried chicken, mac n cheese, cabbage, buttered beans and a coronary. I ordered the dark meat but got a breast, and so happy I did - it was insanely juicy. The buttered beans almost stole the show, they were so good. The cabbage was greasy but I quickly forgot that as I inhaled the mac n cheese.  The staff was excellent and even gave me a little history of the place, which was pretty touching as the restaurant serves over 60 homeless people every day.   Great food, great mission - no reason not to try this place!

zzW40S_WStrOapO0YPlcQw.text: I like what they stand for being a non profit organization. I had the pan fried chicken and 3 sides. The sides were good, but the chicken was tough and dry. I had them take it back and the manager was very pleasant about it. I wanted to have dessert but half of the dessert menu was unavailable. Would I come again? I'm not sure.

rzqzeHOX2Aaua_-zj6i4Rg.text: Ugh, what a disappointment. I really wanted to like this place because of the great concept. We came for lunch on a Monday and I felt like we were just served leftovers from Sunday night dinner rush. We ordered the pimento cheese appetizer with hard bread and hard pimento cheese dip. I got the fried chicken sandwich which was too dry and Mac and cheese with way too much pepper.

QmzjyycgbXMzfLz7e_qGEw.text: I like this place. The servers are very friendly and the food was good. I didn't like the corn bread everything else was good I ordered Salmon, cream style corn, sweet mashed as they called it and butter beans. The yams and the corn were very good. I will be back for some of that. I was gonna order desert but I thought the prices were kinda high so I didn't. I know it's for a good cause but like I said before I will be back to contribute.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Desert Menu
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon, butter beans, cream style corn, and yams

qXW3PizKAkAab2-xHZ2p7Q.text: If you don't know the story behind King's Kitchen, be sure to do some research before you come. It makes your meal so much more meaningful! 100% of the proceeds are donated to the homeless ministry that the owner Jim Noble heads up. Best dishes of the night was the heirloom tomato salad and lemon meringue pie!

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lemon Meringue Pie with Blueberry Compote
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beet &amp; Potato Salad and Fresh Chanterelles
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Heirloom Tomato Salad

5cvkvkQo4mL5IQhRl69wuA.text: How to begin... impressive upon arrival, but then we were escorted to a private, dark, dated, unfinished corner with flimsy tables and uncomfortable chairs.  We were quickly greeted by our eager server Noah, he tended to us quite quickly.  He recommended the NY strip which we both ordered.  (pic posted).  The steak did not disappoint the combination of mushrooms and sunchokes in their sauce was perfect.   The steak was expertly cooked.      We were inspired to get dessert to go... More to come!!

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. New York Strip

3sxc7yBPcPY3SE6WABfZLQ.text: I have only ever been here for lunch so that is what the review is based off of. I will start off by saying I am going to bump my review up a notch due to the story behind Kings Kitchen. I highly support their mission and the fact that they are not for profit, give jobs to those who might not be able to get employment to past circumstances, and give back to the community in many ways. It is such a great idea and I wish that it would catch on more!  We got deviled eggs to start. They were good deviled eggs! For my entree I got a chicken salad sandwich and a side of mashed sweet potatoes. The food itself was good and I was happy. It wasn't the best I have ever had but it was good. The menu was a little limited and I would like to see it expanded. Maybe there are more dinner options though so can't complain.   The service was excellent and I like the location/feel to the restaurant itself. I suggest stopping by here to support the community and give it a try!

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

_iW46U4jkspHC5A8fEczHg.text: This place has an incredible story and mission. I've been here often and always enjoy my good but I enjoy the hope and encouragement my patronage brings to the staff.   I had the pleasure of coming to the Kings a Kitchen with a Feast Food Tour and Chef Rob shared with us how he started cooking and how he got to the Kings Kitchen. His testimony was moving and the pimento cheese with smoky red peppers was AMAZING!!! They should sell that by the lb.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chef Rob
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

uECBcORGzbNURZcNL9tBuw.text: Loved, loved, LOVED this place! Was in town walking around with my hubby when we searched Food Network shows for places they'd been nearby. This beautiful gem popped up and was just a couple of block away. Everything from the greeting, to the ambiance, to the food was exceptional. We enjoyed simply looking around and reading all of the interesting history as we waited for our food. What an amazing experience. Would definitely go back!

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hubby&#39;s delicious meal. He loved every bite!
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. My delicious meal! Everything was amazing!

ndnD_nWAM77FJgxaz2DQiw.text: I have enjoyed this place since my very first visit. The food was everything I expected, and the servers always have a smile, even during their busiest hours. I especially like fact that the restaurant hosts our homeless neighbors on a daily basis.

rJk8EzaXW3SuSb2-i_8mHA.text: I went to the Queen City (Charlotte NC) and ate at The King's Kitchen. It was recommended to me by someone in the hotel as a great local place to eat if you like "Southern food" He said, you know fried chicken and mashed potatoes. I'm in! That's all I need to hear. I was pleased to hear Christian music playing on the radio and a friendly staff greeting and waiting on me. I ordered the fried chicken, mashed potatoes, butter beans, black eyed peas. Very good and reasonable priced for downtown eating. I also learned more about their mission and how they help people get back on their feet. It's a great place grab a meal when you're in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Southern Fried Chicken

N16FDrOf10qziNUdrdEy2Q.text: A soul-inspired restaurant with a soul-warming mission. Reserved a table for two to catch up with a friend for dinner. Service with a smile, menu is the right length to provide options and focused so that they deliver good quality.   Bakery looked even better so would be interested in trying something from there for breakfast sometime.   The tables were full when we were there on a Tuesday, and it can get a little loud when full (likely due to tile floors).

OUG7hos0VX9viWuiPMRH6g.text: I've been here a few times now and their food never disappoints.  The fried chicken is incredible as is the flounder.  Couple that with a few of their sides and someone is going to have to roll you out of the restaurant.  From a sides standpoint, the macaroni and collards are excellent.  They also have a solid pimento cheese dip as an appetizer.  I'm 100% confident that you could wear a blindfold while choosing your dinner and still leave happy.  I love the whole concept of Kings Kitchen.  I'm always a big fan of restaurants giving back to the community in some way shape or form. As is the case with a lot of restaurants in Uptown, parking can be a pain.

wzeKX91zlK_-2sMVjzliWg.text: Visited King's Kitchen after a long week of training in Charlotte with a coworker.  We were seated quickly in the bar area and almost immediately had water in front of us (much appreciated after our walk to the restaurant from our hotel).  The host saw that the bartender was preoccupied and he came over to take our dinner order so that we didn't have to wait.  Major bonus points for that awareness.  I ordered the steak frites and my coworker ordered the Salmon served with pimento cheese grits.  I also tacked on a biscuit because. . . why not?  The steak was good.  Not great.  It was cooked to my liking and the demi glace was good but I wish the steak itself had been seasoned more.  The frites were good.  My coworker let me try the pimento cheese grits and those were delicious.  Very rich flavor.  The biscuit was pretty meh.  I expected something to be served with it (butter? jelly?) By itself it was pretty forgettable.    This review is really a 3 star for food and a 4 star for service.  Great service wins out in that battle.

nRdGdowjTpFp6gWn06A2Zw.text: My first time in Charlotte and this restaurant was suggested. I was delighted to see homestyle food on the menu. We started out with sweet potato fritters which were hot and fresh. So tasty. I ordered the pot toast with creamed corn, green beans and Mac & cheese. It was delicious!!!  So convenient to the plaza. This is s place that shouldn't be missed.

_eubTZWiUUaTE7ZFp82JZw.text: My wife and I come to town about 2 times a month during basketball season and we are always on the hunt for some good food when we are in town. While out for a morning walk we saw the Kings Kitchen and looked it up on yelp. I'm happy we went to the kings kitchen. The staff was super friendly but not over attentive, and the food was really good. We had the pimento cheese with some really good tasting bread as an appetizer and it was tasty. I had the tri-tip steak with fries and mushrooms, while my wife had the pot roast with mac and cheese and mushrooms. The meals were prepared really well and everything was great tasting. We can't wait to go back and try some of the other dishes. I highly recommend trying out the Kings Kitchen.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. tri-tip steak, fries and mushrooms
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. pimento cheese appetizer
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. pot-roast, green beans, mac &amp; cheese and mushrooms

M6RYIzGOJOq3eRnzhLojqA.text: Wow! Great food with a great cause! I had the shrimp and grits with a side of green beans. The food was excellent.

H-Sywh0cnHx41axfpD--hQ.text: I had the steak, hubby had the shrimp and grits.   We both loved our food. The shrimp and grits portion size was a bit smaller than we felt it should be. A small piece of crusty bread would have been  nice, especially since they have a bakery there.  They win points with me for the mission to support people getting back on their feet. Definitely check them out.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits.  Real good. Hubby would have liked a little larger portion though.
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tri tip steak with fries.  Excellent.

ZMGtUwm7tOFTyDntGGsOjA.text: I had the seared scallops. They were cooked well but the seasoning was way too strong and overpowered the dish. The celery root puree tasted like cream of celery soup and there was barely any pickled greens. My mom got the gumbo which didn't taste fresh; she described the texture as gummy. The service was the best part of the dining experience.

du32kfWWQX28F9010vIQqA.text: I was very impressed with the food and the service.  I had the famous Ruben sandwich with their extra cheesy mac and cheese.  Everything was perfect.  I also enjoyed the sweet tea.  I strongly recommend this restaurant.

92ikmSpw0qHwDOVZN-XhPw.text: Best restaurant yet!!   Shrimp n Grits :) and fried Oysters :)  We even had a chance to serve the next day great place changing lives!!

D2VgxEI31A_04Cz2LeWjwQ.text: BF and I had dinner reservations and were seated right away. He ordered the shrimp and grits and I had the fried chicken with corn, mash potatoes, mac and cheese, and collard greens. The cream corn was the BEST side ever it was buttery and flavorful. The order sides are to expectations. Meals also come with a biscuit which is really good, super fluffy. So I know I shouldn't be saying this but I wish my fried chicken was more flavorful and greasy LOL. Their fried chicken was pretty healthy tasting LOL (not a bad thing, but I just wanted more). The shrimp and grits were really good though. The shrimp were a decent size. Service was great and atmosphere is definitely southern hospitality.

it4PBvlGt3b6Fzz7aA_66Q.text: The fried chicken sandwich with coleslaw and house pickles was sooo good, along with the sweet potato mash.  Others had the Panini and fries which were also delicious.  Superb services and a great cause as an added bonus.

Y6ROFolGXsI9L1l9fztbrg.text: Bonz Smoke and Taphouse. Great service and atmosphere for football. Wings were awesome. Great menu.  Staff very attentive.

aPz_GSJshCUZNuc-ZYB7EA.text: Great mission, even better food! We tried a variety of apps and sides (fried green tomatoes, crab cake, sweet potato fritters, butter beans, cabbage, green beans, mac & cheese, cornbread) and everything was super delicious! I had the salmon as a main course, which was also terrific!

B8DSKPbbXAmYVJKlUTy9Mg.text: Came here on our first visit to NC from California, so I am not a local cuisine aficionado if you will. Our goal was to intake as much southern cuisine as possible, as this was the most "southern" state we had been to. With that in mind I ordered the shrimp and grits and my partner ordered the fried chicken. The shrimp were well cooked in a red sauce, but there weren't many and I didn't find the sauce anything extraordinary. I couldn't take the grits. They were just too thick, cheesy, and rich. I love cheese, it's one of my main staples but I couldn't handle these and my partner agreed. I would have much rather had her homemade white wine and garlic shrimp and grits, which are also a while lot healthier than the heart attack on a plate I had. She was also generally unimpressed with her fried chicken which also arrived a little cold. Fried chicken should be piping hot. The service was friendly and the place was very busy so it's clearly well liked, however, I would not go back.

Y-72GRWqL2zhXsgdNB65vQ.text: We were staying at the Marriott and just wanted something close. The food was amazing. I had the scallops - YUM! The service was great and the selection of craft beer and wines was awesome.

UMzvadI-gp7y0kkGP9POng.text: Shrimp and grits, delicious ! Bob got seared scallop; he said awesome. Also, coconut cake. YUM

kDFq8f9LMO1uF3XXlQlhRg.text: Excellent service and good food. I wish the cornbread was sweet though. All and all I say it was just OK.

pe7vvSwZPsUZUJqOrBRrFg.text: Fried chicken isn't the healthiest, but it sure is tasty. Pair it with sides of mac & cheese, coleslaw and roasted carrots -- it's all the better. Add hot sauce, look out!   And with mission for feeding people who are struggling, providing job training, and generally doing good... Well, that's just a place I can support.   The prices were right. The food was good. Ambiance was pleasant. Service was flawless. And, the company was fantastic. Highly recommend this King's Kitchen. Mostly for the good it does in the community. You'll enjoy it.

BX2Vr3AByrF4I5NgzGyWbw.text: Absolutely love this place! Their take on hush puppies is to die for.  The desserts are awesome! Fresh banana  pudding, great coconut cake,  and terrific lemon merengue pie that is almost a cross with strawberry shortcake.  Nice wine selection- live the Proemio Malbec.

k74tAp5cl5r3uxY7cax8uA.text: I'm just adding my positives to all the others - this place was great! We got there right at 7 on a Saturday, and within minutes it was packed. Still the service was good and fast. The waitstaff are friendly and knowledgeable and the food was excellent. I had the fried flounder with mac n' cheese, collard greens, and butter beans. Each item was tasty - just how you would want it to be, seasoned like it should be. These are some well-known, established type foods, and you have expect it to taste a certain way. And it does, so I was satisfied and happy.  Only downside for me was that it is loud when its full of people, being all glass and chrome, it makes for some noise.

_Zhc4FmqLMake69NP2gEoA.text: All around awesome establishment! Food is absolutely delicious and the customer service is nothing short of outstanding. Their mission is even more of a reason to support this business along with its sister restaurant Rooster.

i_fW4voQTpL396BVsUPwPg.text: Great service and delicious food~ Love their buckwheat pancakes, scones, and fresh coffee!!!

_Ty_pUgDOl6MdF-m9f9kPw.text: "Each chicken, feed some people"- Their slogan on the menu  We loved this place. The fact that their sole purpose is to make good food so that they can feed the homeless in the area makes me happy.   I had the fried chicken with mac & cheese, Black eyed peas and creamy potatoes. The entree was excellent for the most part. The peas were not my favorite, but I think it's more of a preference thing for me. My wife had the fried flounder, and it was amazing. I was actually a little jealous, but don't tell the chicken. We also "split" the chocolate, peanut butter crumb cake that was decadent.   The staff were amazing. Some of the best service we have had. Our friend told us that their cornbread was extremely tasty, but when we asked about it, we were informed that they only serve that at lunch now. A few minutes later our waiter came back a warm basket saying he found a few pieces in the back for us. All of his recommendations were spot on and he helped us understand a little more about the mission of the restaurant. Knowing that the proceeds were helping the community, we didn't mind splurging on items that we normally might pass over like dessert.  The atmosphere was also warm and cozy. My wife said it felt like someone's home. The candlelight was perfect and the layout of the place was nice.   Definitely try this place if you are looking for soul food in the Truest meaning of the phrase.

Xbgrn5oRhIxb6kDt7hLXxA.text: I bought my first groupon for this restaurant. Upon learning that their a non-profit and provide food for the needy.. I felt a little guilty so I ended up not using the groupon. I'm glad they offered one, because it gave me that first little push I needed.   As for the food, the fresh hot biscuits started my evening off with a salivating bang. I ordered and split two meat and threes. I got a hefty serving of flounder, fried chicken, mac n'cheese, collards, green beans, mashed potatoes, creamed corn, and roasted carrots. They all got along swell in my belly.   I had high expectations and they were surely met. Parking wasn't bad, the interior space was very neat, and the waitstaff was very attentive. All around the perfect southern meal and experience.

8b8l22jZzDQN1Nq5x548nQ.text: I have so many wonderful things to say about the Kings Kitchen. First off, I respect the mission of this non-profit restaurant and what they give back to the community. Angela, was our waitress & she was fantastic as well as the other staff. My husband had the duck special and I had the shrimp & grits which was delicious. Everything was cooked to perfection. We also had the sweet potato fritters which were awesome. For dessert, we couldn't decide so we had the banana pudding & the coconut cake. I just love everything about Kings Kitchen and can't wait to visit again.

cdZixRfAQry2c5BzwIVxjA.text: The Wife and I were heading to a 7:30 show and wanted to give Kings Kitchen a try.  We set a fairly early 6:00 reservation and we were one of the first groups in the restaurant that Monday night.   The server appeared promptly (maybe a little too much so) to take our drink orders, so we put him off just a bit while we perused the wine and beer selections, which were pretty good.  When we placed our dinner orders I let the waiter know that we had a 7:30 show, no big hurry at that time, but better safe than sorry.  I had the Fried Chicken that has gotten so many good reviews, Mac and Cheese, cabbage and mashed potatoes.  My dear Sweet Wife went with the Fried Flounder Filet, Collards, Mac and Cheese and mashed potatoes.  OK, here's where I'm supposed to complain how everything fell apart, we were late for our show, and I died from undercooked chicken.....but none of that happened.  Our meal arrived promptly, but not so fast that we did not have time to enjoy our drinks a little before eating.  The chicken was delicious, juicy and flavorful with a nice crust.  Try as I may, I can't seem to cook chicken, so I appreciate it when someone gets it right.  The cabbage had good flavor, not watery, as you get at many restaurants.  The mac and cheese?  Well, it rivaled my Wife's (sorry Babe), and she makes really good and unhealthy mac and cheese with lots of cheese and cream.  Mashed Potatoes?  Biscuits?  Done right.  The flounder was breaded with the same sort of crust as the chicken instead of a corn meal breading.  She said it was very good.  A big portion of collards were well done.  We passed on dessert because the main portions were plenty.    All in all, we had a good experience.  We had plenty of time, but we weren't rushed by the staff. Of course Monday at 6:00 is not a busy time, but by the time we left several parties had arrived and the place was pretty busy.

fiTaDx6yxXq4bJpfNVBdDg.text: Highly recommend eating here. The shrimp and grits were amazing! Ordered the sweet potato fritters as an appetizer. Delicious ! and later had the beet salad also delicious. This restaurant is a nonprofit organization which exists to give back to the community in the form of training people otherwise considered unemployable. Sunday's the restaurant is closed and used for a nondenominational service and meal offering for those in attendance. Check it out at kingskitchen.org

FySsoaKXEtVT6Hm_9yYpWA.text: A fancy meat and three with a purpose. I have always gotten great service here, lunch and dinner.

iXIBbmQGfyRxgC6X9Ru4RQ.text: This is a fantastic place. We went here on a Saturday night. The place was packed. We were a fairly large group (16 people). We had three courses. For appetizer we had a mixture of wings, bread, .... all very tasty and the food was delivered in no time. For main courses I had the flat iron steak with sweet potato hash and greens. Others had a specially prepared vegetarian dish, fried chicken, ... All the food was very tasty and delivered very fast (especially considering that we were 16 people). For deserts most of us tried their banana pudding. A bit heavy and an interesting mixture of sweet and bitter, but overall a great meal. Our server was very busy but had just the right amount of attention. Certainly coming back here next time I am in Charlotte.

barhg3D1jmyzh2jvSbdD-w.text: My first meal in Charlotte and it set the bar REALLY HIGH.  Everything I had was amazing, and I love the whole non-profit, local food thing, proceeds going back into the community.  WIn-win-win.  King's Kitchen is my new go-to place for all friends visiting from out of town.

BFxluORLHIRb3bU7ucFpnw.text: Good southern food and hospitality at a restaurant that supports worthwhile causes. The shrimp and grits was well balanced, and the beet salad was not overpowering. This was my second visit to the King's Kitchen, and it did not disappoint.

pvtfEIs2xrZNVLJPAB6vrg.text: Great atmosphere, nice color scheme,very bright! They have nothing to hide in dim light, their service was attentive and accommodating to a picky eater. Husband and I had the meat and three, flounder(not technically a meat but).., 1.mac&cheese, 2.carrots and 3.potato salad. Nice lightly seasoned batter on the fish and the baked Mac actually had flavor of cheese not just egg and the grilled carrots were so sweet! Husband had Pams brownie, a bit to sweet to me. Giving back to the community always feels great!

qnbWM9W4wOJcCxM4efhxXg.text: Loved the food & ambiance. Everyone was extremely friendly. I will definitely go back over & over again especially since I know the proceeds go towards a good cause!

Cxvi2l4dDYVGtJC6pD5XZA.text: I loved their mission and atmosphere.  The food was some good, some not so good.  The fried chicken was very dry, but the collards, black eyed peas and creamed corn were great!  I love pie, but why do so many restaurants fail at piecrust.  It was uncooked tasting and thick.  Piecrust should be flakey!  So, would I go back? Yes, but would probably order the vegetable plate.  Love what they're doing.

R5FrUHfF2Srkz8dSjtH3Hw.text: King's Kitchen fills many voids in the Charlotte area. First it's a meat & three, which has been long missing since Gus Sir Beef left Latta Arcade years ago.  Second it's a GOOD, upscale meat & three which is part of the Noble family of restaurants (one that even I will enjoy going to). Third it is the most wonderful concept: it is a nonprofit conceived by all proceeds are leveraged to donate to soup kitchens, and other food charities. Beyond that, they employ the otherwise unemployable (formerly incarcerated, rehabilitated, etc.) and are integrating a 40-week job training program to teach life skills. They also hand out box lunches to homeless. There isn't a place like this anywhere around, so I wanted to support this nonprofit even if the food wasn't good. Maybe their motto should be "Do Good, Eat Well" because lucky for me, it was delicious.  They said they have the best pan fried chicken in town, so that's what I tried along with some of the best grits I've had in Charlotte (Anson Mill stoneground grits with some corn kernels), stewed squash and fried green beans. The squash was absolutely delicious, and the beans weren't really what I expected- I thought they might be battered and crispy, but they were possibly stewed and then fried so they were definitely more crispy than stewed, but not crispy crispy. My chicken's breast was very tender inside and I would definitely get that again.  I will refrain from commenting on my husband's pot roast since I never like fatty meat. He said it was tender. He accompanied the roast with mac 'n cheese (good but not plentiful enough), collard greens which were tasty and not too vinegary, and creamed corn which weren't too creamy. He was very pleased as well.  Other meats included fried flounder, grilled chicken breasts and Eegads! chicken livers!! We are in the South, Jules, get over it.  There were several other things to choose from as well as some sandwiches.  Desserts included a banana pudding with a torched meringue top from the pastry chef from Johnson & Wales, a brown sugar pound cake, chocolate pie, coconut chess pie and others.    Service was very friendly, but we got the sense some of the staff was underemployable. Since they've been open only a few days they're still in training mode, but was very encouraged about the friendliness.  Right now they are only open for lunch M-F, but they hope to open for breakfast and eventually dinner as well and are going to play with opening for breakfast/lunch on weekends.  Their spot on Church & Trade has a great spot for outdoor seating but I would understand why they would opt to have it be weekdays only.  My office is right next door, so I will definitely be going again. Probably not every week because I would need to change my nickname to Fat Jules, but definitely every other week, perhaps only with a veggie plate!

kQJltZl-xKJ2o7gepMenwQ.text: I finally had the pleasure of eating here for the first time last week....was blown away. The people are friendly, the food is excellent and what better than being a non-profit organization! Will become a regular of The King's Kitchen.

NJXKwGe55nm6lFSjOhT8IA.text: We went here for my birthday and it was fantastic!  I had the fried chicken, mashed potatoes & gravy, mac & cheese & collard greens.  The hubs had fried fish, mac & cheese, collards and slaw.  We also had the pimento cheese dip and bread and it was amazing.  We were stuffed and had to skip dessert but look forward to trying it soon!

BxrjnqE85vek9MKXtTBn9g.text: I was excited about this place because it supports such a good cause. Unfortunately, I'm not Southern enough to enjoy meat + 2. I got the quarter chicken, mac&cheese and beans. It was ok according to me. I may not come back but sure... I recommend it you're a meat + 3 kinda peeps. It's a for a great cause!

fXYZXwSQGNVPG3KS4Yquzw.text: Nice! I LOVE Southern food and I super love good service.  We came in for dinner on a Monday night and it was just busy enough to not feel weird about eating in an empty restaurant. The outdoor seating looks great, maybe I'll get to try it next time. The decor was lovely, and reminded me of my great grandmother's summer room. The only issue I had environment-wise was that there were TVs; it seems like too classy a place to have those.  Our server was really friendly and helpful, service was great.  The food was great! The server started us out with a biscuit and piece of cornbread each. The biscuits tasted gorgeous. They were JUST a tad drier than I like though. The cornbread was super moist but was not sweet (yes I want cake at dinner). We both got "meat and 3". I got fried chicken, mac & cheese, creamed corn, and mashed potatoes with gravy. Mom got pot roast, mac & cheese, potato salad, and green beans. My chicken was lovely, well cooked and not too dry. I would have liked a little bit of heat (a bit more pepper) before calling it perfect. The mac & cheese was good, it was baked and not the saucy kind (but not the good custard-like stuff you can cut into squares). It was very nice, if a bit oily/greasy. The creamed corn was wonderful. It tasted like it had been on a fresh cob about 30 minutes (I'm guessing at how long it takes to cook it to that nice consistency) before I got it. The mashed potatoes were very nice, although I would have preferred a brown gravy to the cream (I actually ordered them for my mom to eat with her pot roast). The green beans are listed as "fried" on the menu, but the server said they're actually stewed (with I think he said bacon, but I'm not sure). The beans needed "stringing" but my mom said they were really good. She loved the potato salad and considered trying to order a pint of it to go. I guess the pot roast was ok, I didn't taste it and she didn't say anything about it either way. It definitely looked good.  Sadly we didn't get dessert because we were full. I really want to try some chocolate pie though, yom!  They also have a decent-sized wine list. I don't drink though so I really have no idea if it's good or not. If they add spoon bread they will have a regular customer in my mom; she can't find it anywhere and how can you get more Southern than spoon bread? (The souffle kind, if your chef is reading this, KK! Not corn pudding, although that would be good too.) I'm leaving NC to move to TX so I'm glad I got to visit this restaurant before I left. I wish I could come back soon but that'll have to wait another year...

NhPGKtmqPzOsdALQCj1v3w.text: Wonderful. Very flavorful, very interesting preparations, good ambience. Heirloom tomatoes were fantastic, fantastic locally sourced ingredients. The food tastes even better knowing the good that is being done thru this establishment.

abjmvmodc-2smMa1ddPeaw.text: Great Mac and Cheese, however, the stewed tomatoes were a little bland and the fried chicken wasn't the best I've ever had.

iKTthIizSIEPcBq-C37P5Q.text: super sweet feel-feels very home-y.  I love the fact all proceeds go to non profits and helping others!  Had the fried green tomatoes, fried chicken (dark meat), mac and cheese, collard greens, creamed corn, and pecan pie.  its really delicious!  definitely hit the spot of what I was looking for.... Coming from SF, it was a really great first southern meal.

P3h57xleeO3dIwx1oncPSA.text: I was in Charlotte for a weekend trip with my family.  We ate dinner here based on the good reveiws and were not disappointed.  The service was fantastic and the food was the absolute best!  I had the fried flounder and my brother had the grilled salmon.  He travels the world and said it was the best salmon he ever had.  Everything tasted fresh and flavored just like a home cooked meal.  I would love to go back and have the shrimp and grits!  If you are looking for a great place to eat, don't skip the King's Kitchen.  It's also a non-profit restaurant that helps feed the hungry...cool!!

_L4Hubo7e7wI5J3FB4VihQ.text: Great food, fantastic service! I was not surprised considering the founder and his history in Charlotte. The fried chicken was amazing. The only reason I didn't go with five stars was because the veggies were a little too salty for my taste.

VCDBTa8MBWcUP3WoIXl6Sg.text: This place was awesome!! the food was delicious, the ambience was nice and the service was great, all with reasonably priced food. I went very recently with a group of 6 friends, and they accommodated nicely. The restaurant is a non-profit in which 100% of the profits goes to help the local needy and those making a trasition in their lives. Check them out and I'm sure you will love as my friends and I

sfRSqDXlZ5P8G4TFOYDgIA.text: I really enjoyed this place.  I did not have high expectations, but the food is quite good.  I am a fan of the meat and three menu, and the portions are good.  The sandwiches, however, are huge.  The service is also quite good, and our server remembered me from over a week ago when I returned a second time.  I am also a fan of the fact the restaurant supports philanthropic efforts.  Would definitely recommend.

KWG5yWxvCuKf0ySG1lGQBg.text: We stopped here while on a road trip. Great southern fresh home-cooked food, great service, money goes to a good cause. Wonderful! PS.don't pass on the banana pudding.IT is not far off the highway if you are driving, for example, between Georgia and Florida.

ZRbFbbJOysBa5LhZAY1kWA.text: I dined here for a friends birthday dinner.  I have driven past this place numerous times and I was excited to finally try King's Kitchen.  However, I wish I would have kept on driving by it.  The service was absolutely awful!!!!!!!!!!!!!!   SLOW SLOW SLOW!!!  If I am paying almost $10 for a glass of wine I do not want to wait 15 minutes to receive it.  Furthermore, I was not a fan of the food...I felt as if the chief's pairing of ingredients did not go well together.

nXsKi5o2Xl64hbFc6gLQRQ.text: I really wanted to give this place 5 stars because I love what they stand for, but it is a restaurant after all and the food/service is very important.  The food is why I had to lower my rating. I went with 3 friends.  I ordered scallops, everyone else ordered the fried chicken, salmon, and pot roast.  First off, our service was SLOOOOW.  Took a long time to order/get our drinks and order food.  Waiter never once checked on us after our meal arrived to find out if everything was ok. He just dropped the check when we were done and then took his sweet time taking care of the bill. When our meals arrived, I was appalled that I only got 3, really small scallops and the tinest scooping of zucchini/tomato ever.  For $22, I expected more. The scallops were well prepared and tasty but about the size of a quarter. The zucchini/tomato mix was severely overcooked mush and I only got one-half of a grape tomato. The corn bread was VERY dry.   Salmon was prepared well, but again a very small portion.  Pot roast was dry and small portions. The only person that enjoyed her meal, and didn't leave hungry was the one that got fried chicken.

1KYQT_cPiJZ5jJqv1JwUvg.text: Love this place. Good cause, good prices, generous portions.

sE1wnLGxIWChryBQcesNzg.text: My second visit. I remember the first visit from about a year ago was good (not great) and this time cemented the deal.  I had the arugula and goat cheese salad, which arrived minus the goat cheese.  Ok, that got fixed.  I ordered the salmon for dinner.  It arrived, a very small piece of fish (~5 ounces?) served in a pool of cream sauce that was devoid of any particular flavor. There were no vegetables, no sides, no nothin.  And 5ounces of fish.  And all for $22.  Sooo not worth it!  And the menu hadn't changed in the year between visits.  The only reason I went for 3'stars is that the server was very good (Dave).  I won't be returning.

YGVPUtsdZG-TKDnFLSDT7Q.text: Well I was looking for something in Charlotte that was the real deal in NC. I found The King's Kitchen and decided to go for it. The best part it was a not for profit that went to feed the homeless. After fighting all the road construction we made it there. We had a hard time making a left turn with all the road work. The restaurant was very clean and the personnel were pleasant. My wife had a zucchini appetizer and I had the pot roast dinner. The food was cafeteria quality, edible but nothing to return for. The dinner cost me $45 dollars. They use the restaurant to train people and feed the poor. The 3 stars are strictly for the food.  It's a great venue doing good for the community.

EemeDkk0m0UNvXgH8hWC5w.text: Delicious! Made reservations for 8:30pm through Open Table on a Saturday night. We were greeted and seated immediately. The restaurant was a bit slow, but this was the Saturday before Christmas. Most of Charlotte seemed to have left already. The restaurant is casual, open, and spacious.  Our server greeted us shortly after being seated. She was wonderful! She was quick and knowledgeable. My SO and I tried the following: Beet salad - $6 Tomato bisque (cup) - $4 Bread - complimentary Seared scallops - $22 Trout (seasonal special) - $20+ Sticky toffee pudding cake with vanilla bean gelato - $10  The tomato bisque was creamy, but not heavy. The beet salad was refreshing. I was a bit disappointed when my scallop entree arrived. I knocked off a star because the portion was a bit small, especially for the price. It came with 4 small to medium sized scallops and a handful of veggies on the side. Regardless, they were absolutely delicious! I was scraping my plate in less than five minutes. I was still hungry. My SO could tell and tried to offer me more of his dish. The trout entree on the other hand, was significantly bigger than mine. It was perfectly crispy on the outside and full of flavor on the inside. For the dessert, the sticky toffee pudding is to die for!!! It was heaven in my mouth. My SO saw my face light up after the first couple of bites and decided to let me finish the rest of the dessert. I could have easily eaten five of those! After the dessert, I was finally full.  We appreciate the message and mission of the restaurant. We cannot wait to return!

fQdqP3NQmzNwVg6jUH9fNg.text: Everything was excellent here! Authentic flavors made me alllllllllmost feel like i was eating my grandmother's south eastern GA cooking again. Ill totally come back next time im in town!

Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried chicken

tz6xvZ1UIHPkrEn8mrI5Tw.text: First time in Charlotte and were craving some tasty Southern comfort food.  This place did not disappoint.  Fried oysters appetizer didn't last long on our table.  Half Beet salad was also very good.  You have to have the Shrimp & Grits.  We also had the fried chicken and the scallops.  Collard greens side was so good we ordered another.  Black eyed peas and mac and cheese were also tasty.   Very nice atmosphere with excellent service.  We will eat here again if we are back in Charlotte and will try the fried catfish, which is supposed to be great.

PaNss-cXzlTSSi378kdQbQ.text: Okay, if I could give King's Kitchen 10 stars for the food, service, and atmosphere last Tuesday I would! I've been here before and would have told you that it was good. Well last Tuesday they were on FIRE! It was GREAT!!!! We made reservations for a group of about 30 and what a fantastic job they did accommodating our large party. We pre-ordered selections and dined family style. The food was LIT as the young people say. The service was absolutely fantastic and the the overall atmosphere was warm and inviting, allowing our large party to relax and enjoy the company. Put all of that together with the overall mission of King's Kitchen, which I love, and you have the makings of the perfect evening! Thank you, King's Kitchen!

yR4pd5r6sCO7w-KL35_iJQ.text: The service is great, the waiters are extremely helpful and attentive without being overbearing and they're all very polite and personable. Really nice portions. I had the catfish with mashed potatoes, collard greens and Mac & cheese. The catfish was huge and cooked sooo perfectly with the right amount of crunch on  the outside. The Mac & cheese was amazing my cheesy and the collards were seasoned very well. Our food came out in a decent amount of time, we didn't wait long at all from the time we ordered to the time the food hit the table.   I'll definitely be returning for another southern reminder of my moms home cooked meals.
