Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Aunt Beaut &#39;s Pan Fried Chicken, Collard Greens, Mac&amp;Cheese, Black Eyed Peas, biscuit

GTeQQ_CzQm-XEIhbZuVPJA.text: Our first time in Charlotte and someone recommended The King's Kitchen. The service was excellent and the food was superb. My husband and I had the pimento cheese to start. It is a very healthy portion and tastes yummy. My husband had the pot roast and I had the shrimp and grits. Both were fabulous. I would definitely recommend it.

0xE7TPWWrwA54DUv_0LYFQ.text: Awesome place where part of your meal goes towards feeding the homeless. I'll be visiting Charlotte next month and plan on stopping in for dinner. I had some collard greens, mac and cheese, corn bread and roasted chicken. Excellent service and reasonably priced.

4HtvSy9EqgDEtbsvS0OzqA.text: My Wife & I grab some dinner here and loved the food! The menu is always changing and the staff is great! I love the concept of this place!

ES98FFW9J3GihHgSklzYWQ.text: We loved this restaurant.  During our trip to North Carolina, we googled and yelped best restaurants to visit and this one was the first one.  The food was delicious beyond words!  Service was great!  Awesome to know that this restaurant helps those in need... so what we pay actually feeds those who are in need .  We believe in God and in helping those who are less fortunate no-matter what their own story is.   We had good food, and we left here very satisfied!   We will come back when we return for our next visit !

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. When you walk in this is what you see!
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Thank You !  We loved our food, front desk and server was great!  Delicious food!  Best food ever!!
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Amazing Food!!!  We def. recommend it!  Our first time in North Carolina! Very satisfied

dK6uEBcl3NRHgTuU9y5Nfg.text: In my search for southern cuisine while visiting Charlotte, I came across this place and decided to book a table based on the positive reviews. Their mission, unapologetic Christian ambience and delicious foods was well worth the visit. If you're visiting this town, this is definite worth checking out. I booked via Open Table with no issues!

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

yBrZfSfoN-GAX6jYEea4sA.text: After walking by this place countless times, we finally decided to give it a try. Inside of the restaurant is clean and modern, with a bar centered in the middle. I didn't ask, but it appears that there are no soft drinks, and I didn't see anyone drinking tea, just water (which is what we had) and beer/wine.   We got the Sweet Potato fritters with sorghum butter to start and it was impressive. Great fry on the fritters and a sweet, rich flavoring on the butter.  My entree was full of flavor but had many technical errors. I got the Fried Chicken platter with Mac & Cheese, Sauteed Mushrooms, and Green Beans. Chicken was just slightly overcooked with dry meat, I did choose the white meat instead of the dark, which probably would have been more forgiving moisture-wise, but I expected a finer attention to detail from a restaurant specializing in southern cooking. Mushrooms were very flavorful but perhaps placed in a very cold bowl because they were lukewarm while the rest of my food was hot. Green beans were full of flavor, perfectly seasoned, but very stringy. My girlfriends shrimp and grits were outstanding, I kinda wish I had gotten the same thing!   Had I gotten this meal anywhere else it probably would have been close to a 4 star review, but as a self-proclaimed Southern Kitchen, I expected these fundamental dishes to be perfect, especially 1 block away from Trade & Tryon. I'll be back and at least I know what to look for on the next visit.  As a non-profit, they have a noble cause, which you can read more of on other reviews!

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Chicken Plate
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and Grits, tasty!
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. The bar and seating nearby.

ePKUhLa1etArn9N3vz-DHg.text: While in town for a work trip, I was given the opportunity to select the location for dinner. I love to support local businesses and try to avoid chains whenever possible. My colleague gave me a few options, including The King's Kitchen. She explained to me that the concept of this restaurant is upscale southern home cookin' with a twist-most of the staff are looking to get out of rough situations or improve their skill set so they are more marketable in the workforce. I was sold on the idea!  The service was friendly, although I could tell it was a little out of the comfort zone of our server. But I give him 5 stars for effort and dedication! Keep it up, my friend.  As for the food-I got the pot roast and it was amazing! The entire experience was great and I'd love the change to support them again if I find myself in Charlotte.

xXcrk-tiyfvLJS-MNNKqpQ.text: Oh my God, scrumptious and hmmmm, were the only words that can be heard from me as we sat down to enjoy lunch at the King's Kitchen. It's been awhile since I've been here, and never at lunch always at dinner time but the King's Kitchen did not disappoint. While my friend enjoyed the kale salad, I dove headfirst into the NC catfish platter, with sides of collard greens, macaroni and cheese, and cream corn, and oh yes cornbread.   The catfish was scrumptious, lightly breaded and fried just right, simply delightful and went down very quickly. The Mac and cheese were nearly homemade and the collard greens for out of this world. In addition to the mission of King's Kitchen, being a not-for-profit run restaurant that does great work in the community, they also do a great service to the stomach. Service here was excellence, The Waitresses extraordinarily attentive and we had our food in record time.  King's Kitchen is a must-stop when uptown Charlotte.

n1ahE6tewh8Lia5BVvr8DA.text: I'm not sure if I should begin by raving about the mission or the food of this restaurant. Long story short, they are a non-profit business that provides job training, meals, and a church service to the homeless and those in need. I'm not a super religious person, but helping people in need is so amazing, you can't help but support it. There are religious references throughout the restaurant, so if that bothers you, you've been given a heads up.  You need to make a reservation if you plan on going on the weekend. Hubs and I went on a Friday night, and waited about 20 minutes to sit at the bar which we didn't mind. We both got a glass of riesling which was delicious and reasonably priced. The menu is good, ol' southern comfort food, so we ordered the fried chicken plate. It comes with 3 sides of your choice for about $15 which is very reasonable. There are nicer, but more expensive items on the menu. The food was absolutely delicious. Hubs is typically a picky eater and he loved everything.  The atmosphere is romantic and comfortable, clean and nicely decorated. There is no private parking since it's in uptown, but there are garages and street parking nearby. We will definitely return in the future!

Fkjsn9QNgkQmOcB2llDSQg.text: Checked out this spot by recommendation of friends that live in Charlotte. While the food was not spectacular the service was outstanding and is what earned this trendy spot 4  stars! Fried chicken was dry and all my sides were lukewarm. However the catfish and fries were hot and tasty. The Mac and Cheese was stellar and the collards were seasoned just right (tang and sweet). I was most impressed with the customer service. Hostess greeted and seated us immediately. The manager checked on our table during the meal and when I gave feedback on the meal he was genuine and appreciative. Even our server was attentive and thoughtful, apologizing when he forgot to bring a condiment. Overall I would return the dining experience alone made quite an impression.  TIP: Choose biscuits over cornbread!

XxTS7LCZGEO8B-z2O1zPdw.text: The food at The King's Kitchen is absolutely divine! The crab cake was probably the best I've ever had. We loved everything we ordered and can't wait to go back. It's great to support a local restaurant that pours so much back into the community they serve.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

IDpSn9GQB8yA9RsFLGrcrw.text: Service was excellent and so was the food. Macaroni and cheese is phenomenal and so was the desert, the homemade carrot cake. The main dish, chicken was OK but not as good as the side. Also the cornbread was dry but the biscuits were delicious.

8f3H-EWM9yw5ukUgvQuNYA.text: I was staying at the Holiday Inn a few blocks from here and I was recommended The King's Kitchen by the front desk staff. I got in at about 8pm on a Saturday night and was looking for my first taste of southern food. The King's Kitchen was the perfect choice for the evening. It was a quick walk from my hotel and I was seated immediately at the bar for a late dinner.   To start off I ordered Duck-Rabbit Milk Stout, I loved it, it's a full bodied stout brewed with milk sugar... great local beer. For dinner I opted for Aunt Beaut's Pan Fried Chicken dark meat, which came with a biscuit and a choice of 3 sides so I went with collard greens, mac and cheese, green beans. The fried chicken was great - crispy and savory skin and super tender dark meat. All the sides were great as well - collard greens were bomb, mac and cheese was super creamy, and the green beans had a nice flavor to them as well. The buttery biscuit was good too but I was too stuffed from all the other goodies to finish it.   Not only was the food and drinks delicious, the mission behind The King's Kitchen is just the cherry on top. It's a not for profit establishment that donates 100% of it's profits to feed the poor in Charlotte. The staff are Charlotte residents that have suffered from life-challenges such as poverty, homelessness, or incarceration. Loved everything about this place, I would highly recommend it if you're ever in Uptown Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pan fried chicken, collard greens, Mac and cheese, green beans, and butter biscuit

sr6Ktoc2qBAJ27lYuLUS5w.text: I have to say I was less than impressed after reading some great reviews and coming in with high hopes for King's Kitchen. Every time I'd be in town, I'd miss their open hours since they close early, but I got lucky this particular Thursday where they were open a little later than during the rest of the week. The venue is nice and open with a small private party room off to the left and friendly staff to greet you. It does offer a nice open bar area with open seating and table service, depending on which one would prefer. But the important part of the whole experience comes down to the food. I started off with the bartender recommended fried oysters. They were a bit dry and inconsistent, however the achilles heel was all the shell fragments that were fried with the oyster. Either they weren't shucked properly or just a matter of bad hands going from shell to batter to oil. I fought through 2 of those before I pushed that away. Moved on to the dinner portion and asked between the fried chicken and the salmon. I was recommended the salmon and again, maybe it was just the recommendation that did me wrong? The salmon had a funny texture to it, meaning it was likely frozen and quick thawed before being cooked. It did have a good flavor but the texture was definitely off. What made the dish bad was that it was served on what I would call a bed of shoe-string fries. With salmon, I was hoping for a nice steamed vegetable or greens of some sort to cut what is typically a fatty fish, but very odd combination. I did opt for dessert which was the banana cream and that was pretty awesome served in a mason jar that gives the idea to make it at home and create a dangerous portable snack. Overall, maybe my menu selections were bad and this was an off night, but considering the other numerous options around downtown I'd pass on this one.

AIzO7xAm2qPZO5ESi0Jygg.text: Excellent food and service. Had the scallops they were wonderful. We sat at the bar had a local beer and appetizers, try fried oysters!

Sgzww4ImRxDIJBMWauQM3g.text: If you're looking for good southern food, this is the place to go, but you must also be looking to splurge a little bit, because the prices are a little on the high side. I didn't learn until after I had eaten here that this was a non-profit organization, which is cause enough for me to return. The food was really delicious. The sweet potato fritters with honey were a nice twist from a usual appetizer. I couldn't even take a picture of my entree because just as soon as it arrived I started to indulge. I ordered the pot roast which was very juicy and tender (recommended) and my friend ordered the pork chop which was decent. The mashed potatoes are a great side, especially if you get the pot roast. The roast juices mixed with the potatoes are a divine combination.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sweet potato fritters with honey

DFMx7kkyXvlhHLxQDCmrmw.text: We were in town for the day and just decided to try this place out.  This restaurant was amazing! The food was fresh authentic southern food....it was just so delicious!   Would come back in a heartbeat!

y1mwg3pzPOlx7vGSPGaT8Q.text: Somewhere between 3 and 4 stars.  Nothing was bad, so I will go with 4.  In town for business and wanted something casual/quiet and this was great.  While there is a bar and an outdoor seating area if that is what you want, I was able to get a table for 1 far enough away to just sit and read.  I got the fried chicken which OK.  Nothing amazing, but it did have a nice thin crust that was not over powering.  I was almost out the door for $20 when the desert special of fresh bread pudding caught my eye.  They say it takes 20 minutes and it was a good 20-30 min, so if you are interested either order it early or be prepared to wait.  It was incredibly rich and fresh, no complaints.  I only have a sample size of one meal and I enjoyed it, it just didn't blow me away.

5187vl-sDf6dG-t0sHkFlw.text: This place is everything that is right with America.   We were in town for a weekend and stopped in King's Kitchen because it was right across the street from our hotel. Boy were we in for a surprise.... Every part of this meal was delicious. From the drinks, pimento cheese, and mashed potatoes, to the chicken and green beans, it was to die for.   If this were my last meal I wouldn't be disappointed at all.

oUhGuoscerEHRIYK7KPr3Q.text: I loved the BBQ chicken - mac and cheese - black eyed peas and the biscuits are Devine! The portions are a little small which made me wanting more!   The service was spotty and she kept forgetting things ~  The atmosphere is trendy and fun.

0Y8pJ9FpTwc94LTNSK5-YQ.text: What I was looking for southern food and went somewhere else that was recommended and left!!   This is a honey hole! Good black eye peas, collard greens, and green beans like Gma cooked.  The beer was cold, so I was all set.  I will return.

iToZ_2PxF0bdqjRCOitiLw.text: The food was good, but more than anything I loved the service. We had a waiter named Stuart who was so helpful in making suggestions and was totally patient with us. Most of my table ordered the tomato bisque and enjoyed it as well as the fried chicken with the various vegetable sides. The fries and mac and cheese were delicious!

7qukCuN-ktjSP2KplRrHtA.text: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Epicenter for 4 days and yelped a few restaurants around the area...we decided to try Kings Kitchen for lunch one day because they had previously good reviews.  Our lunch was perfect, and so was the service. We went for lunch on a Wednesday around 2:15, they informed us that they feed the homeless every Monday-Thursday for lunch. Which makes this restaurant even more enjoyable.  We decided to go back for dinner on our last night in town and it was unexpectedly even better than our lunch.  The vibe of the restaurant has a very welcoming feel, the servers are wonderful and remembered us right away.  I recommend this place over all the restaurants we tried in Charlotte. Not only is the food perfect, so are the employees. Thank you Kings Kitchen!

O6U5Yx4U_KULfwGLCif1Kg.text: Great home cooked food!  If you are looking for southern cooking may your way there. Fried chicken was delicious and excellent sides.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried chicken!

IQpC4jJaY9xcK7gors-Tyw.text: A Southern kitchen on a local mission - and my new favorite place in Charlotte! The story behind the King's Kitchen is very heartwarming, and the food is absolutely incredible. I'd recommend arriving fairly early for dinner, especially if you're with a large group. It fills up pretty quickly! All of our entrees were amazing, you really can't go wrong here. The sweet potato fritters and southern style mac n cheese are definitely a must!

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Charming entrance by the bakery

7kFwEAjBTKpayKKTkiGf9g.text: Great, quick, HUGE lunch. Friendly service with an even better cause. 100% non profit, providing food and community to the homeless in Charlotte. Can't find this too often!

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

QxeJWS2wXeWaun3cVcQ9fQ.text: My husband and I went over Memorial Day weekend and had a great meal. Their sides are classic southern foods. Note: they are a Christian restaurant so they choose not to serve alcohol aside from beer and wine. I value their integrity! Meals are very reasonably priced for their location! Great indoor and outdoor atmosphere!

7CO6FjCN9YMACM4fydZiEg.text: The server and manager were so friendly and welcoming. Went for dinner with friend in town and family and sat outside patio. They said they were busy but we were seated and served really quickly anyway. My husband had the pot roast and loved it; friend said pork chop was wonderful and my salmon was really good. Daughter was disappointed with the pan fried chicken. Thought it would be a lot more flavor-ful. Needed more spces and not so fried. Nice place in Charlotte. Should try if you like Southern food

6q_EhDFa1eoWC2fhwhTBJQ.text: Awesome food and service.  A great restaurant with a great mission.  The tomato soup was great.  The porkchop and sides were very good.  Apple pie for dessert.    Enjoyed the corn bread.  Definitely a place to go back to if in town.

7sc9egic2mXgRVbHyxAl8A.text: So impressed with just about everything here.  The concept is so wonderful, and such a blessing to see that "unemployable" people are trained and given the opportunity to work well with the public.  Grilled Meatloaf was top notch and the sides were all so good and properly prepared.  Local stout on draft tied the entire meal together.  Bravo, and God Bless this place!

vEPMPlvPdbG6liTEr5N9Og.text: I like this restaurant. The concept is great and the mission of giving back to the community is something I can get behind. The have excellent fried chicken. Their lunchtime fried chicken sandwich is delicious. Their sides are great - the creamed corn is wonderful. I have found the entire staff friendly and on point with their service.

u8NDED3X_N59Y-9tNSefGQ.text: It doesn't look busy, but then again who knows what's going on in the back.  My friend and I ordered about 30 minutes ago and we are waiting... Still waiting...  The waiter seemed really busy.  He took our order and I tried to order an appetizer, but took off before I could ask.  I've never been here before, so maybe this is the normal wait time? Who knows...  The waiter is nice and the Arnold Palmer is delicious so far.  Oh and the water here, superb!  Maybe I'll revise this later when I see/taste/smell the food.  If I don't revise, that means I walked out.  I don't have time to wait much longer for food.

GfRyZm9UyQaYCfvugwjcBQ.text: I would describe this as upscale southern and dangerously good! We had dinner here last Friday and had a great time. The food and service was great and we chatted with our neighboring table that happened to be a family that moved from California to NC.   I ordered the fried chicken ($14) and it came with three sides, so I went with the mac and cheese, collard greens, and green beans. Even though I know how collard greens are prepared, I was trying to trick my body into thinking that I was eating semi-healthy by ordering some veggies. lol. The fried chicken did not disappoint and the collard greens were the best that I've ever had (second only to the homemade greens made by my friend, Earl). I'm pretty sure it was cooked with the most flavorful bacon fat! :p   My bf ordered the fried flounder ($17) and he chose mac and cheese, creamed potatoes and gravy, and creamed corn. The flounder was good but I was going bananas over the potatoes and corn! Take a scoop of the potatoes and a little of the corn on your fork and YUM! Heavenly! Speaking of bananas, we decided to have the banana pudding ($5) for dessert. It came in a drinking glass and was topped with toasted marshmallow. We usually share a dessert but I think next time I want my own. lol! It was so good! It was nicely chilled and super creamy but with a few chunks of banana and hints of vanilla. I think it had some graham cracker crumbs or cookie crumbs for texture as well. Whatever it was, it added to the loveliness of this dish.  And then there's the concept that I absolutely love. It is a not-for-profit restaurant that gives back by feeding the hungry and helping people get back/stay on their feet. I talked to Jake (our waiter who was excellent!) about the mission of the restaurant before we left and he also gave me a piece of paper that explained everything. I'll be in town for a couple more months and I will gladly spend my money at KK, not just for the excellent food, but to contribute to a wonderful cause.   Photos taken: meals noted in review plus banana pudding and view from the street.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Street view of King&#39;s Kitchen
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana pudding ($5) Yum!
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried flounder with creamed corn, creamed potatoes with gravy, and mac and cheese ($17)

rNCVBH1XacCWECNOnORTFg.text: This is a great place for dinner!! Classy atmosphere, good location, attentive and friendly waitstaff and fresh food. I would definitely recommend this place and I would absolutely come back!! Indoor and outdoor seating available, which was a plus.

unVhNyvbe2G4_xDwX7ruZA.text: The King's Kitchen moto speaks volumes....    "Where you FEAST TO FEED SOMEBODY.  We're a not for profit restaurant serving up southern cuisine made with fresh, local ingredients from right here in our community. And the proceeds go back to the community, helping to feed those in need. So, come on in. Because when you dine, the whole community thrives."   This is what we had on our first visit....Pimiento Cheese with House Crackers, Deviled Eggs, Grandma Bennon's Pot Roast (falling off the bone good!), Mac & Cheese, Butter Beans, & Coconut Chess Pie!    YES, I LOVE TO EAT!!!  :)  NEED I SAY MORE???  Go support this great restaurant!  Chef Jim Noble (Noble's and Rooster's) is the mastermind behind it!

lZpziK7kxO5LNUM7B8j4aw.text: Catfish cheese grits and stewed tomatoes yummy. Organization offering inspiring job training and support in a surprisingly upscale, confident restaurant package. Great ambiance, large outdoor terrace wraps around on two sides.  Right in downtown Charlotte.  Eat here!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Catfish cheese grits and stewed tomatoes
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Catfish cheese grits and stewed tomatoes
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried catfish cheese grits and stewed tomatoes

LT3bT9C_YrwCwWE-vjjIYw.text: While the food may not be as good as one could hope, I will always choose this as the number one place for lunch downtown because of the AWESOME work they are doing giving folks a second chance.  Hooray for The Kings Kitchen

3N5JRPIPzsMuqFW4guFp8A.text: This restaurant offers something I dont think I have ever come across (take note Los Angeles) but its a non profit restaurant offering many soulful dishes and in very warming, yet upscale setting and the cornbread is delicious.   I had the chicken breast plate. the breast was small proportion BUT delicious and very satisfying. I was too hungry anyways so it worked well The mac n cheese has a nice spice to it as well.   Go here and don't die!!

m_N0JlbPtqf7wtMYpkxICw.text: Came for breakfast and it was pretty much as expected. Would recommend getting clarification on dishes. My wife ordered the parfait and the seasonal fruit ended up being apples. The Awaken Hash was well prepared but I didn't expect so many sweet potatoes. Quality and mission combined = really good place to eat.

c_z8FkjQxPUhxH4bCBFVcw.text: I love the concept of farm to table, but the food still needs to be prepared right.  Went in a large party with a fixed menu.  I tried the fried flounder and the breading was overpowering in seasoning more like a fried chicken batter.   I was disappointed.  There was only one server for 28 people.    The cornbread was brought out burnt.   The sides were OK.  The other members of my party that had the pot roast were more satisfied.

Nph3FGXGSWshkrQ8kYzmXw.text: Couldn't have been better. Had pot roast with three sides, collard greens, fried green beans and black eyed peas. All gluten free! The sauce on the pot roast was fantastic and I can't have a lot of sauces. The staff was great too. I'm traveling for work and they gave me info on the area.

4AMXt1aQMukhhATDwm-mTA.text: I've been on the fence about trying this place since they opened and finally decided to give them a try. I've heard mixed reviews about the seasoning of the meats to the veggies being eh, so here is what I think. I love that they're profits go to feeding the homeless.....major kudos for that concept! At the recommendation of my waiter, I had flounder, mac n cheese, corn, and greens........not bad, not bad at all. They also serve cornbread while you wait, but be warned if you're used to your cornbread being sweet, you may want to pass but it wasn't that bad. The flounder was very crisp and light served with some of the best tarter I think I've ever had. The corn was absolutely delish.....I mean my meal could have been a plate of corn and I would have been just fine! I'm not sure why they call it creamed corn, because what I had was definitely fried corn where I'm from. The collards were very tender, but had vinegar in the mix, which I am not a fan so I'll leave it at that. I wasn't expecting the mac n cheese to pass my taste test but to my surprise it was a winner. Very good meal overall......4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Flounder, Mac n cheese, greens, and corn
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cornbread

PTw6d9-8Te3hw5OQxZNZDg.text: While in town for business we tried Kings. The salmon was incredible! By far the best I have had in some time.

qZm96GKHMfWGDn0JlaWWaQ.text: We were visiting Charlotte for a couple of days and were relying heavily on Yelp to lead the charge for dining - but this time it let us down.    The Bad: I'm not sure if we were there on an off night or what (quite possible when looking at photos from other reviewers) - but the food just wasn't good.  Given the reviews - we were very surprised.  We started with cornbread and biscuits for the table - they had little flavor and were so heavy and greasy that when we ordered our meal we said no thanks to the bread option.  I ordered fried chicken w/ mac&chs, butter beans & collards.  The greens were good - but that was pretty much it.  The chicken was dry, the mac&cheese had the same old-oil taste the bread had and the butter beans were okay for being out of a can, but nothing special.  A friend order a Salmon special and she said that was good so I wish I had ordered that instead.    The Good:  Service was good.  Attentive and friendly server took care of us.  The premise behind the restaurant is fabulous - giving back to the community.  But I would have rather given my $$ directly to their cause than spent it on the food.

TRWU18GwYnwF_4eP9uOcVA.text: I loved my experience! I have a gluten allergy and used to understanding every restaurant won't be able to accommodate me. This was an amazing experience! I loved my garlic chicken and they even allowed me to substitute some fresh kale! Amazing price and AMAZING service! Thank you Stuart for the great rest stop!

DrdcuWN3tX9-hlxZakoaMw.text: This was our first time in Charlotte and this restaurant. We must say that the food was excellent and beyond our expectations, mainly because the southern cuisine taste and style of cooking was prevalent in all dishes which we were seeking coming from ny as tourists. The fried chicken, mac cheese, potato gravy, and steak were all very well made and all in southern style of cooking. The portions are not too small or big but I would stay away from appetizers if you get heavier entrees like chicken or steak. The restaurant gets packed fast so you can either go early like we did at 6pm for dinner or make reservations. Clean, tasty food at good ambience restaurant. Well worth the trip and very reasonable prices.

IAPYlttDoudq1-9CohCBoA.text: Oh man, the food here is amazing!!!  Chicken and dumplings were awesome and different (dumplings were actually biscuit balls fried like a hushpuppy).  My friends both got the dark meat friend chicken and collard greens and both said it was the best they've ever had.  The only disappointment was the pimento cheese dip which was flavorless super soupy white liquid with a pepper stuck on top.  I'm pretty sure there was no cheddar in this at all, and there wasn't even enough cheese to make it taste like cheese!  Tasted like eating warm milk on stale bread pieces.  Luckily the chicken and friendly service (shout out to Charity!) made up for it.

5LTAXrds2Z5HUB9wiGIg1g.text: I thought this location might be cursed, with the quick demise of its previous inhabitants, a tapas bar and then a Harper's.  So, I'm very happy to see that the King's Kitchen has been going strong for over a year.  The food and service here are very good. I typically opt for the veggie plate (delicious mac and cheese and greens), but I'm also a fan of the white-meat fried chicken, and I have a friend who swears by the pot roast. The deserts are definitely a weak spot--the banana pudding tastes instant and the chess pie wasn't very good either.  But you go here for the entrees, not the deserts, so that's forgivable.  As many have noted, the restaurant has a positive social message, which makes it easier to tolerate the high prices for what is, in essence, extremely cheap Southern soul food (I grew up on these delicious artery-clogging recipes, so I feel that I can say this with some authority).  This type of food is neither difficult nor expensive to make. But, since I'm not making it at home and this place does a good job of it, I'll have to put myself down as a fan.  I would recommend going here for lunch rather than dinner because the lunch prices are cheaper and the portion-sizes for both meals seem to be about the same.

yQtjwOcYj696Btd1gVjCSw.text: I really like this place. It has a really great vibe and I love supporting the community while getting great food! I highly recommend the friend flounder, collard greens & mac & cheese. delish!

3stnsRDusQJct7xDaRkZkg.text: I've been to King's Kitchen several times for lunch, and am really pleased with the food, service, and prices.  While the fried chicken with gravy is good, I'm a huge fan of the meatloaf.  They prepare it so uniquely - after baking it, they slice it into large pieces and grill it to add crisp.  It's really delicious with the mashed potatoes and mac and cheese (double order of that, of course)!  The cornbread and biscuits that you get before your meal are also out of this world.  Lately, they have gotten busier for lunch, and I suggest you go early.  It's definitely worth a wait, however!

5C0NsOAnqur2ZCyk-hcQtw.text: Delicious Southern food! The calories might make you feel a bit guilty but knowing that you're dining for a good cause will wash the guilt away pretty quickly.  Enjoy the local specials, the amazing mac and cheese, collard greens, and spicy gumbo, and then enjoy the fact that your money is going to help local folks who are less fortunate. Win-win.

Afz6baY54axqxYC8lrWvIg.text: I really wanted to give this place a better rating, I really did.  The food at King's Kitchen is amazing (though a tiny bit pricey) and the restaurant seems to have a really great purpose.  However, after the treatment we got on our anniversary I doubt I'd ever go back.  My husband and I went to the restaurant to celebrate eleven years of marriage.  We were expecting a special event, especially after reading all the glowing reviews.  What we got was a waitress who treated us like dirt, while treating her only other table at the time like old friends.    We sat at our table, and when we saw a woman roll her eyes as she stared our way I whispered to my husband "Oh man.  I hope she's not our waitress.  She looks like she hates us already!"  Lucky us, here she came.  She said nothing about specials, gave us no suggestions, had to come back to hear our drink orders TWICE, and all we ordered was tea.  And ten minutes later, when a couple of women sat in her section across from us, we got the jealous privilege of watching her gush all over these ladies, telling them in detail the specials and what came with them, which dishes were good and even telling one of the women to try a dish she had told five minutes earlier me was SOLD OUT.  What?  And while our appetizer sat on the counter where we could see it, she held a ten-minute conversation with these ladies about the conference they were attending and oh my gosh, we're all from the same hometown?  What a coincidence!  Let's talk some more!  After that the loud PLUNK as our appetizer was carelessly thrown on our table was audible throughout the restaurant.  Before we could even request a refill on our tea, she was gone, back to finish the conversation our appie had so rudely interrupted.  We didn't get our food for forty minutes, during which time we got to watch our neighbors, who arrived fifteen minutes after us, dig into two plates of delicious-looking food.  By the time we got our tepid but delicious meals we had already been in the restaurant for an hour and twenty minutes and we were actually feeling like nuisances.  We honestly should have complained to a manager, but we had to get to our other anniversary plans.  If I had it to do all over again I would have said something.  As it is they've lost us as customers.  If I'm going to pay that much for dinner, I'd like to be treated like a human being at least.    The funny thing is the ladies and that waitress had more than their hometown in common, and though I'd hate to think prejudice came into play, it seems to be a very plausible possibility.  I just don't know why a woman who is so friendly to other people could look at us and decide we were worthless scum without knowing us.  But that's what happened.  The difference in the way they were treated and the way we were treated was astoundingly obvious.

jyWfFfT2_sL0DlY90NFs5A.text: How often do we support a great cause while dining? The food was awesome! Would love to see a drink menu but had a great choice of local beers. We will most certainly be back.

W2jXiqSJq_zHIJNTTIuE7A.text: This place just seems to get better and better each time I go. I had the Fried Chicken (white) with mashed potatoes, butter beans and cabbage.   Everything was extremely good and the fried chicken was very moist.  A friend had the meatloaf that he said was very good as well.   We will definitely be back!

5wAcdwD2Fxp_01Z7W_k_8w.text: Great place!  The Cornbread is to die for, chicken was equally delicious.  Food is good but not anything to go out of your way for.  Proceeds go towards the local homeless population and there's some job training aspects.  Very neat idea and cause!  Was a bit empty at dinner (like most of downtown Charlotte) but couldn't get a table at lunch the one day I tried.  Leave your expectations at the door and just enjoy a well cooked meal and a well thought out cause & mission.

DUWHO9Dvx_YQS-3-V5FrIg.text: Today for lunch I had the pleasure of re-visiting The Kings Kitchen and I have to admit that their service has improved dramatically. When I arrived the staff here really rolled out the red carpet! I was warmly greeted and seated quickly. I started off with the sweet potato fritters which were quite amazing they came out with a side of honey they were the perfect appetizer . For my entree I ordered the catfish that came with three sides. I've never had catfish before and didn't know what to expect but when it came out I was in heaven ! The catfish was fried perfectly it was light and crisp but not greasy and flavorful for my sides I choose the Mac and cheese, seared cabbage and the butter beans that came a side corn bread and a biscuit everything thing hands down was good. When you come here for lunch come with an appetite . Now last but not least one thing makes this place special from any other place . This restaurant is a non profit that donates all of its proceeds and opens it's doors in the afternoon to feed the less fortunate in Charlotte! I had the pleasure of witnessing this first hand and it was beautiful to see the non profit in action. So if your looking for a great meal please support this place. Not only is the food fantastic but your contributing to a great cause. Eating out never tasted so good :)

gAHXbBmWmL6Zxr5_4L3w5w.text: Well, I guess that satisfaction is a derivative of expectations versus outcomes and based on the very high reviews of King's Kitchen, my expectations were equally high.    Granted, the concept of this restaurant is wonderful - all profits go to help the homeless population and job sharing programs with the homeless help them establish greater self-confidence and good job skills to help them get back on their feet.  What I wondered, however, was whether the mission swayed the reviews some.    Based on this being a non-profit, I assumed that this would be a hole-in-the wall location with a modest environment.  However, the setting was a little bright and loud.  The first thing I noticed was that my bread plate was dirty, as was the one at the neighboring table where I was borrowing a replacement.  The biscuits they brought for the plates were good and warm, but not the best I have had.  Our server was very friendly and explained the concept and the chariable mission, which was nice background to have.  Unfortunately, that is where the positives ended.    My girlfriend had a stuffed pork loin at the recommendation of the waiter and I had the blackened catfish over cheese grits.  The pork loin was extremely dry and over-cooked and the additional sauce we requested to try to make it more edible didn't help much.    The blackened catfish was decent, but half of it was beyond blackened and I had to cut off a decent chunk of the fish that looked like charcoal.  The grits were good, but its pretty hard to mess those up.  I'm disappointed that I didn't like this place better.  I really wanted it to be good and have a new place to which I could return.  Its a great cause, but at the end of the day, the food has to be what brings me back.  I'm glad to see others had better luck than we did.  Perhaps we just ordered the wrong things.  Sounds like the fried chicken is the way to go!

yFnQdyP2M94rx6ITW7Kl2A.text: Deviled eggs, braised pork belly, skillet fried chicken, mac & cheese, coconut pie... have I died and gone to heaven?!?  I got a LivingSocial coupon the other day, and I think this is the fastest I have ever used my coupon.  I have been wanting to try this place, and there's no better way than to drag my girl friend with me on a random Tuesday night armed with an empty stomach and gift certificate!  The interior hasn't changed much since it was ARPA (and on that note, I miss ARPA and their sangria by the pitcher).  We got a table quickly.  Our server greeted us and informed me (since I'm the newbie) that this is a non-profit establishment.  I think it's a very great concept and admirable thing to do (bravo to Chef Noble).    We decided to split our "loots" since it was getting late and she wasn't too hungry.  Somehow we still managed to polish 2 appetizers, 1 meat and three and a dessert (as you can guess, it was mostly my doing... taking a bow here).  Deviled eggs was tasty, the filling was a little more liquid than I am used to, but it was still good.  Braised pork belly was fabulous; perfect balance of fat and meat... I think it was served on a bed of sauerkraut, which was a bit too salty.  Skillet fried chicken was crispy.  The breading didn't take away from the meat.  The 3 sides we picked were mac & cheese (fabulous, moist, just enough cheese sauce), pan seared cabbage (looked undercooked but wasn't, it was amazingly flavorful), and butter beans (another good one, I'm sure there's bacon in it, just have to!)  We closed out the night with a slice of Coconut Chess Pie, which was topped with a fluffy (big) dash of whipped cream.  The pie was a little hard (both the crust and the filling) but I love coconut, and it tasted good... not too sweet.  I think the most disappointing part of the meal was the butter that was brought out with the cornbread... it was bland... but I am picky about my butter.    It was a great night of good food and good cause.  I will definitely be back, I have my eyes on the Polenta Bites and Fried Pork Chop :)

DpKN38scETrZdN12vUtNhg.text: Expensive and the service was terribad! First off, it wasn't too busy.. probs at less than half occupancy. Our waiters kept changing to @_@ so we didn't even know who was serving us. Now for the food... I ordered the gumbo [over spiced and tiny] and the fried chicken with mac&cheese and sauteed mushrooms... the fried chicken was really dry and the meat itself had no flavor it was all in the skin.. which was still lacking. The mushrooms weren't even really cooked.. it just tasted like raw mushroom drowned in veggie oil. The cornbread was dry as well [woohoo..] the only decent thing I had was the mac&cheese.. but yeah.. no drink refills.. slow service.. meh food.. 1 star

XXkP-tP0Ez9rXzQutLxJBQ.text: I ordered take-out from here this past Friday.  The food was very good and the service was excellent! It is a very pretty restaurant, and I love their mission.  They have a couple vegetarian options for take-out lunches; I wish there were a few more.

lPtc6Uoz1BPVc4MSh1ZaEA.text: Ate here on a Saturday night. I like that some proceeds are donated to local hunger efforts.  But, the service was somewhat lacking. We weren't checked on after our food arrived. Nearby tables were left unbussed. It wasn't terribly crowded.  The food was acceptable, though my companion's steak was overdone.

ofDl6TkS6qk-Dbij8rqpUQ.text: Not much not to like here. The night we went it wasn't busy which means we had a lot of attention from the staff. Supporting your local communities through this restaurant is a great idea. Food is rich so be careful how much creamed food you order. Down right good.

2quLQ0mCZmmdnJBpgJCvaA.text: Good ole southern cooking done the Noble's way. Too yummy and every meal you eat helps give back to others less fortunate. Pretty tough to beat combo. Fried flounder and pan fried chicken to die for and the sides.  This boy cries when the creamed corn is off the menu but the rest are A+ as well so it's not too terribly awful.

kjNUGDStT_-xfKwupIhiQw.text: This is my favorite comfort food restaurant in Charlotte.  I love the fried fish, the collard greens and the cream corn. It has a lovely atmosphere and the proceeds go to a great cause. It's a not for profit org that helps feed the hungry.

V5gmUTaQ-I9MV19xrvOW4g.text: The King's Kitchen is now one of my favorite Charlotte restaurants.  First, you have to acknowledge they do amazing things, being a non-profit that feeds the hungry.  That alone is remarkable.  I didn't know really what to expect and was blown away.  It has beautiful decor, fantastic food and our server was one of the best we've ever had.  He was attentive and represented the restaurant wonderfully.  We were there to celebrate my mother-in-law's birthday and we were not disappointed.  I was especially looking forward to the veggies.  The collard greens were fantastic!  The white meat fried chicken was tasty and moist and the wings were spice and yummy!  Can't wait to go back!

TYXPz1cqPDFjiKrPpbM4tw.text: I had lunch there yesterday and the food was amazing. Very good pimento cheese appetizer but the standout was the fried chicken cooked in a cast iron skillet and homemade creamed potatoes. So good I ended up eating too much and skipped dinner. Our server was also absolutely awesome.

xlFzL3ZocNkXhtJnvHI54Q.text: Everything tastes so delicious. Had the baked bbq chicken with mashed potatoes, mashed potatoes and creamy corn. It was True southern style cooking. Definitely comfort food. Loved every second of it and the service was very polite.

C7SLHJ0GY_cnhNqDM2jSGw.text: Wow I adore this place!  Here for dinner last night with a friend - haha only on a rainy day in Charlotte were we able to get seated here easily with no reservations.  Everyone is super nice and helpful, you can tell the staff really like their jobs and want people to feel at home.    The decor is perfection for me, really chic bar and white linen table cloths.  I cant wait for summer to eat on the pretty corner patio!  Obviously the restaurant is for a good cause so it is catty to say something may be overpriced on the menu....but it was.  The $13 cheese plate came with tiny tiny bits of six different kinds of cheeses (that were ok) and a few crackers and two tiny globs of honey.  This should have been about $6 bucks....that really is the only critisism I have of this place.    I got the Meat and Three (butter beans, mashed potatoes and mac and cheese.  Yes the mac and cheese at Macs is better but it was just fine here.  The chicken was the 'Meat'  and it was perfectly done fried chicken (yes better than Prices!)  Everything else was fantastic!!!  My friend got the Meat and Three also (fried flounder, collards, cabbage and green beans).  His green beans you thought may be boring??? OH NO!!!  They were spicy and delish - maybe a white pepper on these or something?  I couldnt place it...but all awesome and worth every penny.  Great wine list and very attentive service.  With wine and the app and the meals and to-die-for Pound Cake for dessert we were out of there for $80.  Cant wait to come back!!!  :-D

ZJumpJ0j5Wwj4NxoLxLF8w.text: Pork Chops, Mac 'n Cheese and Cornbread.   The End  . . . . . . .  Okay just kiddin'. Fab place with quality homestyle cookin'. Cornbread is made with real corn, staff is incredibly nice and the food isn't too darn shabby either.   To go orders are neatly packed with each item in it's own container. Surprisingly, the food really feels light and won't leave you in a gluttonous stooper. A can't miss and a must show off to out of towners.

QNN98CrwN_nj45N-mkIDzA.text: Great place for classic southern food. Sides are great, collard greens, creamed corn, black eye peas. Fried chicken is a go to.

j7paZQ0I-N5qkhvw6RAkBw.text: I am giving it three stars because of the service. This restaurant has the policy (I never seen this before nor in the US or Europe) that if you do not have a reservation then you cannot sit in the main dinner area but only at the bar. Not very welcoming. Food is good.

Rm3_lC6vYZ_WVt6eIOoI_Q.text: Took my aunt and uncle here when they were visiting from California because I thought they would really like the whole non-profit angle and the religious aspect that Jim Noble brings to his workplace since they are also very religious.  Came at lunchtime and we were seated right away.  Our server was nice but was sooo soft spoken it was hard to hear him.  I went with the meat and 3 and did the fried chicken with mac & cheese, creamed corn and sweet potatos.  It was all good but not great.  I prefer the style of the sides at Rooster's and the creamed corn wasn't really creamed.  The corn bread was awesome though.  I did have to ask about them because our server never brought them over till long after our food arrived.  My aunt did get a run down of the restaurants mission statement from our server and overall they seemed to really enjoy themselves.  I was treated so can't comment on price, but didn't seem very expensive.

NPpO42lq0EL8qfUUVQgbWA.text: Mmmm... Southern comfort food served up under the watchful eye of restauranteur Jim Noble and located right in the heart of uptown.  Additionally, the restaurant is a non-profit where 100% of profits goes to feed the local needy and servers are folks identified by other ministries as looking for a new beginning.  What's not to love here?    Jim Noble has labeled his cuisine "new local Southern"  and it shows here, where the menu revolves around a selection of the classic "meat and three," though you can also have a sandwich or salad as well.  Chicken, both friend and barbecued, is featured prominently along with staples like meatloaf and friend flounder.  The real gems here are the selection of vegetables available to you- I am particularly found of the smashed sweet potatoes, wilted spinach, and red sea island peas.  And you know they have pepper vinegar or texas pete to throw some heat on these!  Vegetarians rejoice- you can have a veggie plate of 4 selections for $10 (my usual go-to).  The tomato soup is pretty darn good here too.  And don't miss the biscuits here folks- I've had my share of dry, large biscuits, but these are almost creamy in the middle- like soft pillows just waiting to be ripped apart.  Holy goodness!  They make a cake-like cornbread too, but it's a red-headed step child to the biscuits.  Servers are dressed in jeans and white dress shirts.  All I have encountered have been nothing but professional and accommodating.  They all have their favorites on the menu too- if you can't decide just ask.  The dining room is a comfortable mix of tables and some booth seating.  The colors are warm and neutral- furthering the "Southern comfort" ambiance.  Large plasma TVs on the wall generally play sports on mute, nice for those at the bar seats, but a little disjointed for the main dining room.  If you do venture here for lunch, note that things are usually fine before noon and after about 1 PM.  The noon hour is a zoo with a line usually out the door.  The hostess will get to you in order, but the wait can be a little unpredictable.  This is just proof others think what we've been writing here, King's Kitchen is good food for a good cause.  A rare win-win for all involved.  Bravo!

WzQNylBbxBrmfWF8Q1vnnw.text: The food was just plain good. The serious standouts of the meal were the fried zucchini (batter was reminiscent of a tempura), the not sweet but so buttery and good cornbread, and the comparable biscuits. My pan fried chicken was quite tasty, although I personally prefer my fried chicken deep fried. My friend raved about the tender goodness of his oxtail. We all did go for meat+3 BUT I noted that they also offer "big plates", I suppose to appease those people who look down on meat + 3 out of principle. They read more like entrees so I suppose thats what they are. Anyway.  Even though the place is basically a charity, it ain't charitable to eat here.  It's well-deserved.  Darn good cookin'.

eAZJGUjDauoJwrDR5rDbxw.text: Very nice upscale restaurant with a real purpose. Ask your serve. And by the way, ours was the nicest server I think I've experienced anywhere!

4i6kYfiV4ulZDc842Ev_Vw.text: Great place, local sourced food and inventive menu. Staff was nice and great atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

sChvt1yumS9RYUMMzPxY5g.text: I am just downloading this app and decided to write an review on my recent visit to King's Kitchen. I have been in the hospital and could not help but think about my graduation dinner I had there with my family who came into town. This was an important part of my life for me. The food was not all what I expected. The wait time was horrible. Especially when everyone else had gotten their meals except for my brother n law. I felt he was made to wait longer due to the fact of him being the only white person at the table. He ordered the quickest thing that could be prepared salmon. Why did it take salmon 30 minutes to come out after our meal? I feel that sometimes situations such as this happens on purpose due to the fact that interracial couples are not welcomed.

Lgqc2TQRS9le-d0O9F_XoQ.text: This is a non-profit restaurant that uses their extra cash to feed the homeless. On our way out between lunch/dinner, they brought the homeless in for food and Bible study. This is incredible! The food is actually pretty good. Anyone looking for lunch here in Charlotte should definitely check this place out

Wim-54wkwwJWY8edZBvdbw.text: Delicious food. Wonderful mission. Gracious staff. I have zero complaints about The King's Kitchen. The fantastic and flavorful food that comes out of the kitchen makes this a go-to eatery for all things southern and soul. The mission that drives the restaurant is the icing on the cake. Go. Eat. Enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried chicken sandwich, Cole slaw and macaroni and cheese | across the table: veggie plate, you can choose any four sides

_tXKgODdA9mjl1v_xqasEg.text: Great service, great food, great atmosphere. I've never really had southern food and while visiting Charlotte we decided to check this place out. We were very pleased to say the least! I got the fried chicken with sides of Mac and cheese, green beans and mashed potatoes with gravy. My dinner date got the duck breast with roasted sweet potatoes, candied pecans and sliced apples. Everything was SO Flavorful and fresh. We learned that all their ingredients are from local farmers and local businesses which we thought it was really cool! For desert, we got the coconut cake --- ITS A MUST TRY! Our waiter was so awesome! He was so professional and did not rush us at all. If you are looking for a nice place for southern food, this is it! Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried chicken, with sides of Mac and cheese, green beans, mashed potatoes and gravy and a biscuit. SO AMAZING

O8Bjjk9w0NgXxtEr9IQvUQ.text: If you're in from out of town, King's is a no-brainer to put on your short list of places to eat:  - great bar to post up and have dinner  - Shrimp & Grits (A) - I don't think I've ever had Shrimp & Grits I've liked until I came here (Note: I know little to nothing about Southern cuisine)  - Seared Scallops (A-) I was highly skeptical of NC scallops after growing up on New Bedford Scallops, excellent dish - perfect sear & we enjoyed Margaux's succotash  - Fried Chicken (B) Good, but I wouldn't recommend it.   - Hot Pimento Cheese Dip w/ Kings Baguette (C+) - the only True miss

PhUQeLfI7WSZxdFg2Bs0gA.text: Found this place by chance (just down from my hotel) and what a find!  Many local beers on tap and a knowledgeable wait staff about them.  Also the menu and its service was superb.    I usually dine alone and did not feel uncomfortable at all.  My meal was well paced by the wait staff.  While it was a quiter night (not as packed as other reviewers have mentioned) they did a great job of pacing the food with me and not making me dine at the pace of the kitchen.    Can not wait for my next business trip to Charlotte to go here again!

dGS9AuCERi97OqhHVwZhMw.text: The ambience is nice, but the food is average at best. I ordered the barbecue chicken with mac & cheese, cornbread, corn. Nothing was wow, it was just OK. Maybe I just expected more

rfy8I8m2Q6p3GfYPIW7YEQ.text: Incredible service - incredible food - incredible cause! I'd eat here every day if I could afford it!

LZzkyiTjs7xb_1fOerOG_Q.text: This restaurant is amazing. I loved everything about it: the food, the wine, the service, the atmosphere, the farm to table, and the profits going to help those in need.  I was in Charlotte on business and we liked this place so much, we had to come back again.  The cheese plate is excellent, with some really great local cheeses.  Both times I had the scallops because they were so damn good, but the seven other people said all the dishes they had were fantastic too.  The dessert was amazing - that freshly made bread pudding and the chocolate mousse really stood out.  Prices are very reasonable as well.  Appetizers between $5-10, entrees between $15-25, and desserts around $8-10.  For the quality, you'd be hard pressed to find a better more reasonable meal that tastes this good.  All in all, one of the best dining experiences I've had.  If you're in town, you've got to try this place.  If you live there, The King's Kitchen should already be your go to spot.

pL0_b5ix3npojCTTWbmZYg.text: Great dinner. Love the concept of the proceeds going to charity from your meal!!  Had the pimento cheese and sweet potato balls for an app. Excellent! Had fried chicken and peas for dinner. Some of the best fried chicken I have ever had! Had banana pudding for dessert...DELISH!  Bottom line, I can't wait to go back!

HD9bWnXk9wH5-Jd44XSSgA.text: The restaurant is right beside my office, so I go over for lunch pretty frequently. I haven't had anything I didn't like! Big portions and good quality of food.

pPxUafVdBoxk8W2l4bdGaw.text: Very well prepared. Highly recommend the salmon! Staff is very friendly. They lost my reservation but still seated me immediately. Very kind with great mission!

k0icDEBzA4-HQyQrsJ-dZw.text: I read the reviews before trying this spot in Charlotte, and my main reason for going with not just for the food but their helping the community. The service itself was wonderful, our waiter (Dannielo )was very attentive and provided great service. My order was the pan fried  with 3 sides which included mac & cheese, sweet potatoes(yams) and lima beans --Dessert Cocnut  total price $27.06. The atmosphere was very comfortable and the food was seasoned perfectly.You have to come and try it!#giveback #communityawareness

PpDKZBrOvM5eJnCy9l7EAA.text: Have the best NY strip with rosemary and other light sauce. Best complex of flavors I can remember. The Chefs here are for REAL.

6z5A5r9umQONOK03u4E2Tg.text: A recent work conference took me to one of my absolute favorite cities ever this past weekend, and a quick google search took me to this fabulous restaurant. I contemplated trying it for 2 days before a co-worker looking to grab dinner convinced me to test it out. I'm very glad she did.  Naturally like others - I love the concept. I've come across it several times now in my travels, but this is the first time I decided to eat at such a restaurant. You get them feel goods when you do.   I ordered a scallop special and my co-worker had a duck special. Both were fantastic! Or so she told me on the duck because of course I didn't sample hers. I am not the biggest scallop fan, though I keep ordering it because I WANT to like them. These were the best scallops I have ever had. EVER. The succotash paired very well with the seafood as did the apple sauce tasting ... sauce atop them. Beautifully plated and amazingly delicious.  Admittedly, the service was slow. Very slow. But the food and fantastic weather (we sat outside) push me to give this restaurant five stars. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this to anyone I know visiting Charlotte.

jsLb7gmTcd6bVVd40Unu_w.text: One of the best fried chicken dishes ! Recommend coming if you are in the mood for some classic southern cooking with basic ingredients.

XU7BCt2wYaIN-Zw8AecDsQ.text: Great food + great atmosphere + great mission=awesome experience.  They have a great beer selection and cocktail menus. The shrimp and grits were by far the best I've ever had and the greens were amazing also.  This is a must visit place in downtown Charlotte!

oF0XJl5MUKvA8UFW5FfLBA.text: We love the King's Kitchen, the food and service are always great! The fried chicken and fried oysters are some of our favorites, and they always have a great take on comfort food.

_PCdNHvHTqAb8g-B2dtdtg.text: Sold out of everything and the chef don't know the difference between well done and medium. Then the manger thinks he can talk to people any kind of way. Visiting from dc and I will never come back to this place

idjt3iolAFP4rrjEh7ayaA.text: I've been here for a few lunches. Food is pretty good! Fried tomatoes are great! Service is quick and staff is attentive. I will definitely be back! I would recommend (and have already)!

V7iuMI9oWNLLN7A70u2XCw.text: Had a lunch date with my girlfriend here. It wasn't busy though we went around 2pm. It's a pretty big place. The staff was fast, efficient and friendly. He came around plenty of times to make sure we were okay even the manager as well. I had the baked chicken with green beans, mac and cheese and collard greens. The food was good for uptown. Maybe a little more seasoning and it'd be great. But that's just my tastebuds for you.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

nQeFDKXlWAGlpTqh2YiGSA.text: Best Southern restaurant in Charlotte. Myself being a native to Charlotte this is by far the best southern food I've had in the city. I went for lunch with my family and were not disappointed. I ordered the chicken sandwich with a house salad, the sandwich was fried and seasoned perfectly topped with homemade pickles, slaw, and a special sauce. My family got the fried chicken with sweet potato mash, collards, and green beans. The fried catfish that my sister got was delicious it was so flaky and flavorful. Everything we received was amazing. We decided to try the banana pudding for dessert and though presented pretty that was the only disappointment we had. The pudding consistence was grainy and creamy, I wouldn't recommend it.  Definitely want to try their bread pudding though next time, but they only serve it during dinner.  Tip: If you come for lunch make sure you don't go an hour or two before they close because after a certain time they run out of chicken during the lunch rush.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana Pudding
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Catfish with green beans, sweet potato mash, and Mac and cheese.
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

fCAhb2axSzV9gWoimTQJDg.text: The food here was amazing.  I had the kale salad that had pecans and apples and was tossed in a delightful citrusy dressing.  I opted to add a piece of salmon to my salad.  Normally, when you add a piece of chicken or fish to an entree salad, it will cost an extra $5 or so.  Well, I was shocked when I got the bill.  The salad was $12 and the small piece of salmon was $14.  That means I had a $26 salad.  NOT RIGHT!  I confirmed with the server that the bill was correct and he said it was.  As fabulous as this salad was, every single bite, the salmon upcharge left a bad taste in my mouth!  Otherwise, I love the mission of this restaurant and the fact that it is a non profit. They are doing some good things in the city.  The uptown atmosphere was fun, though the restaurant was a bit noisy for a conversation.  When I left, I purchased a bracelet at the register.  The proceeds will go to a person in need who strung the beads.  It's s fun little ditty for my wrist. All in all, it was a good experience.  I just didn't count on a lunch that was almost $40.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

QjMxzoClgPH3gAB48vxDFA.text: I have eyeballing the restaurant for years, but could never make it due to my packed schedule while visiting Charlotte. Now that I am living in the area, this was (of course) the restaurant I chose for date night.   I first want to say that I love their mission! This is a non-profit restaurant whose proceeds go to feeding the less fortunate. Amazing! They also work with the Charlotte Mecklenburg Dream Center, and host bible studies during the week. What an incredible place!!   Now for the food! I ordered the famous fried chicken with mac and cheese, creamy potatoes, creamed corn, and cornbread. DELICIOUS!! The chicken was fried to perfection, but a little dry (no worries though). I loved the mac and cheese, potatoes, and cornbread (so yummy)! The creamed corn was good, but not my favorite. I really wanted to try the banana pudding, but I was so full from dinner. That gives me an excuse to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

bT9hhMb4ebZO5tjA5fjRSw.text: The concept of this restaurant was what initially caught my attention. Let me preface this by saying that my husband and I arrived about an hour before closing. We had arrived in Charlotte late and I had seen this restaurant before hand and I was hoping to make it there during our single night stay. We arrived and were greeted warmly and seated promptly. We knew time was of the essence and wasted no time in putting in drink and food orders. The food was great. We both had the steak and frites. Our options were limited because the kitchen had run out of a few things. (Again we showed up one hour before closing, so not their fault) the service was top notch, the food was great, and the benefit to the community is priceless. I would highly recommend this place, and if you want to get your hands on the best dishes, show up a bit earlier than we did. Cheers!

wC33MBMorWbCjDPhvoFpCg.text: I absolutely love this place! Every time I come to Charlotte NC this is one if my go to restaurants. They never disappoint the chicken is always prepared fresh, biscuits taste great, & their macaroni & cheese , as well as their collard greens are my favorite. All their dishes come with so much food you will need a carry out tray.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried chicken comes with 3 sides &amp; a biscuit or cornbread! Only $15

ov90yYhHfjbB-xBn4Vtoeg.text: Soul food feeding souls in need. We made reservations here on a recommendation without realizing they are a non-profit helping people get back on their feet.  Service and southern comfort food that will amaze. Don't pass on the oyster app or shrimp & grits. The burger and mac & cheese are awesome too.  Great ambiance and decor round out a superb experience.

rCnIh2N0dRRPjPzcn5DGJg.text: The food was super yummy! And the mission is inspiring! Claire was a great waitress, personable, knowledgable and friendly. Highly recommended!

ah81XYtyvzYWT9_xVpm6yw.text: The atmosphere is pretty Christian. Which is ok. I just wish I had known to expect that.  I had the gumbo.  It was overly spicy for me. But maybe I'm just a sissy.  The coconut cake was spectacular.  My hubby loved it!  I tried the components separately, & each were unique. Then as a whole, it took on a completely different presence.

UhYseUlN92bn8xgZUwkZSQ.text: Kings kitchen is some of the best southern food I found in Charlotte I'm fond of  their not for profit organization they donate and provide jobs for those less fortunate. I ordered the meat and three the pot roast with fries Mac and cheese and cornbread.

Vf81qIEyOPP8evIcgbWPWQ.text: I don't leave many yelp reviews. But I felt like I had to leave a review for this place!  The food was amazing and the service was excellent!  The shrimp and grits, WOW!

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and Shrimp &amp; Grits

p9Di5ouBZiHfivAxGeokFw.text: Absolutely delicious!!! I come to Charlotte regularly on business trip and this is my absolute favorite restaurant!  First off the food is incredible. Fresh, well executed, and very tasty. But moreover, the restaurant is entirely non-profit, with all profits being donated. The restaurant is also staffed by employees who have all been given a second chance in life.  Now as for the food, my coworkers and I tried almost all of their appetizers, with the sweet potato bread and jalapeno hush puppies being our favorite.  For an entree, I had the shrimp and grits, and can definitely see why they're known for this dish. Get it! Don't think about it. Just get it!  As for dessert, I had the sweet toffee cake with gelato. It was a great way to end the meal. Not too sweet,the ice cream was all melt, and when the melted ice cream mixed with the toffee, heaven!!

CU38Q6FFlMk6pp_iSp6nfg.text: I ordered their speciality dish - a black bass. It was very very delicious. It was a little pricey compared to other dishes ($29) but totally worth the price. The biscuit was not as impressive tho.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

QrtI4LGwgiVYrO2o5ww_9Q.text: Upon moving to Charlotte I had a few friends recommend King's Kitchen. I took my girlfriend on a date during the week. It was not crowded and the atmosphere is great. The prices were on the high end but it is a nonprofit and has nothing to do with my three stars.  The salmon was cooked well but had way too much soy sauce which overpowered everything in the dish. Every bite tasted like I was taking a shot of soy sauce. Also, the service was not good in my opinion. Our server seamed annoyed to be there.  I do hope to make it back to kings kitchen soon and have a better experience.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

8B71XiMxjEHEodrymOSqLg.text: One word: AMAZING!!!!!! I came to Charlotte a week or so ago for my birthday. Found this place while we were just walking around. It wasn't too crowded, which was perfect.   When you walk in, there are news articles and things for you to read and get a better understanding of this establishment. They offer bible study, job training, and help feed/employ the homeless, among other things. (That alone will bring me back)  Our waiter was super nice. I ended up ordering the fried chicken. I have NOT had fried chicken that delicious since my great grandmother was alive(God Rest her sweet soul). It was fried to perfection. The Mac and cheese was delicious. The greens were ok though. Not amazing but not terrible. I probably wouldn't get them again. I'm usually not a heavy eater and almost always take more than 1/2 my food home. My plate was CLEAN when I was done. No leftovers whatsoever.   The next time I'm in Charlotte, I will most definitely come back!

WjdcOXVZbsubPEHQn0hgBA.text: Delicious southern dishes executed well and proceeds go to a good cause. The location is in a great corner of downtown Charlotte. The staff is attentive and service is spot on. I highly recommend if youre ever in downtown Charlotte. The atmosphere is very inviting and comfortable. The duck confit was really good and the shrimp and grits was well made.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Duck confit
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits

V1RYgQLBoDaxctgGQ-T68w.text: Delicious food, lovely space, great beer and wine list, superlative service.  Great vibes here.

DFkYzOzP-fT7cstAC8eOeg.text: The vibe here is nice. Clean lines and nice bright lighting. We opted for the outside patio. The outside patio was large and nicely decorated. The menu was VERY limited and because of this we chose to tip the waiter and count our losses. We were eating with another couple and children were in our party as well. We are primarily poultry eaters and the chicken dishes were pretty much fried. No one wanted seafood so it went downhill quickly. We decided to eat at another spot but if in Downtown Charlotte again I would definitely like to give it another try.   Con- I accidentally knocked my water off the table while waiting for my husband to park and join us. Our waiter oddly enough gave me a kid cup with a lid like the rest of the children at the table. This did not influence our decision not to eat but I just though it unnecessary.

0ysnA_A-CPTNhWPnRlY5qw.text: My hotel had the little Kings Kitchen menu and the pictures and description of entrees looked enticing so I gave it a shot. Walked a couple blocks.  When I walked in I was greeted and seated fairly quickly maybe because it was a table for one. I already knew what I wanted.. Salmon with beet risotto w/ kale.  My drink came and then a couple minutes later my food was ready. I was surprised how quickly they prepared knowing risotto might take a little longer.  I first tried the salmon and it was delicious. But as soon as I tried the risotto I knew why my food came out too quick for a reason. The rice/risotto was hard. I've had risotto in many places and I also cook it at home and it wasn't this hard. I understand al dente but it didn't  even seem as my rice was cooked. I complained about it and they made me a new one, unfortunately, the risotto was hard again. I guess the chef didn't taste the remake of the risotto before serving it again. Just by looking at the rice it didn't even look cooked or al dente. I didn't even bother of complaining again. I just ate the hard rice. I didn't eat anything all day so either complain again and be brought the same tough risotto or just eat it since my salmon was already cold. I decided to just eat, pay, and leave! I don't know if this is how risotto is really prepared at the kings kitchen or this is how north carolinas like their risotto. But I've tried risotto at different restaurants in different states and the risotto here is not part of the norm. It stands out but not for the right reasons.

gAyk8CHJMuvgsWpmPw33ag.text: I was in town for business and in the mood for some Southern cooking, so came across The King's Kitchen on Yelp. Despite my best efforts for healthy eating, I could not resist the fried chicken, and it definitely exceeded expectations. The outside was crispy and well-seasoned. At this point I figured if I was going to not be healthy with my eating I might as well go all out -- got the mac and cheese to accompany it, also very good. The wine list here was decent, some good selections by the bottle. Overall a great place for me to get my Southern fix.

gxNEQzakwspW7QhUsk4DAA.text: This place was decent. I didn't hate it, but I didn't love it. Our server was awkward and definitely not what I thought was acceptable for the prices we were paying, but she was nice so I would never complain to management. The food was good. I didn't like the ambiance. I felt like I was in a cafeteria, which didn't fit with the menu/pricing.

p7BBIEXSQttiIthAZYXnCg.text: Like the concept...but not the food. Went for valentine's dinner. Two appetizers on the menu were not available. No draft beer available. Which leaves limited wine list and 6 or so bottle beer choices. Scallop appetizer was ok. Chicken and dumplings...sent back. Ordered blackened catfish...burnt. Shrimp and grits were lumpy....very strange. Either this was a bad night or this place is hurting.

iEfLRm8YqPZ4lJ1Qr-hhPQ.text: It's great to have a meat-n-three place that's not your typical BBQ restaurant.  I've been here 3 times and have always liked my side dishes.  The creamed corn had strings in it, but that was my only complaint.  I agree with a previous reviewer about the pie crust - not my preferred kind.  I do, however, love the biscuits and cornbread.  Portions are reasonable and so are prices.

RAG9p8n9jjS9l0dwDKCC5Q.text: For someone who moved too far north for Good southern food this is a destination. If you are looking for a casual meal this is a awesome place.

uUu9U77DvFwnxWk0Wx0ZoA.text: Great Food and concept. Service was completely lacking.

2rumRLHwQxNYk3P167o0Mg.text: Loved this whole experience. The pimento cheese dip with homemade crackers were so tasty. The shrimp and grits were amazing! I had to go back a second time on this trip. And the biscuits with butter and honey....my oh my...the best I've ever had. The mac and cheese wasn't that great but our corn and butter beans were so tasty. We had them with the fried chicken. I would love to come back to visit (from Seattle) just because of this restaurant.

eC9hCEJvW_i8swgyrkn7NQ.text: Funny experience here.  My friends claimed that I took them to a "white guys soul food place".  Hey!  Aparrently, "real" soul food, according to my friends, is spicier.  I thought the food was great.  Interesting business model.  Check it out.

62FWrRjospwaEnN_eO_V2w.text: Was visiting Charlotte for business and checked out this restaurant after reading the good reviews on Yelp.  our server Melinda was amazing and I reccomend you requesting her.

qYkXFsLJ5tbxayTn8f-Xhg.text: As far as food goes, I'd give this place 4 stars, but based on the service, it get's a golden review. KEN was our waiter and he did a damn fine job. My bf and I were flying out of Charlotte the following morning and decided to spend the evening walking around the city and grabbing some decent food and drinks. Ken made the experience a hundred times more pleasant than expected! He had the best recommendations for dinner - go with the mac n cheese for your side and crab cake for app! - and also he brought me 2 sav blancs to try before making a decision on which wine I had with my meal. The evening seemed a little slow and we enjoyed chatting him up about Charlotte's history and night life, etc. We really had a great evening and the food was yummy, but the service was unprecedented. Thanks, Ken!

7PiUD58L9126ysfj3BLqTQ.text: Cornbread was very good. Had the BBQ chicken which was good but small leg and thigh. Wasn't anything special. Sides were the cabbage, red peas, and sweet potato mash. Have to say the cabbage was the best thing. Everything else was bland with no seasoning. I would not go back here

_5WIQYVWev4KBOG00hkdxQ.text: Excellent food, GREAT service, good beers on tap....not much more I could ask for in a restaurant! We were very pleased after our recent date night here!

5eHaQ41Jw-0XOccOTXqL4g.text: I had a bad dining experience here and will likely never go again.  Oddly enough, I went in the first place because of good reviews I read here on Yelp.  Needless to say I was suprised with bad service, and burned food that was tasteless!  I had a grilled pimento and cheese sandwich with fries.  I know that the couple sitting next to me and my wife were not happy either.
