lETi5iFVIkuUiythTvpuIQ.text: Fabulous meal with friends.  Service was friendly, but a little slow with a misstep in bringing the bread.  I had an excellent glass of wine.  OK maybe 2, all for a good cause.    The cheese plate had 6 regional cheese on it.  All but one were pretty bland, so I don't know if I would do that again.    The cornbread was great!  I enjoyed a bite of a good biscuit as well.  I had the skillet fried chicken with mac and cheese, pan-seared cabbage, and creamed corn.  The chicken was fabulous, moist with a delicious crust to it.  The creamed corn was really good.  Fresh corn with just the right hint of seasonings.  Mac and cheese was just like Mom's so it was delish.  Husband had the steak special with au gratin potatoes and some wilted spinach.  The steak was on the smaller side but the flavor was terrific.  I really like the potatoes.  They were well cooked.    For dessert, we had the brown sugar pound cake and the bananna pudding.  Both were really great.    Friday nights is live jazz night.  The musicians were great, but it was a bit loud for conversation in the small space.  The saxaphonist came and did a great rendition of Happy Birthday to a nearby table.    Overall the restaurant is warm and welcoming.  The non profit, helping those in need, greatly appealed to all of our group and we will definitely be back to King's Kitchen.

E30kdrg3fqiV6aRZYLE6zA.text: If you like southern cooking, don't miss this place. The shrimp and grits were delicious

npnBH4ztgB9ifVE0h5tTIQ.text: Good as it gets!!! Southern cooking and southern charm at its best. Fried chicken melts in your mouth; cornbread delicious; pot roast yummy; 3 sides included; banana pudding WTC (worth the calories!). )Everybody  is professional and super-friendly. Service is terrific. Reasonable prices too. Best meal we've had in Charlotte and we've been to Mimosa Grill and Luce. Paid more than double what King's Kitchen costs too. The icing on the pecan pie....humanity benefits from this not-for-profit restaurant also!!

10fC7oLcTpJPC-4lHElxHA.text: Excellent service. Meat+3 is definitely the way to go. My date had the salmon which was also excellent. And profits to charity for dessert.

7qk-DKpCbJEbCDxYPqsVgw.text: i was excited to eat here because it was highly recommended. the service was excellent and the food was pretty good. it's not the best fried chicken i've ever had but it was decent. it was a little greasy though.   however, i went with a large group of 7 and so far 3 of us felt sick later. i haven't checked with 3 other folks from my party but, my mother in law, my husband and i all felt very nauseous  and had the runs afterwards.

AQRZmVNNZeSiJ8GC0464Tg.text: I really would give this a 4.5. My wife and I both got fried chicken and with all the sides it comes with, it was a decent deal. We both got mashed potatoes, collard greens, and mac and cheese. All of them were delicious. The biscuits were the best part. I really wish we had room for desert afterward because there were a few options which I'm sure would be great. On top of it all, it's in a good location. A block from the action, it's along Church Street where I usually can find a parking spot. We will be back for breakfast for those biscuits.

hwOABeQXBgEqVLeranvYHw.text: Visiting Charlotte on business, was looking for a fun place for dinner with a group. Saw good reviews on yelp and wandered in. Limited beer selection unless you like craft beer. No Coors Light. Food had mixed reviews from group. Burger was awesome, NY Strip was good. Fried Chicken was tasty but a little on the dry side. Service was attentive. Love the business concept though!

3ze-RBiaBhdIc1PVRqNxmQ.text: I had to arrange a last minute dinner for a large group (~18 people) called in the afternoon& they took excellent care of us. Logistics for accommodating the group were clear and important questions were asked up front which made it all go smoothly. I was hesitant that such a group could all be made happy & yet they were. Everyone was beyond happy with their meals and the service was excellent!

xPRS5dU3d8HngRQFx3ozCg.text: First time trying this place out on a quick trip to Charlotte.  Loved the service, food and what they stand for.  The greens and mac and cheese are delicious!

-62KsJwkqt4wa9w9PgMPeg.text: Food is all right, but nothing special. The shrimp and grits were okay, but nothing extraordinary. Service was lacking. We felt like our patronage was a burden to the wait staff. We did enjoy the sweet potato fritters.

uWcVYrhVC7MhWBo7OGeWcQ.text: First let me say that I love the mission of this place and I love how much it is doing for the community! Additionally, I love the decor and airiness of the restaurant, making it a very welcoming environment. I came here with my fiance and I ordered the shrimp and grits and he ordered the pot roast. Sadly, I didn't like my shrimp and grits and I thought the portion was very small for what the price was. On the other hand my fiance loved his pot roast and I was lowkey jealous that I didn't get it because it was really good! I would love to come back and get the pot roast or try another dish.

MWJIsb9I4ZiWWBmwTm6VJQ.text: We were actually walking to eat at a different restaurant in downtown when we saw the word "collards" on the window. That was it for us. And we were so happy we stopped.   The oyster po' boy was to DIE for. I mean seriously!  The collards were amazing. Butter beans were good but a little too salty. Gumbo is good.   My friend had salmon on red rice and gave an excellent report on it. Plus a pleasant milieu and excellent service. Definitely coming back!!!

p7rsT_sh1URrIGtrUv7LsQ.text: I eat here quarterly. It's about every time I need a hair cut I always find myself going next door to King's because I know I'll get something qualitatively good.   Much if not all of The King's Kitchen menu is farm-to-table and that will always have a sweet spot in a slow foodies heart. While I haven't toured their menu extensively I do fall into some easy categories.  Instead of need a V8, I often need a Veggie plate. Collards are smokey-bacony, mac and cheese is buttery delicious, corn casserole or creamed corn is--well creamy nomnom. I sometimes range on my veggies--carrots are in sometimes, green beans others, or a dish of fresh beets are yummy too.  Grilled meat loaf. Sometimes you just need a weight in your belly, a good anchor point is a slab of meatloaf grilled a bit with a side of smokey sauce and some veggies to go with it. Haven't gone wrong with that yet.  Specialty sandwich of the day--this ranges all over the board. Yesterday was a Virginia fried oyster sandwich, tega kay lettuce, aioli which was--dayum good.  To add to it--they added a pastry case in the front sometime in the last year and even though I'm surrounded by desserts 24x7 I really enjoy some of the treats they cook up. The coconut brownie is a heart attack and perfect for a partial late night snack.  To balance out all this goodness their pricing is on the high side, which is to be expected for something local and scratch made. Sides for sandwiches are extra, don't let this throw you or it will. Portion size are just a tad small for sides but it's good to moderate. So these mild detractors are just cosmetic. They don't interfere with the quality of the meal to be had. :D

2EqtyI6TtEmFOxy10-KOhQ.text: My favorite place for a healthier lunch - especially is you're a paleo eater! The baked chicken is always super tender and the salmon is always cooked to perfection. The selection of fresh vegetables is huge - be sure to ask if they have any daily specials! And for someone who is not a cornbread fan - I can't resist theirs! Perfect thickness, texture and moisture.  The food here is great and the mission is even better. Who wouldn't want to eat a delicious meal where all meal profits go to serving the homeless community?!

oNf6wu2oDYFt7aVdWqmBaw.text: A favorite.  Love the food, ambiance, and staff. Definitely a must for quality southern. Wish flavors were a bit more unique and distinctive, but food is always fresh and has southern warmth.

3Pbojf3_3M5g6brSf-qiFw.text: Overall my favorite restaurant in Uptown.  Food is amazing but certainly not low calorie. Shrimp and grits fantastic.  Biscuits absolutely out of this world. A few good selections for wine by the glass. Most amazing cole slaw I have ever had. Great ambience. Bar service attentive but sometimes a bit slow because understaffed. Food comes out too early.

A-6pWVdQUw3gDtzNSz-lEg.text: In town for a conference and checked Yelp for great local spots to eat. This place was recommended by the hotel staff and Yelp reviews only reinforced their recommendations.   Atmosphere was great. Packed, but got seated quickly. Service was very friendly and suggested a couple specials. I had the pork chop dinner....it was incredible. The chop was so juicy. The polenta was great, and the glaze sealed the deal. Top 3 best meals of all time!! Im serious.   The $9 house salad was disappointing (bland, no salt n pepper or flavor) with a ranch dressing that didnt come close to the flavor of ranch, more like a creamy herb I couldnt identify.  But I tell you, the pork chop meal completely made up for it.   My colleagues got the gumbo and said it was really good, as well as the fried chicken. I very well may go there again tomorrow because it was that good!!

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork chop dinner with sweet potato polenta and some type of super delish glaze!!! Must have! Best meal ever!!

ljgb03GCGZH2wI9iSvazrg.text: The mission of this restaurant is phenomenal along with their food. There is a large selection of good ol southern dishes.  Their fried oysters and the fried okra are wonderful.  Their seasoning of vegetables is spot on.  I recommend going with a friend and split several dishes.  The portions are very generous and you will want to try all the yummies the Kings Kitchen has to offer.  There is outside seating so you can enjoy center city Charlotte.  The wait staff is excellent.

vjPGvZ_PR3N0e2jeeyHY7w.text: Delicious food! Nice and salty and flavorful. My only negative is the portion. For $24 a plate or more...you get a tiny chicken leg and thigh. And the cornbread isn't that great...cold and dry.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pricey for southern food...I would think you would get bigger portion for $30 a plate

yJfh6irCFHHmYD1t900rsQ.text: Awesome fried oysters! Great way to start up an appetite before having the real deal, which is a full course meal of course. I have to say my favorite thing about The King's Kitchen is how they are a non-profit business who helps those in need. Very noble cause indeed!

hJky6Fo7qufgFq05CNfXsw.text: What a bummer.  We were in town on a business trip and decided to check out The King's Kitchen based on some glowing Yelp reviews.  Unfortunately, it ended up being a complete fail.  Shrimp and Grits:  The grits were lukewarm and clumpy.  The shrimp were small and lukewarm.   Vegetable Side:  SALTY.  Overcooked mush. Fried Oysters:  Decent, but some were a bit soggy. Hot Pimento Dip:  Probably the highlight of the meal.   Sweet Potato Fritters:  Awful.  All you could taste was clove(?).    The server was sweet, but seemed out of it.    Last but not least, the printed beer menu was ~80% wrong.  Instead of just telling us what was on tap, the server simply responded "sorry, we don't have that" to nearly every beer on the menu.  To get the REAL list I had to finally ask, "so can you just tell me what you do have?"  Pain in the ass.

UO3BcP3JGSgyHXAkPEk0wQ.text: We decided to come to the King's Kitchen because of their message of helping those less fortunate. The meal started and ended on high notes but the middle was very lackluster. We started our meal with the sweet potato fritters with honey and I was blown away. They could have easily been served for dessert and were out of this world delicious. I would have been a lot happier if i just got these and then dessert. This 3 star review would have at least been 4 stars.   For dinner i was starving so i got the King's Kitchen Burger with a side of Mac and Cheese. I wasn't asked what temp i wanted my burger at so i made sure to clarify that i wanted it medium rare, it was definitely more medium/medium well. My mac and cheese was good, but wasn't outstanding. Overall the dinner portion was mediocre at best. My one friend got the gumbo, which she seemed fairly happy with, and the corn bread. The corn bread was dry dry dry. It was definitely not what she wanted. My other friend got the tomato soup and was happy with it. She got a biscuit on the side and loved being able to dip it in the soup.  For dessert we decided to split the banana pudding with a marshmallow on top. We told our waiter that we were going to split it and she kindly had them split it in the kitchen so we each got our own marshmallow. The banana pudding was delicious. If i come back to the King's Kitchen i am going for the sweet potato fritters and the dessert. Everything else was not worth it.

vHyEa_BjOsrMyJ3vVoCs0g.text: Went at lunch. Food was superb. I had the meatloaf and 3 sides - corn, collars greens, and sweet mashed potatoes with cornbread. Service was fantastic. Highly recommended. Best place I've ate in Charlotte thus far (still new).

enCkMJhtIUu_CRkPjxukyg.text: I ordered the pot roast, Mac n cheese, collards, green beans with cornbread. The pot roast and cornbread were equally dry. The sides were good though.

gUp6t6-6BYzqcJfQ0aumrg.text: I love this place! I haven't stopped recommending it since we have been.  My coworker suggested we try it since my husband loves authentic southern food. He was excited to have their friend chicken, mashed potatoes, and macaroni and cheese. He even adored the green beans!  My meal was the roast with macaroni and cheese, creamed corn, and fries. The fries are even better than they look and I loved the creamed corn! I highly suggest you go here.  The service was also excellent!

ooMYof2Y9ZDUoIgMJD7-6Q.text: I like this place.   I like their location, their staff, their menu, their food quality,  and especially their mission.   Sure they can be a little pricey for what some consider simple fare (good ol' home cooking), but dang . . . they do it well.  Think Art Smith in DC at his Art & Soul restaurant in the Capital district and you get the idea.  Did I say I like this place?

iC3ZV5Jgyz2QtRfXGLW1BQ.text: What an amazing restaurant with an even better mission. If you are looking for a good meal with a cause, this is your place.   Nice outdoor patio with large indoor bar and plenty of seating. The dining area is spacious with a beautiful semi-open kitchen concept.  The staff is extremely friendly, attentive, and knowledge about the menu. They offer a variety of dishes that are seasonally inspired and locally sourced. Nice selection of wine/beer as well.   Some menu items selections have small portions, so just ask before hand. The pimento cheese is amazing! I've also had the hush puppies before as well and as not disappointed!  Overall it's a great little place with a beautiful mission. Stop in and check them out if you are looking for some good down home southern food!

zCfWCky_I6PTN-GxV-RAbw.text: I'm visiting Charlotte with my mother and friends. We just came from the restaurant and we are extremely disappointed. We're from a small town in Georgia and we live for soul food, we know the ins and outs of the kitchen and how REAL southern food is supposed to taste. And THIS AINT IT. The collard greens taste like the were drowned in sugar, tougher than jerky, and had an after taste we can't explain. The chicken wasn't southern fried at all and wasn't crispy. The Mac n Cheese had clumps of cheese in it and the noodles weren't covered in cheese like baked Mac n cheese should be. My friend ordered the duck.... it wasn't tender, hard to cut and still had blood in it. She asked the waitress to make sure it was cooked all the the way through and the waitress stated she would just put it in as medium so it won't be dry.   All I can say is that my steak was cooked medium rare like I requested and my tea was sweet like I like it. I don't know why or who is rating this place 5 stars but please stop the madness. I am a southern girl who's had southern food all my life, my mom and I should have went in the kitchen and cooked our own food. It was disgusting. I know it's for a good cause but please if you label yourself as a southern restaurant get southern cooks and recipes.

J25eoLG2Y2rdcXf6Dxazbg.text: I really wanted to love this place. It has has an excellent location, indoor and outdoor seating, and prompt service. And the mission of the kitchen is what brought us we. Supporting the local community by investing time and energy into her people-- sounds amazing!?   Unfortunately the food was only okay. Definitely three star food with a five star atmosphere/mission. We tried to order either chicken dishes, but by 7pm they were already out (which seems a little early to me). My husband had the pork roast, which he enjoyed, along with his sides of green beans, mac and cheese, and potatoes. I had the veggie platter- which brings me to another concern. On my veggie platter, I ordered green beans, which ended up being full of bacon chunks (a delightful surprise for most!) which I do not eat and could not exchange. It just made me think that if someone orders a veggie plate, it could be good for the waiter/waitress to advise them that the green beans have on not vegetarian. Just a thought. Overall, we decided the food was good, but not incredible.   The people were kind, and we loved the mission. But the food was just good.

dwtVzWnj0Pj0GbyoLTxzmw.text: First, I'd like to say I think the mission of this restaurant is AMAZING. What they do to help the community is beyond commendable.   This review is based on my experience with the food.   Let me just say: I really wanted to love this place. I'd heard it was good and was excited for reservations on New Years Eve. Despite having a reservation, the wait time was about 20 minutes and it looked like they were severely understaffed. With it being a holiday, I imagine they had a lot of call outs.  Overlooking the wait, I was happy to get seated and order a glass of wine! It was good.   I debated what I wanted to order for a long time because everything sounded amazing! I finally decided on Aunt Beaut's Pan Fried Chicken. Yikes, I don't know whose auntie passed down that recipe, but I was not impressed. It literally tasted like no seasoning was added at all. You know it's bad when you have to ask for hot sauce to make it more edible.   The black-eyed peas were good.   The macaroni and cheese and collards were just ok.   Being from the Deep South, when you say "soul food" I'm expecting the seasoning to be immaculate and to not want to put my fork down! I would much rather go to a "hole in the wall" establishment with better tasting food than a fancy place with food that is so mediocre for the price.   Again, good mission. The food needs work, though. I was not impressed.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Aunt Beaut &#39;s Pan Fried Chicken

Q00rUjIY5OX7DrZjrPViaA.text: I enjoyed Kings Kitchen!  This was my second time here, it's been a few years since my last visit. Walking in I was greeted by the host and the manager. I will say I personally didn't like that they only seat you when half of your part arrives. Especially when there's no one in the restaurant, but rules are rules.   When we sat down our server immediately introduced himself and provided us with glasses of water to start. We had time to scan the menu and select what we wanted for lunch. I chose the fried chicken sandwich with collard greens and slaw on the side.  Our food arrived hot and looked beautiful! Everyone rebased over how delicious the collard greens were. We also tried to figure out the ingredients lol. The food was seasoned very well {southern girls favorite} so I give extra points for that. Our server was nice, I failed catching his name but he was very punctual.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

ySNxLROM6GB_2YHXLLVrRg.text: Finally made it here for lunch even though I've been working uptown for a while now.  Went with folks from the office for a farewell lunch, but it was a good experience.  Located right off the main drag on Trade & Church, the space is modern and comfortable.  The glass that surrounds the restaurant has southern recipes all along the perimeter.  We got there around 12ish for the lunch rush, but we were promptly seated and the staff were super friendly and accommodating (even though the place was busy).  Where I was sitting, I had a view of the construction happening across the street.  It was not that long ago that I remember a park being there with a big sculpture.  I think a hotel is going in.  I had the Copain Country Panini and it was delicious.  Frits for my side were crunch and rustically cut.  You can't really go wrong with Pimento cheese, but add it to a sandwich with some arugula and you've got a winner.  I'm also a fan that the owner of this restaurant incorporated their passion in their faith and realizing Restoration Word Ministries.  I know most people may get turned off by attaching a religion onto a restaurant entity, but I did not feel like that was a major player in my lunch experience.  It is a public restaurant that puts its profits and proceeds toward feeding the poor.  They also have a work program to help train and employ people that need it, so I think that's a win for the community in general.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Copain Panini with Frits
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Copain Country Panini

pc-z8c-FEr5M1xNbXYHoog.text: 3.5 star  First thing first- please change the napkins, they shed so much that we had to ask for a lint roller.....  Service was good, we came here as a team dinner and I ordered the burger with a few side dishes: mushroom to add on my burger, mac n cheese, and potato salad. I enjoyed my food but my co worker who ordered the southern style fried chicken didn't like hers- dry and didn't have much flavor.   Large seating area and it was on a game night so the place seems a little empty.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

Yo6cRJgmxASZhQYDh4spGQ.text: Relaxed atmosphere and overall positive experience.  Decent select of beers on draft and selected the Legion Juicy Jay IPA ($7).  Went with the Stone Fisheries Grilled Salmon ($26) which was prepared well but a little spendy for the portion size.    Service was decent.   The acoustics could lend itself to being a little noisy when the place is full - keep that in mind if you want a place for a business meeting or more intimate conversation.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grilled Salmon
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Main Menu
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dinner Specials

2SwgrqfKRDQ5uXidBeThDw.text: I was very disappointed in the food ! I ordered the fried chicken meal, first off they were out of white meat smh. When my food came out, the chicken tasted like it was oven fried with no seasoning, the mac was dry and lacked cheese, lastly the greens could have been cooked longer, they were crunchy. The cornbread was the worst! It tasted like they just mixed the box ingredients together and baked it. No flavor whatsoever. We complaimed.to the waitress and she said oh yea we tell the owners all the time they won't change the recipe. How is this considered a soul food place?

bDw5SP4Pj8C8gmOJZrTHBw.text: I don't live in the CLT area but saw this place online and wanted to try some good ole southern cooking. Well I wasn't disappointed. The food, service, and drinks were great and I will go back next time in town.   Let's start with the service. It's never easy making everyone in a group happy but somehow our waiter did it. The level of service we received from him was phenomenal and this was with two groups (my group had 8 and the group beside us was about 12). So for them to be able to keep both tables happy, have our food out in a decent time, still have it hot, and no one had any problems with their order shows the level of care they take for their customers.   The food. OMG y'all, this is a southern boys dream. We started off with some Pimento Cheese and Crab Drip and both were on point. The crab dip had just the right amount of seasoning to it so it wasn't overpowering. Others at my table also had the Okra. I didn't personally like it to be honest because it was roasted and not fried but to each their own (update the website says it's fried now). My entree I had the pot roast and it was like my grandma's. I was looking for her to pop out the kitchen and come sit and eat with us. It was that good. No one at our table was disappointed and I have some super opinionated friends.   One thing I have to say before I wrap this up. The one thing I love the most about them is their mission. Please please please go to their website and read what they do. They give opportunity to those that may not have the most options out there. They teach them life skills they can take with them and the best part is that they are a non-profit organization. So give them all your money!   In closing; if you want to make a difference in your local community, have some great food, and be showered with great service check them out!

1KXgs0h9DNJHUfgEFFXOrg.text: Attended King's Kitchen for a birthday dinner. We had a larger group and everyone was still able to get separate checks. I ordered the catfish with mac&cheese and butter beans. The fish and beans were really good. Everyone raced over the mac&cheese and it was just okay. I would definitely go back and try the fried chicken.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Catfish, macaroni and Lima beans.

BT6jawe5JMfuPTl8LtdWHQ.text: We went on a Tuesday night, and it wasn't crowded. I think you may want a reservation if going on a weekend dinner date because I've heard it is busy.  The pimento cheese appetizer was so good! It's a giant portion too, so we took some of it home.  The food was amazing, good service, and it supports the community. Can't go wrong!

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Catfish, fries, and butter beans
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Roast, cornbread, green beans, butter beans

ybRMp8NbRzL57FnZ1oFh3w.text: Did not order enough food for a fair evaluation but we did enjoy what we ordered. The other and I stopped in here prior to checking out Bert Kreischer for a quick bite and a drink and overall we were pretty happy with it. Warning - this is a wine and beer joint only! No cocktails :( the beer was still delicious and cold, though. We shared a bowl of the gumbo and an order of the scallops. The scallops were cooked well but I was not impressed with the flavor. The gumbo was pretty tasty but nothing that blew our mind. Quite spicy but we both enjoy spice. Neither dish was out of this world. Some of the items on the menu looked and smelled delicious, though, and we have intentions on coming back again!

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gumbo
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Scallops

wnkphVtWlLmZvZsSY6x-hQ.text: Came here before a Hornets game. Great location for the walk to the game. The service was good and the atmosphere was classy. The appetizer biscuits were good with the spread options. Molasses butter was best option. Salmon was  cooked well not to flavorful and small. Everything else was pretty regular. Nice light meal for me. I enjoyed my dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Biscuits!!!!
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Meat &amp; 3...Salmon, mac n cheese, mushrooms, and mash potatoes

H3RegEDzsBGpvbZnVbM1xg.text: Great story behind the place and some fantastic tasting food!  We started off with the appetizer of pimento cheese.  It was so good.  Do it !  For the entree 2 of us got the shrimp and grits.  It was recommended and we both had to do it.   The taste of it was so good.  The shrimp was tasty and the grits were perfect.   Thinking back at it now makes me want more.  It was one of the best tasting entrees I have had in Charlotte.  It cost too much though, at least for what we got.  The serving was too small for 22 dollars when we got less than 10 shrimp and a big bowl.  I'm not complaining though because the taste was great.  I just left a bit hungry.   The other one in our party got the 4 sides option.  No need to talk about anything else but the Creamed Corn.  By far the best on her plate and must get if you are ordering a side.    This place is fantastic taste.  Make the spot and enjoy the story of the restaurant too!

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Old State Shrimp &amp; Grits
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Plate of Southern Vegetables

xNnhj61bwdoM4wgNj1qwVQ.text: While we were visiting North Carolina, there was one particular food item we really wanted to eat... fried chicken. In fact, we researched the best fried chicken places in the area prior to coming.  King's Kitchen wasn't one of the restaurants that we were going to hit up for fried chicken... we read about this place just having good food so we came here on our last night.  The mister and I ended up ordering... yes, fried chicken. He ordered black eyed peas, collard greens, and Mac and cheese with his fried chicken plate as well as a biscuit... I think that entire plate was like $12... I ordered a fried chicken dinner as well but got their mushrooms and corn bread along with collard greens and Mac & cheese.   The fried chicken... YES... this is what we came all the way here for. This kind of fried chicken. It was perfection. Before coming here in the days before, we had gone to Price's chicken and Bojangles. Sorry, neither of those places come close to the tastiness of King's Kitchen's fried chicken.   Their side dishes.... the mushrooms, you MUST order. It is scrumptious. They use various types of mushrooms and they are all cooked beautifully. The collard greens... order this also!!! The biscuit was dry as was the cornbread... but it didn't matter because everything else was so good. We also ordered their baby kale salad to start off with and that was very refreshing.   Total for everything with a glass of wine, salad, tip and two dinners was like $65 which wasn't bad at all given the quality of the food.  Service was friendly as it was everywhere we went in North Carolina.   Check out this restaurant if you're ever in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

acr8lrjTQ3yKJe9QsIi50w.text: Meh. I really wanted to like this place but nothing was amazing. Our waitress was in some type of mood and was unpleasant throughout the night.  Started off with the fried okra appetizer - and I could care less about okra, but my boyfriend LOVED it. It came to our table looking completely different from what I expected and honestly, tasted better than I thought. The pan fried chicken was good - but nothing to really write home about and the sides were again, just meh. Green beans were definitely from a can.... which kinda sucks if the dish costs more than $15.

TS4VjPAyFc0laPW8n_XK_A.text: I love this spot! It is perfect for a working lunch or a date night. The restaurant is beautiful, and the food is delicious. Their cornbread is hands down the best in Charlotte!  I typically order their meat and sides entree. Ad your meat, you can choose from pork, grilled chicken, fried chicken, fish, etc. They have tons of side options but the corn, mac and cheese, and collards are my favorites.   Their food is upscale Southern and it sure is tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grilled chicken, Mac and cheese, butter beans, and sweet potatoes! Yum!!

hc7V2D8O2nPI2vhFS-GbhQ.text: What a fun establishment. I sat outside during a Thursday night and thoroughly enjoyed my meal. Had a local draft to start and the pimento cheese appetizer. So yummy. Then I had the fried chicken (whit meat) with slaw, Mac and cheese and the mushrooms as sides. I must have eaten it in 5 minutes. Delicious! Would highly recommend eating here and that fact that they support the local community makes it all even better.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

kIe7sTCG0ZGgeMeVLEJXtg.text: Great lunch option for us coming in from s drive. Close to many hotels. Salads with proteins were made for us (grilled chicken breast and chicken salad). Chef made the chicken salad dairy free for the diner. Small beer selection but local brews. Cornbread was good. Waitstaff helpful. Nice atmosphere- there is a nice article about the mission of the owner in the foyer. You can ask for more information from your server. Nice that they help the neighborhood community. Nothing felt pushy and the meal was good.

RtlN0H01elGWOFy8nyntlw.text: Great food, great service, impressive business model.  I'll go back every time I'm in Charlotte.

3nofeb_R3uPns4MtmcYdEg.text: A friend and I took our 13-year-old sons for dinner.  We love the restaurant's concept of giving back to the community, and the boys were intrigued by the idea of a restaurant that donates all its profits to feed others.    Everyone loved the food.  Started with the hot pimento cheese dip in the bread bowl and only the fact that we were in public prevented a couple of us from licking the plate.  Followed with fried chicken & vegetables (3 of us) and one flounder & vegetables.  All were great -- the collard greens, butter beans, mac & cheese and mashed potatoes were favorites.  The biscuits were delicious -- I haven't had homemade biscuits that good since my grandmother was alive.  Just typing this is making me consider the drive uptown for those biscuits...    We finished by sharing three different desserts because we couldn't decide and wanted to try them.  The caramel cake was good, the s'more mud pie was great, and the banana pudding was so good the boys refused to share.  Servings were substantial; enough to make 13-year-old boys completely full!  Rodney was our server, and he didn't steer us wrong on anything. Get a table in his section and he'll take great care of you.  One more note:  when you get your check, there is a line at the bottom where you can add an amount (separate from the tip) for a donation to feed the hungry.  The servers don't ask you to contribute, so look for that if you're interested in donating.

wASXkXPoD27RanESrsZYaw.text: We all would give this place 6 stars if we could.  Incredibly tasty food.  We ate every morsel ordered and waddled out of the place so full and so happy.  Fantastic service, good prices, very casual atmosphere, good bar, and just awesome food.

LNiyBkwfHEjFOfNgjPTQKg.text: Love this place....good food, great service & best of all, the owners are Christians & the profits they make, go to help the homeless. They even have church service here on Sunday mornings for the homeless which to me, is amazing, because that is what we as Christians should be doing...spreading the love of our Father. If you haven't been, please come check it out. I promise, you won't be disappointed plus your money will be going for a good cause:)

M2aRwsjE8AOOR3NM67l3Kg.text: My bookclub met at King's Kitchen and we had a fabulous time! Brian our waiter was awesome and knew the wines perfectly! Everyone enjoyed their entrees. I had the salmon and spinach risotto- Delish!!! The local cheese plate is a must. And of course the banana pudding!!!!!

GfcX5x5lO-Vb9OVsukdESw.text: One year later and this restaurant is still going strong! I love the location, the food, and the service. I love supporting a restaurant that is helping others. My fav is the pan-fried chicken with delicious vegie sides pared with an OMB Copper, but I have tasted several other dishes and enjoyed them all!

KTgUu2dbHM2NGqWUsea4_w.text: David was our server and he was knowledgeable and attentive, also had a sense of humor. We had a LivingSocial Deal for the 1 app, 2 entrees& dessert. Wings (7) were our appetizer and they came with both ranch and bleu cheese. The macaroni was decent & the collards needed a dash of sugar.  Hats off for using Yukon gold potatoes for the potato salad, but it was missing salt and flavor despite the dill.  Cabbage and Yukon Gold mashed potatoes were good.  His salmon was nicely charred and flaky and my chicken was moist and lightly seasoned. The turtle pie was pretty good and the Hummingbird Cake was very tasty.   The decor is nice and the cause is great. We were not offered any of the cornbread which I thought was another well-known item for them. Oh well, we plan to return to try some of the other entrees.

D01UJP6LHug_SQFSM1eWNQ.text: The food was great, the service was great, and most of all -it's for a great cause. I love The King's Kitchen and will definitely return again soon! It's a great place for lunch in uptown!

EHaaI5ICZNivVTHeig8MoA.text: Outstanding in every way. GREAT food, GREAT service, friendly, professional, and well worth going to.

Y1LTbyrmBfSgiJuIQ9ZWKQ.text: Great concept and fantastic execution. That pork porterhouse was amazing! So were the sides! Should have tried their famous fried chicken, but that pork chop sounded too good to pass.

BTCjlOCaGfel7o8Wfw6ZRQ.text: I ordered the "Tega Hill Lettuces" entree salad with salmon, and was disappointed that only a quarter of the lettuce appeared to be local greens, while the rest was iceberg. The menu, in this case, is misleading. I suggest they rename the salad, or actually serve a salad with local greens.  Other than that, the biscuits were quite tasty, and I enjoyed the pimento cheese appetizer. The other diners all seemed to enjoy their more authentic Southern fare.

yTqZ2fLJghpqGvRzRSSadQ.text: I had the salmon and risotto, which was very good. The decor was clean and appropriate but not over the top. Gotta love the charitable nature of the restaurant too.

ClDHZVpocIK2pT3M9x1Gzw.text: My wife and I loved it!  Divine Southern cooking!  We are looking forward to returning later this month on our next road trip.

0bRE3hCgf83A0i5cL63VqQ.text: First of all, I love that this is a nonprofit doing such great things for the community. I think there should be more restaurants like this!   The food was very good, and very bad for you. I definitely fell into a food coma after dinner--ate too much heavy Southern cookin'!   The atmosphere was mostly nice, except for the TVs all over... I understand having TVs over a bar, that's fine, but there were TVs on the walls in the main dining room, which seemed really out of place and distracting, especially considering there was live jazz playing.

OAN3TFALhPTxqEzk6A6WNA.text: We stumbled across The King's Kitchen because we couldn't get into Room 112 and someone recommended King's. Because my heart swelled three sizes upon finding out they donate 100% of profits to feeding Charlotte's homeless, I would go again but I didn't find the food to be worth the cost.  The shrimp and grits came with five medium sized pieces of shrimp and about a cup and a half of grits. And while it was delicious, it wasn't $20 worth of food or preparation. Grits may be even cheaper than rice and beans and the shrimp (being a Charlotte restaurant and all) wasn't fresh caught.  Others bought the fried chicken dinner that came with dry cornbread or a biscuit (which was fairly good) and THREE sides for $14. Meh. The chicken wasn't fried long enough so the skin was soggy and juicy -- but not in a good way. In a way that screamed cook me longer. The cabbage isn't soul food cabbage but was quite firm and inedible for us real Southern girls. The macaroni and cheese was very good as was the mashed potatoes.   Another girl ordered the flounder and it didn't say in the description that it was fried. She ordered that because they'd run out of baked chicken and didn't want something the fried heaviness. So much for that.

wMr4gptHNEnS_6GbJJRaPA.text: I came here after reading a lot of glowing reviews of the place.  I thought it was just so so.  I ordered the ribs and the chicken.  Since this place is known for the chicken, I was waiting to be impressed.  It was just okay.  It was moist.  Probably one of the moist chicken I had, except it was super bland.  It didn't taste like it was seasoned at all, not even the skin!  But the vegetables were pretty awesome.  I had the carrots.  I didn't know carrots could taste so good.  Green beens were amazing.  Mac-n-cheese were just so so.  Then there was the ribs.  It was pretty good.  Well seasoned.  Fries were good.  Slaws were good.  Just all around solid here.  So for me, it was just a-ok.  Maybe I should've gone for the seafood stuff.  If you want good chicken, I would go to Mert's.  mmm mmm good...

K2M1KGrL8I8upn4c8Vj0DA.text: If it weren't for the mission of KK, I probably wouldn't visit again.  I've been a couple of times and tried different things.  The food is ok, but nothing special...especially for the price.  However, because of the mission I'm sure I will be back.

HYK-UMn7RPwAE6_O33myNg.text: Visiting Charlotte NC, so I had to try their fried chicken... Deliciously juicy and crispy. The sides were amazing, creamed sweet corn, coleslaw and mac&cheese. This was True comfort food!

mR_dVHN_hiA_SlaLRGlNIw.text: I'll be full for the next 6 hours. I don't think I needed chicken, black eyed peas, spinach and Mac and cheese, but I got it. You're southern grandma would make this food and also probably call mac and cheese a veggie, but who cares when it's that good? No one.

-8cMR1xRAb_q9EwKWtcmHQ.text: The idea is nice, that profit from operations will be used to help those in need. But the food is far under par. We tried the deviled eggs, which were similar to what you might expect if you bought them from the Food Lion deli counter. They were out of the ham and swiss sandwich, so I ordered the turkey club. It had absolutely no flavor. Quite astonishing, actually. How do you make a sandwich with turkey, bacon, and mayo, and yet it be completely bland. My wife had a "meat and 3", fried chicken. The collards were good because of the smoked ham. But otherwise everything was average at best. Portions of the sides were very small. Even though the food was relatively cheap, it still wasn't worth it. I feel sorry for people who live in Charlotte if this is one of the better places downtown. 3/23/12

Ob5vkU6caRqBzAZ-0aJB8g.text: Okay Resturant, everything was marginal, chicken was dry, what they stand for is great but if you want good food this is not the place.

S9xxMEc9iqTst7l8Rbtglg.text: The service was quite good, and they do really good work.  Even if the food was across-the-board mediocre, it would be worth eating here.  Luckily, it is much better than that.  We ate here twice during a recent trip to Charlotte.  The appetizers were all pretty good, with some being great (they had a special pear salad that was really super).  Wings were pretty good, smoky and sweet.  Pub cheese was also good.  I had the fried chicken the first night, with seared cabbage and mashed potatoes, and, well, it made me want to purge so I could eat it again.  The second time, it was a steak which was good but not amazing.  We only ordered desserts the first night.  I had a pear and berry crisp which was pretty good bout about 35 minutes in coming, which made it seem less delicious.  The service was good - attentive, willing to make suggestions, and told us about the good work using local farms and feeding local people who need feeding that the restaurant does.

Fn7F-anG8gJ7KZTz5H_j3g.text: Great food, great mission, and good service.  Came here last Thursday with three friends completely ignorant of the mission but based on a recommendation about the food (including a quick verification check of yelp). Strangely after looking at the menu none of us chose the fried chicken most seem to rave about but still enjoyed everything we received.  The oysters with bacon aoli were good enough that we got a second order and the smoked salmon was great but should come with more crostini.  The short ribs were fall off the bone perfect.  The scallops were perfectly finished but yield my normal complaint of it being too small of a portion.  The pork chop was was nice thick sliced chop properly cooked with a good amount of residual moisture.  Our server was very nice but certainly seemed to be more experienced working a lesser restaurants.  She had very general suggestions with the wine.  I wish I could remember her exact quote on which she preferred the salmon or the flat iron steak but it was something like "I like the steak better because its bigger" - ironic that I found this a poor commentary considering small or varied portion size is a pet peeve.  She made of for her lack of knowledge by refilling glasses and checking in several times as we slowly worked out way through dinner.  A discussion when the check came revealed the restaurant's mission.  Next time we'll try the fried chicken too.

SXR8hL755Qkz09RUo9XPkw.text: First of all, I give this place credit for donating profits to feed the hungry.  That's a great start.  It's located conveniently in downtown Charlotte.  We went while on travel for business.  The waitress was great - I had the Fried Chicken with three sides.  Chicken was delicious, the corn sweet, the collard greens fantastic.  Our table also ordered an appetizer spread - the fried oysters were prepared perfectly and the cheese plate was good too.  Only issue I had was that the cornbread was a little dry.  Would highly recommend for a casual business dinner or any kind of a group.

5IcwYy9Iy8FSch8ls4lapg.text: Love their fried chicken. Moist, not too much coating, good flavor. Not a big fan of the cornbread but they have lots of sides to choose from. Not to mention their sweet potato pie!

kuNSOUnnRJtyb1ZI1qAJ7A.text: I didn't care for the food at all. I had the fried chicken with mashed potatoes, butter beans and biscuit. The chicken was ok, the skin wasn't crispy but had good flavors. The mash potatoes were good, nothing special and the beans were in edible. Pile of mush and butter. Wouldn't recommend to anyone wanting good southern food.

7ILN52_reeKseKpXQMuJsw.text: Just visited with a group of 7. The service and food were amazing. Had the fried chicken with corn bread. The waiter was very nice checked on us frequently, and gave us good suggestions based on what he would get. Great job!! Wished I lived closer.

N9tFnpROz_Gxsj0lPXpJtQ.text: I'm the special events coordinator for a group that was recently in Charlotte for a conference.  We meet every year in a different American city, and part of my job is to organize a dinner with for the group.  This year, I brought everyone (about 30 people) out to King's Kitchen, and we had a terrific meal.  The food was great, the wine was great, and the service was great.  Our food came out together (a tough feat when plating 30 meal), and everything was really tasty.  So tasty, in fact, that some of our diners were upset when the restaurant ran out of pecan pie (I had some - it was delicious!).  Thanks, King's Kitchen, for a great meal!

gZc8yU8r_adU0D65fySXJQ.text: This place was excellent!!!  Super cute, modern ambience.  We went on a Friday night and a jazz band played some nice music.  The music was not overwhelming either.  You can easily hear everyone talk.  There were 9 of us and we got a nice table in the side room which gave us our own space.  I'd have to say that my only compliment was the size of my meal.  I got the salmon with pea risotto.  The portion was very small.  But, boy, did it taste fantastic.  I don't even like peas and I loved the risotto.  I noticed the steak meals were well-sized portions.  I had a salad with dressing that was homemade.  Absolutely delicious.  And then I split the brownie dessert with someone.  They add ice cream to it, which is a nice touch.  And, last by not least, I am a sucker for giving back to causes.  I love the concept of this place.  I would definitely go back again!

OVSFBhFdW_MhtXzit6EKNA.text: King's Kitchen is great in theory, and good in actual execution. The story/cause behind the restaurant is amazing, and one you should definitely read up on to truly appreciate the experience if you've never been - worthy of a 1-star bump in and of itself. As for the food, I find it really good at a reasonable price for an uptown sit-down experience.   When I visited this past weekend, I had the fried chicken plate with collard greens, mac-n-cheese, and creamed corn.  The chicken was definitely the highlight, with the collard greens a close 2nd.  The collard greens had a "kick" to them that made hot sauce unnecessary - a pleasant surprise. The creamed corn + mac-n-cheese was OK, but nothing to write home about. My wife also had a biscuit w/ muscadine jelly that was really good.  Lastly, the banana pudding was tasty, though nothing too outside of the norm.  Though I didn't partake, the beer list seemed formidable, and there were plenty of wine options, as well. Overall, a good dining experience built upon a great mission of community service in all directions. I'm definitely a fan.

3yDd-5J7UtMKmiNwSgWNKg.text: We discovered the existence of King's Kitchen based on a Living Social deal a few weeks ago. After seeing the number of ratings the place had we knew it was worth making the purchase. The deal was for one appetizer, two entrees and one dessert for $25, which was quite awesome. We headed down there for dinner tonight after taking in an afternoon hockey game and spending some time at the Mint Museum.  King's Kitchen is a nice little place right amid the hustle and bustle of Charlotte. Upon entering you find a bright, clean-looking restaurant with one of the nicest bars I've ever seen. I usually opt out of sitting at a bar, but if the need arose I wouldn't have any second thoughts about popping down there. The rest of the indoor tables are a bit close to each other, giving you little privacy, but I've been smushed more by other restaurants. There were also some tables in an outdoor area, but the wind was a bit much to deal with that. We had made reservations so upon entering we were seated quickly and our server came over shortly after to take drinks and whatnot.  We were a bit limited on what to order since there was a separate menu for those using the Living Social deal (something that was not mentioned anywhere on Living Social), and I wasn't crazy about the choice of appetizers. We ended up settling on the pimiento cheese ($5) with lavash (sp), which ended up being these really light crackers. The pimiento cheese had a nice spice to it, and definitely went well with the cracker. There was definitely an excess of cheese to cracker, at least for us, since the cheese was a bit much (spicy and rich) to be spread too abundantly over the crackers. They did offer us bread to sop up the remainder of the cheese which was nice, but with two full meals coming we decided to not stuff ourselves.  For dinner I ordered the fried chicken ($13) with butter beans, sea island red peas and roasted carrots. I went with the white meat, which consisted of breast and wing. The batter is nice and light, but I wish it had come out a bit crisper. The flavor was totally there and it tasted great, but the chicken was a bit drier than other fried chicken breast I've had. The butter beans were awesome, but I wasn't a fan of the red peas. I had never had them before so I have nothing to compare them to, but I just wasn't a fan of the overall flavor. The roasted carrots were crazy good, and I never thought I'd be raving about carrots after any meal. They are char broiled so they have all the black char on them and they are so soft and flavorful...almost tasted like sweet potatoes!  The only fish on the limited menu was fried flounder ($14), but the miss' isn't a big fan of fried foods. Luckily the folks at Kings Kitchen were kind enough to substitute that for the blackened catfish ($20) at no upcharge, which I was very grateful for. This blackened catfish knocked my socks off. It had the PERFECT level of spice...I like enough spice where my nose will run, but not too hot where I have to chug a gallon of milk after each little bite. This blackening spice was right at the threshold for me, where it met the maximum but did not stray over even a little. She also got the mac & cheese, creamed corn and collard greens. The mac & cheese  was good, but a little too mushy for us. I really loved the creamed corn...it had this sweetness to it that made it the perfect side. I was not a fan of the collards, but I don't really like any greens, so don't take my word on the collards to heart.  For dessert we split the chocolate and peanut butter cake with vanilla gelato.  I don't usually rave about a dessert, but this one is definitely worthy of it. The cake is a couple of layers of chocolate, peanut butter and ganache with some crispy layers thrown in also. The contrast of the soft cake to the crispiness worked well, and the ganache was simply indulgent. Then you had the heaping scoop of vanilla bean gelato. It was soooo rich and thick and the miss' detected a hint of some spice (possibly cinnamon) that really brought the flavor out. When you combined a little spoon of gelato with a spoon of the cake, you really had the ultimate dessert.  Kings Kitchen definitely dishes out some slammin' Southern cuisine, and I love that they do it for a good cause at a great price with heaping portions. While some of the food was totally spot on, some of it was also lacking a bit. If I could dish out 4 1/2 stars I would, but I think there are a couple of things keeping it from 5 stars. Still, I totally recommend heading down to get some serious eats on.

DN4rGIwrh_zxAOSEe8y1Lg.text: My favorite place in Charlotte. You'll have no self-respect after eating so much, but you won't regret it. The caramel cake is addictive.

YRlcH1FtBZWzvOlFgb5YwQ.text: What I ate:  Cornbread, Biscuits, Fried Chicken, Mac & Cheese, Green Beans & Roasted Carrots, Local Dark Beer  The food was very good, not the best I've had here, but very good.  The fact that this place is non-profit and donates proceeds to the hungry makes it a worthwhile experience.  The servers were very attentive and friendly.    If you're in Charlotte and want a nice ambiance with good American food, go here.

Pf0bMoVB6JcgNO3OAlN8OA.text: Went to Kings Kitchen tonight for dinner. The service was excellent. The shrimp and grits gave me an entirely new perspective on life. AMAZING. My dinner companions said the chicken was good but not any better than popeye's however everyone said their sides were fantastic. I ordered the Mac n cheese as my side and it was better than out of the box but nothing special. Bottom line a good meal but if you are expecting "soul food" like Sunday dinners at your grandma's house expect to be disappointed. That being said, still one of the best meals Charlotte.

6rnMDgzDl16l-Y2sptgMxw.text: this nonprofit restaurant offered a very filling lunch! I went here on a yelp review and let's not disappointed very good southern food!

lPPOOM7vn3RBWdDkmaPE2A.text: I enjoyed my dining experience here for the most part.  I am born in raised in north Florida though and have very high standards for southern cuisine.  I dined with my girlfriend and we had a Living Social for 1 app, 2 entrees, and 1 dessert.  Good thing we did though because I still ended up spending $40 on 4 drinks and the tip.   But hey, it's uptown, I need to start accepting that.....Or should I?  I thoroughly enjoyed the fried oyster appetizer.  It came with a bacon vinaigrette and cocktail sauce for dipping.  I wasn't wowed by the vinaigrette like I thought I would be, but the cocktail sauce made up for it.  We both ordered the meat and 3, and we both ordered flounder as the meat!  I always try to order something different from her, but I just wasn't feeling the other options of salmon, flank steak, or fried chicken (yes, the chicken was tempting, but I didn't want to have to pick at anything during my meal).  I thought the flounder was fried perfectly.  It was a little salty, but I have a salty palate so I liked it.  The sides are what I really thought could have been better.  When I think about southern cuisine, it's all about the sides, bottom line.  I ordered the mac n' cheese, cheese grits, and mashed (creamed) potatoes.  The potatoes were pretty good, but I make better mac n' cheese and grits at home.  When I go out for southern cuisine, I want to eat food that's better than what I make myself.  The mac didn't have enough cheese and tasted very eggy.  The grits weren't thick enough and made me wish I had ordered something different.  I can't really remember what she had as sides, oh well.....  The dessert left something to be desired as well.  It didn't taste homemade, but who knows.  We had the turtle pie.  I would eat here again with a Living Social, but honestly if I'm in search of getting my southern fat kid on, I'm heading over to Dish.

TdXdt6KwxMJvjYntvu6DwA.text: Comfort food at it's best. Fried chicken was sold out so I had the roast chicken which was very flavorful , mashed creamy good , butter beans yummy, sauteed cabbage delicious. Biscuits were phenomenal. Husband had vegetable plate and roast carrots looked awesome. I love the concept of this restaurant that other Yelpers referred to. Service pleasant and efficient . Wish I had this restaurant near home.

9QCJZsk5IQDXyrm-2luusA.text: This place is great! Nice location and great food. I sat outside and enjoyed the weather and the scenery.   Normally when I eat, I seem to end up eating my meat first and veggies/sides last. Well this was a first. The creamed potatoes and cabbage were the two best things on my plate! They were finished before anything. The mac and cheese was good also. The fried chicken was not the best I've ever had, but definitely not bad.   The only reason I can't give it 5 stars is because of the cornbread. Weird, especially since they have a bakery attached, but the cornbread was not good at all. One bite, and I placed it on the side, and never touched it.  I also had the cheese plate appetizer which was delicious.

hcPY6UPMWJCbdLrtqHhB0w.text: Went after finding the miniature menu in my hotel's lobby.  Asked my server for a few recommendations and settled on the skillet fried chicken with three sides, mac and cheese, Rosa's green beans, and Anson mills cheese and bacon grits.  The chicken was entirely underwhelming. It was pale, not cooked crisp and seemed to have been rushed out of the kitchen. Won't bother with that again.  The sides however were entirely delightful. Next time I may just make a meal out of the sides.  Not sure if I'll be back.

XDMRUFhLTN7V8J90fuJfRA.text: After reading the reviews, I was excited to try the King's Kitchen.  While I'm glad this palce helps out the less fortunate, the food was disgusting.  The cornbread and biscuits were dry flavorless.  I had the fried chicken dinner with mashed potatoes and mac n cheese.   The chicken was soggy and not seasoned.  The mashed potatoes and mac n cheese were not good.  Frankly, I've had better food from a tv dinner.

GAQMBZevE6PMEihDPBkFOQ.text: I don't know where to start.  The fact that this is a not for profit restaurant, the crowd, the staff or the amazing food.   Horrace was my server and a True gentleman.  He gave me that background on the restaurant and a guided tour of the menu.  After several minutes to ponder my path tonight, I arrived at Jimmy's wings, the peach glazed pork chop with hoppin Jon and finished with banana pudding.  I remember sitting back from my chop and dreading my last bite as this amazing dish was coming to an end.  I have traveled the country and eat in a lot of great chop houses and no where can even touch what the executive chef has created here.  Words cannot describe the flavor that crosses your lips on every bite.  Watching other diners around me, I noticed the same look of extreme satisfaction on their faces as well from the first bite to the end.  Finally, the banana pudding was as sweet and smooth as silk.  If your in the Charoltte downtown area and want to contribute to a great cause stop by The Kings Kitchen and take part in a culinary adventure.

f_MrmD-LiJlwbwZvxNkHew.text: Very slow service on a Wednesday night.  Fried chicken was good, but I have had better mac and cheese and green beans.  My dining companion was disappointed that her greens were cooked in pork, and not in turkey.

aLFB61VRHSulcjfSpQujdA.text: 4.5 stars, but not a 5, so they get a 4.  Great fried chicken.  Delicious banana pudding.  Upscale home cooking comfort food.  Nice place and great staff.

PSMUcIww0ffztrLtn5Xaew.text: Just had lunch there with a friend. The sides I got were about what I expected, but the fried catfish was excellent! Nicely breaded without being greasy. Flaky, not mushy and seemed fresh. So big and meaty I thought I was eating cod or haddock. Service prompt, friendly and attentive.

Vl-jGfejZjW1_FxFtpRkhA.text: Terrific southern food , great service right in the heart of uptown! Love that this is a non-profit with such a noble mission.  Cornbread was amazing!  We will be back soon!!!

AMwcTRyMmZS3UKLxoqBiJg.text: Had dinner on the patio outside. The waiter, Dave, was great -- he was the soul of hospitality and service with a clear passion for the food. We tried the deviled eggs, iceberg salad, steak with cheesy grits, creamed corn, and mashed potatoes. Banana pudding for dessert. Everything was solid.

g2OD9LlsTnfuL-pvcRaBaQ.text: how much fried chicken can you southerners eat? jesus. service was pretty good, im not crazy about homeless people making my food but it was good. im new to shrimp and grits and it just seems to get better every time i have it. i even begged the waitress to get me a fruit plate for dessert (not on menu) and she delivered, so i was pretty happy.

G7DvJJLy-alB41HSYaZDXA.text: I can't add much to the other reviews.  The food is great, I like the atmosphere a lot; perfect for business or pleasure. The service was good and the business model is inspiring.

c5VMQFyEycvqHdEe8OcXIw.text: Dined here for lunch with a group of coworkers. There were 10 of us and when we called about an hour ahead as we usually do in these situations, we were told they didn't have room for a party our size as they already had reservations for several parties. The lunch was for a coworker's birthday and she wanted to go anyway, so we did and ended up all having to sit at the bar, which was fine. I'm glad we stuck it out! The decor is modern and a little funky but very nice and classy. The staff we encountered were all friendly, helpful and quick and the food was really good! I think everyone in our group enjoyed what they got. And the lunch prices were really very reasonable... the only thing we were a bit put off by was the high price of the desserts (all $6 each - the meals themselves were $7-10 for the most part so it seemed odd to pay almost that much for a average size slice of cake/pie) but a few of us indulged anyway and everything was delicious. I personally don't eat out uptown often at all but if I'm ever presented with the opportunity to eat there again, I definitely will and I recommend it to anyone who wants to check it out. Oh... and all of this is on top of the fact that they some (or all?) of their profit goes to help the homeless in our community.

HYl6GsID0RR-Tm0vQnVnOw.text: I really wanted to like this restaurant.  They give all their proceeds to charity, the set up is cool, their wait staff incredibly friendly, and their southern menu items look great on paper.  But the food itself was so greasy.  The chicken and mac n cheese were glistening.  The corn bread was fried in butter...sounds like it was taste amazing, but it just tasted like a little crunchy cube of butter with no hint of corn at all.  The 3 stars is for the great wait staff and charity cause, otherwise food would get a 1.5.

3ixE7qvGq8-GLsVekPGYuQ.text: Had the most delicious dinner here before going to the symphony.  Deviled eggs were tasty, and I had the Catfish with fried cabbage and creamed corn.  My wife had the Mahi with mac&cheese and collard greens.  Everything was delicious, and we both loved it!  Also, the server was attentive and polite.

do9hO0cGeQZgoqOxWY6NFQ.text: 5 STARS bc of its cause/mission/message, otherwise it would be an extremely strong 4 star if based solely on food and atmosphere. i had been wanting to go here for a while after hearing and reading about it. i love jim nobles roosters, loved nobles and had an opportunity to get a great living social coupon to kings kitchen so i bought one. we went in last night and never in a million years would i say it tasted like my moms or grandmothers cooking bc that is saying A LOT and very cliche. (side note: my mom grew up in the kitchen and in deeply southern fam and produced perfectly prepared southern classics, then she became a schooled gourmet chef in her spare time bc she wanted to broaden her art) anyway, the mac'n'cheese tasted exactly like my aunts, which is my favorite on earth, simple, classic...perfect. the creamed potatoes w/ white gravy and black eyed peas freaked me out b/c they were EXACTLY like my moms, yes, i know one of the reason why is bc they use bacon fat in a lot of the veggies....GOOD that stuff is what dreams are made of and these two veggies blew me away... and finally the skillet fried chicken, thick crispy crust, perfectly cooked, lightly seasoned, pretty sure the use peanut oil to fry their chicken and it tasted EXACTLY and I mean EXACTLY like my grandmothers which isnt the best friend chicken i have ever had but it was phenomenal. i think there can be different types of friend chicken and if you want good old classically prepared fried chicken this is the best in charlotte, followed closely by myers park cc and then probably prices. they brought us some perfect biscuits and delicious cornbread to start, she got the flounder and was blown away by it and the collards (which they brought out with the proper side cars in both types of vinegars) we also got a really good rose to drink. we had a perfect server, dylan who we knew had recently started working there and he treated us perfectly and he knows his stuff. i was really really impressed by the place and will def be back many many times in the future. hats off to jim noble once again, this guy knows what he is doing and is doing it for the greater good which is to be commended.

9GsIY2lQeL6JwTsKBdWSGQ.text: Southern fare for the greasy at heart  Work buddy & I came to King's Kitchen right after arriving in Charlotte - she was looking for something farm to table-esque & had been here before & liked it a lot  Started w/ a couple of beers & man oh man do they have an awesome selection!  I chose the Duck Rabbit Stout & it was bold & creamy & had a lovely chocolate undertone - perfect for me!  Work buddy chose a darker IPA, as recommended by our waiter & he steered her right - she loved the balance of hops but no bitterness  Offering NO real veggie entrees except for "Plate of Southern Vegetables" which is a combo of 4 veggie side dishes & a biscuit ( pathetic! ), I got an appie & a side for my meal & chose the Sweet Potato Fritter and the Mac N Cheese  The fritters were awful - I was expecting something semi-light like a hush puppy but these were dense & heavy & completely over-fried to the point they were almost black & hot as napalm....totally burned my mouth throughout the meal - they never cooled down!    Even so, these fritters were still raw on the inside - not sure how that could be accomplished.  There was way too much ginger & not enough sweet potato flavor & the honey dipping sauce which I suspected had a ton of corn syrup in it, due to its abnormally thick consistency, just put everything over the top  The Mac N Cheese came out in this teeny bowl & it also had a greasy consistency to it - no stringy pulls of cheese but a gloopy, congealed bechamel w/ strong white pepper flavor  And from those glowing descriptions, it's obvious I was not a fan of my "meal" at all - left over half & this is coming from a Southern girl who loves her comfort food!!  - 2 stars!  Work buddy got the Shrimp & Grits & it was classic NOLA / Southern deliciousness - creamy grits & they didn't skimp on the shrimp!  She was a fan - 4 Stars  All adds up to an average 3 Stars - I prob wouldn't come back here to eat but to indulge in their wide variety of beers, that'd be a different story

ni8NdDM6CoOB7aNffKPvVg.text: I've been coming to Charlotte for a few months and this is my go to spot. The service is top notch and the food is incredible. It's such an incredible concept, I hope more cities create places like this.   The mac n cheese is of course melt in your mouth good. The sweet potato fritters are sweet and salty goodness. And the fried chicken melts in your mouth good. Everything I've tried is amazing.

_4fee1UBJt3K_okQ3J8zDA.text: Absolutely delicious!!! Fast service and home cooked dinner. sever was nice and precise. love the cause of the restaurant, will definitely come back in the near future.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Kings Kitchen

3J5cW-PB38XSMZCL1Ut7Tw.text: Wow! We were sitting at another resturaunt in the Epicenter and looking over a menu that looked less than appetizing. My husband jumped on Yelp and discovered this place is only a couple blocks away. This was the best decision of the night! This restaurant has such a cute shabby-chic factor that I love and a few private dining rooms that I'm possibly interested in reserving in the future. My husband and I tried the pot roast, fried chicken, creamed potatoes and gravy, creamed corn, collard greens, green beans, and macaroni and cheese. The sides are the most amazing Southern tasty treats I have ever had! We had banana pudding for dessert and it was so delicious. We brought friends from out of state and they loved it! My husband and I will definitely be back. The great thing about this establishment is that it is completely non profit and all proceeds go to feeding the homeless in Charlotte. What a great way to give back to your community by dining here. This is a must stop for Uptown Charlotte. As an added bonus, there is a full bar!

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

vhicv9wxsQ-bHZ96sUzQ5Q.text: Established in 2010, The King's Kitchen donates 100% of profits from sales to feed the poor in the Charlotte region.  And while every penny of profit at The King's Kitchen has a higher calling, each bite of the food served to patrons, features Chef Jim Nobel's "New Local Southern Cuisine." Specialties include premium Carolina organic produce paired with fine southern meats!  So that first paragraph is a synopsis of the establishments mission...feed the body, nourish the soul and help thy neighbor... and nobody does it better!  Fresh, tasty and ALL done to perfection.  On our lunch menu for this Wednesday afternoon, Ms Funk and I shared:  A Beet salad with Goat Lady Chevre, Arugula, Toasted Almonds & Sorghum Vinaigrette. The addition of chicken or grilled salmon was available, we opted to pass as our Pannini had chicken. A perfect combination of sweet and savory.  A Sourdough Panini with Tomato, Arugula, Pimento Cheese and perfectly grilled Chicken that could not have been tastier paired with the house prepared potato salad, possibly the best we've ever had.  Ms Funkette chose the day's special: A steak burger with local lettuce, tomato, house prepared condiments and frites on the side... and yes it was a beautifully prepared medium rare steak. Not ground, not chopped but perfectly grilled and tender!  Maybe you've picked up on the whole "perfect" thing going on at this eatery.  Well, that would be perfectly fine with us!

U1_VaF82EzV0WS2jdZijyw.text: I love the concept and the great things this place does for the community and less fortunate. For that, I would give them a 5 star. However, grading them on my meal I have to go lower.   I got the following meal to go since I got there right before closing.  Fried chicken with side of asparagus, mac and cheese, collard greens, and corn bread. The chicken was decent but not that fresh and all of the sides were disappointing and salty.  Maybe I just got an end of day batch but I had higher expectations from this place based on the hype from many.

0gpzVa4vldbPZgqIhSmAQg.text: Went there based on reviews from Yelp. Food was great - tomato brisque, ravioli, coconut cake - and service was excellent as well. Highly recommended!

zTRyWxUu73-GW01QvAwmgA.text: If you want a home-cooked southern meal this is the place!  Great cause, atmosphere, food and service.  I had fried chicken with potato salad, coleslaw and a biscuit.  All yummy!  Decent wine list too!!!  I would go back!

WD82VPVA3egoD-uIp5YA9w.text: Great restaurant with an even better mission. Food was fresh and creative. Service was also wonderful gave an extra big tip.   Decor is cool but noisy.   Had a hard time hearing the conversation at our table.   I definitely recommend the shrimp and grits.

Cdb7PgeGetnsZYmU3hlkzQ.text: This place was a big let down. I can't understand the reviews they have gotten. We shall not be back. Food was over priced, cold food . Big let down.

XWb-N_xj_rXg8HYvdtfWkQ.text: Been here a few times sporadically for lunch over the last few years and it was always a good 'meat and three'.   We decided to visit again after seeing the chef featured in Happenings magazine.   The staff was very attentive and the experience was great.  We ordered the cheese plate which had three great local North Carolina cheeses. We also had two of the daily specials, the grouper and the strip steak.  The presentation was fantastic as was the food.  And it was deliciously clean as it seemed void of over seasoning, butters, or creams.  We will be back!

VSFIcZH8MkBkrgm8D0L5YA.text: I can't explain how disappointed i am with this place. Even though the portion size are extremely small i continue to come because I  love their fried chicken mac & cheese  and sweet corn . But the past three occasion where i either invited family or was dining alone they were out everything . What business is out of fried chicken or mac& cheese, Corn, green beans at 6pm. This past Monday was the last straw. I mostly liking with not return due to the poor management in keep menu avaiable more often.

bQlRyl4j7K8dJ5Hta6IaqQ.text: The greens are the best we had. But the rest of the food was mediocre to okay. The fried chicken want seasoned. The biscuits were terribly dry. The craft beer list was excellent.

1boFlbwMV4Uf5uZF6lgIHQ.text: wonderful food, amazing amotsphere, great for celebrating. Proceess go to homless as well, highly recommend. My server, Joe, was the bomb.com

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

G9TOo47doXcCE5ZA5lHIhQ.text: My husbands family and I dined here last night and everything was wonderful. Our server was very polite, knowledgable and also exceeded our expectations. The manager visited our table and was genuinely interested in making sure we were satisfied. Three of us had side salads - Tega hills lolla Rossa which comes with a delicious honey vinaigrette dressing and the beet salad. My husband's dad ordered the gumbo soup which he enjoyed and thought the scallions added a lot of flavor. We each selected an entree. Two of us had the shrimp and grits, a plentiful dish with great flavor. My husband and his dad order the porkchop. Very tasty and a sizeable portion!! I love how their mission in helping other people!  We will definitely be back!!

Ji347QIlCvjExeqRMwaMvw.text: This is a great purpose-driven restaurant. The owner feeds the homeless, hired the disadvantaged and yet customers are not disadvantaged. The service was exceptional, friendly and helpful.  The food is well prepared traditional southern fare.  I had the excellent fried chicken, my son had a delicious Pork Chop.  The sides were excellent, the Mac and Cheese some of the best I've ever had. The creamed corn was great 2 and the Pimento Cheese Appetiser was tasty with a tiny bit of a bite.  For dessert my son had a superb Lemon Meringue Pie I had a competent banana pudding which  was topped off with a toasted Meringue  This one is a winner!.

bMylKiYLaDbaIUfC8pnH4Q.text: I had high hopes for this place, but I was sadly disappointed. I love their mission but not the food. It was luke warm at best. My friends had the burger though which they said was incredible so maybe it was just my food that wasn't very good.

RO4GLwynAD7Kuc5MtGZntw.text: This is a really great place! I had the vegetable plate with collards greens, green beans, black eyed peas and Mac and cheese. All were very flavorful and the Mac and cheese is some of the best I've ever had. The collards were not over cooked, not greasy or too sweet. They had a little bit of spice which made it really good. Staff was very friendly and service was excellent.

igLGmiOstVJVo3Ex0ZlCZQ.text: Great soul food! We were here on a weekend vacation from Chicago and were staying at the hotel across the street. The hotel staff recommended Kings Kitchen, glad they did. The fried chicken was spectacular and huge portions for the price. The atmosphere is trendy in an old school way. We noticed a large group of homeless near the entrance, the waiter mentioned that everyday they hold bible study for the homeless and the serve them a good meal for free. Proceeds from their sales go back to help the community, this place is amazing!

ImfEGlDU98YsPTx5ZfWIRw.text: Delish fried chicken and great mission. Mashed potatoes are awesome, would love to have grits on the menu at lunch!

UZxvvRXdJlWb2CjjTiQpnQ.text: Best service, great atmosphere, delicious food (southern cooking at its best) especially the banana pudding.   Now for the best part, they are non-profit.  Feeding the hungry through the restaurant proceeds and raising up those who need another chance.     great food and a higher cause-can it get any better.  Highly recommended

-mgR8lkzjzayxLMjFMtZeA.text: Herb roasted chicken was good, but I wish I had just done all sides.  I enjoyed the zucchini the best.  Jalapeno cornbread was really good.  We did not get to try dessert.   Great service- We had a party of 7 and the waiter didn't blink at separating the check.

TK8CtJb03xrzn1WWfPmiQQ.text: Yum. You have to try this place! Not only does it support a noble cause, but the food and service and atmosphere AND wine list are among the best in Charlotte! Try the fried chicken, the zucchini and tomato side, the roasted okra, the Spanish garnacha, and do NOT forget to save room for dessert.
