My only request - Kings Kitchen, please bring back that scrumptious caramel cake!!! I have rarely tasted a cake that wonderful and I miss it!

w2zU6AXGOEOv9s4iw5vPHg.text: Sorry King's Kitchen... I'm knocking my 5-star review down to a 3-star based on recent visits. I'm not sure what has caused the noticeable change, but the service has been pretty bad the last two times I've been there in recent months. And the food? Not what it used to be. This was one of my fave, go-to places in Charlotte (I'd recommended it a dozen times to friends, uptown coworkers, & out-of-towners), but no more. Even 3-stars seems generous at this point.  Food took forever to order & receive both times. Orders were wrong. We never got any corn bread (despite asking for it twice!). Water refills were non-existent. Dessert was not impressive. It could just be me, but it appears they don't offer the same amount of side items anymore (or they've changed their variety to less healthy options that no longer appeal to me). And did their portions get smaller while their prices got bigger? Again, it could just be me. Or perhaps I'm more sensitive to the prices when the food & service are so disappointing.  My husband had visited a few other times for lunch and warned me, but I tried to stay optimistic and hoped he was wrong about the changes. Alas, he was right (as usual!), and I'm left searching for a new, favorite dinner spot.

u0a1FAxGQ9TEoSidsQ4A6g.text: We give this spot a 5-star review mainly because of what King's Kitchen is about - helping those less fortunate to get back on their feet and the poor and needy.  As we were walking into the restaurant we actually saw a man who appeared to be homeless asking what appeared to be a manager or owner of this restaurant to buy him a burger.  We were impressed to see that this man fulfilled his request without a question by walking to the kitchen door (which was open to the outside) and calling into the cooks to prepare the man outside a burger to his liking.  The service was exceptional and we really enjoyed the food!  We recommend everyone to dine here and support this restaurant which has a worthy cause behind it... a rarity these days.

Jh96T9eauwKfWvofMVHHSw.text: I have been wanting to try this place out since we moved here, and last night my boyfriend and I finally got our opportunity. We came at 8 pm for dinner, probably a little later than their normal customer base on a Monday night, but we did not feel unwelcome. we were immediately sat and given refreshments. I am a vegetarian, so I was so excited that I could get a meal of just sides--- i guess this may not be every vegetarians dream, but it is mine. We love good hearty southern food, and that is exactly what this place delivered. We started with the pimento cheese and bread, which set the tone for an amazing meal, it was some of the best pimento cheese ever, and the bread was perfect! literally everything we ate we commented on how excellent it was. I'm mad we didn't try this place sooner! for the price, you get a ton of food... it feels as though your eating thanksgiving dinner, above that, your money goes to a great cause! This place is a MUST try.

mzuoTgHOEi7JEMs9IkYWgw.text: I really like KK. The decor is wonderful, and I don't usually comment on decor--it's simple, tasteful, and genuine, just like the food. Breakfast biscuits are a bit pricey but Huge, with thick cut bacon. I had one phenomenal shrimp and grits dinner where every bite was perfection and then another meal where my fried chicken was really dry, so I'm not sure how consistent it is--time will tell. The bacon cornbread appetizer radiates butter, but it's delicious and worth the temporary waddle. If you are uptown and jonesing for meat and three, this is a good standby.  I want to power down a star for the bakery bread, but can't bring myself to because I really do like what they are trying to do. The baguettes are all sourdough (strange and taste specific), and one was already fairly stale the day I bought it. Still, I think they are working on getting the bakery wheels turning steadily, so that's okay. And I know if I had gone back and said it was a little old, they probably would have given me a fresh one without a fuss. Nice folks work here.  Update--this place has stayed interesting, but the addition of a massive cross in the center of the dining room is a bit much. It's pretty churchy vibe now, less like a quiet urban southern food today than it was.

S_zscwMJPAsoSqtrfX6Nug.text: Me and my son ordered the fried chicken darkmeat and it was tasteless and dry. We had corn bread, black eyed peas, Mac and cheese, creamed spinach and buttered beans. Mostly all dry and in desperate need of Seasoning. Way over priced for the tiny portions.

kMjigk0iCJrE149fJbJ3Gg.text: King's kitchen never disappoints.  Quality food and service.  The pan fried chicken was terrific, as were the greens and creamed corn.  The black eyed peas were good.  The local beer selection could improve, and would add to the 'local' feel if the place.  The wall of names demonstrate the ties to the community.

ZWxNms8_y3ibw8p8AqV5HQ.text: The new "grab-N-go" European style menu is awesome.  Croissants, Danish and Sweets.. are all excellent.   Buttery, flaky croissants stuffed with ham n cheese, Swiss n mushroom or chocolate. Yum-o!! The Danish are light, sweet and full of flavor.  The Sweets include, a to die for brioche sticky bun, sticky, sweet and topped with pecans, excellent with a coffee. Muffins are tender and loaded with nuts or fruit. The cookies...huge and crispy, soft. All things considered, the grab-N-go grabbed my taste buds and took them on a most delicious ride. Thanks to the Bakers in the Kings Bakery for bringing European style sweets to my back yard in a BIG way.

rx9svPLKrEwnnstiezwgQw.text: Been there once.  I went to support a friends birthday party.  I enjoyed the clean environment.  Their service was great.  Their food was a bit pricey for me considering they served a lot of southern and not so health-conscious meals.  The food was very fresh, good quality.  Would go again if I have a special occasion to attend.

ixzKoHICU9jDalpLlAIdRA.text: Not as good as I expected. I ordered the fried oyster to start and was completely displeased. The service was not that great as well. Not returning anytime soon

gcsCuInVPRH52_eCKrdm-A.text: May be my new favorite spot in Charlotte.  I love supporting a local place over a chain--King's Kitchen is a non-profit, with 100% of profits going to feed Charlotte's homeless AND they employ homeless and give them job skills to be successful in the restaurant industry.  I ordered lunch and had a glass of wine while I waited.  (Washed my hands before eating and the restroom was spotless.)  The Event Coordinator, Joseph, let my friend and I both try the glass of wine we ordered before we bought it, and made wine suggestions based on what we liked, (ie: I said I liked Pinot Grigio, not too sweet, and he suggested the Pinot Gris.  My friend loved Chardonnay--Joseph said he had a Napa Chard and a French Chard, and the French was his favorite.)  Nowhere else does that.  The sandwich I got-sourdough Panini with chicken, was fantastic.  The sourdough had the right amount of butter, and had grill marks like it had been done on a real grill, as opposed to something electric.  The chicken breast was a good size, and the pimento cheese on the sandwich was so good.  The flavor and texture of the beans was fantastic--flavored with pork and not mushy like some.   Atmosphere was fantastic so I was definitely not wanting to go back to work.  Can't wait to bring people here.  I've passed this place so many times and I'm only mad I didn't try it sooner!

4UXykxnvY_hftSkqgZgH7A.text: Excellent food and service that supports the community with jobs and opportunities that may not otherwise be available. Love this place. Great place to eat if you are staying at the Marriott or any of the nearby hotels. I have eaten there twice and will return every time I have the opportunity.

si28eyuOxWCZScldFRC1TA.text: Great place to eat. All the food was just awesome. The salmon was excellent - some of the best in Charlotte. Service was awesome as well. A must place for dinner - hoping to try it out for breakfast and lunch soon!!!

1unXejT54prNmN6j3dvYaQ.text: I read the reviews before picking this place, so I felt confident making reservations here. We were immediately seated, but it went downhill from there. At 8, they were out of fried chicken, one of their signature dishes. The resturant was only 1/3 full at this time of night, and the kicthen seemed to be struggling to keep up. The bread hit our table exactly 2 minutes before our entree. My meal, shrimp and grits, was near perfect.   My husband ordered the pan seared scallops, and was told he would get 3 scallops on a bed of succotash. Well, what he got was 1 scallop, and another scallop that was sliced in half. How do we know? First it was thin, then we saw each was only seared on one side--because it was cut in half!  My son's porkchop was grossly overcooked.....way too dry. We will pay for a good meal, but to order something and not get it...not cool. We spend a lot of time in Charlotte, but we will never come back here again. Would I recommend this place?  No!  If I could have given it a zero I would have.

Q6lVKDpfs8S6cLRoDzbGuQ.text: really great service and food. I love the whole concept of this restaurant. we all had such a great time. thank you.

Ozj4JOFaLIW3xiLiPE44Og.text: Went for lunch last week - walking distance from Discovery Place makes it a great stop for a visit after. Good for kids especially if they are old enough to understand the story behind the restaurant. The mashed potatoes are insanely good so is the mac and cheese, I had the chicken salad, my husband had the chicken sandwich - would love to go back for dinner without the kids - will be back!

vpMS1h_VkGRasJJsPKuRiw.text: Great place for breakfast in Charlotte. Excellent service. The buckwheat pancakes were amazing. Thank you to our server deana for being amazing.

utq4AotEGqwU-lTQjAoz-g.text: Another Fabulous dinner for 4! All different meals all great for a great price with great service. Not our first time here nor our last

E8J0qFjOZl-nl5FGVmWLYw.text: We were a large party celebrating my grandmother's birthday. One reason we came was because of the generous background of the restaurant, and the fact that they use their profits for a good cause.  They gave us a private area for our meal, which was really nice except that we were split into 2 tables. Our waitress was really nice and attentive, but slow. She struggled to open our wine bottles, but she worked really hard to please us. She had much more patience with my parents, who could not pick a wine, than I would have. She also lit the candles on the cake we brought in and cut it for us. I really liked her, even though she would disappear for a long time. We ended up spending 3 hours there for dinner.  My food was good. I loved the cornbread, and the biscuits were great! I loved the moscato that we ordered by the bottle. I had the sweet potato fritters, which were really good especially with honey. I ordered the pork chop, which was good considering I don't usually eat that. I recently discovered brussel sprouts (because my mom didn't like them, I ate them for the first time this year at the age of 23!) and they were made with vinegar I believe, the macaroni and cheese was good, and I don't remember what else I had. The portion sizes were small, but really I think they're what normal people eat and we should stop expecting plates that feed 4. NC has a high enough obesity rate.

_MXlL9F_SuxuQ-e-mij5IQ.text: This is a great spot for either lunch or dinner. Inexpensive ($10-$12) and you get more than enough food. The fried chicken is amazing and comes with 3 sides (they are all incredible). The servers are also extremely friendly and on top of their ish. I will definitely be back.

ORsP9HejiqLpd4OpToMoPQ.text: I have been there before for dinner and have no complaints on their food. I went there for lunch today and ordered a salmon salad. They charged me $22 ($10 just for lettuce and an additional $12 for the salmon). I really think their menu prices were misleading. I have never been anywhere and charged $22 for a salad. I really think they should consider offering salads at fair market value.

EjvFQz3T1_pi1o1wOpTEDg.text: My wife and I went to kings Kitchen about a year ago and had some of the best southern style food ever; fried chicken, collards, cabbage and mashed potatoes and gravy.  So, we were in town with some friends and on my recommendation we went there.  Later that evening our friends said next time they would pick the restaurant and that I put too much consideration into ambiance.  The service was great and the  waitress was knowledgeable of the food and the beers.  But when my food arrives the drumstick seemed like it had been taken out from yesterdays cooking and microwaved.   The thigh was pretty good as was the rest of the plate but it was cold.  I don't understand it because the food was so great the last time.  Hopefully the coldness of the food was a glitch... but a tough and tasteless chicken leg from a place that is suppose to specialize in fried chicken is unforgivable.

oavKQrXsr8ms0aGXY1C9XA.text: Tried this spot after passing it a few times. Seated right away. Staff friendly and our server was very nice. The fried chicken was A plus! The cornbread was dry... Like day old bread. That really made my meal less enjoyable. I heard a server tell someone at the table next to us they had run out of whatever he had ordered and naturally, he was disappointed but seemed to enjoy his replacement. I will go back.

HgeLSxZNRYV-OeEHHgGrQg.text: Third time here from NYC and never disappointed!  Tonight I had the bone in pork chop. Made me soooooo happy! You must eat here when in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork chop

Ur1oFu-D7CPMOpWfVDISxg.text: I came here for a work dinner recently and it was my first time at The King's Kitchen. They were amazing about getting me a fairly last minute reservation for 9 people and we ended up with kind of a private room. Our server was really great especially with all the special requests we had going on. We tried the pimento cheese dip and crostini which I actually really liked a lot. I went for the pan fried chicken and for my 3 sides I did the southern green beans, mac and cheese, and creamed corn. So first off, they were out of white meat, it was a bit of a disappointment, but not a deal breaker. The chicken was okay, but not a ton of flavor. There just wasn't any spice to it. The green beans were delicious, and the mac and cheese was seriously work dying for!! I was instantly transported to Sunday potlucks at church. I'm talking True southern mac and cheese, yumm! The corn was decent, but I could have done with double mac and cheese and been happier. I also got a biscuit which was delicious. Normally in a situation like this I'd probably only give 3 stars because the food wasn't super impressive. However there were enough items I liked, the service was fantastic, and the Bordeaux we got was a great choice. I love the purpose of the restaurant as well and that alone is enough for another star. I'd come back to try something else and get a vat of mac and cheese lol.

pw5eaiA-pGOPUbati5Lq_w.text: This place definitely delivered when it came to my entree. I thoroughly enjoyed everything except the cornbread. The banana pudding was really bad so don't get that. I have not extensively explored Charlotte so this is my go to restaurant in Charlotte as of now. It's priced fairly and it provides a good traditional southern meal that's well executed.I can't wait to bring my friends here! I had the fried chicken meal with sides btw(photo attached).

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

KRz1D-BPg1wwtqsrr8q0dg.text: This was the first time we had tried this restaurant.  We came for dinner with friends and upon arrival I was a bit apprehensive as I had recommended we try it based on good things I had heard about it.  The decor was more casual than I had anticipated so I thought it might not live up to expectations.   I'm happy to say it did not disappoint.  Everyone enjoyed the dishes they ordered. The tomato bisque was very good, the beet salad was crisp, delicious and well balanced with the goat cheese.  The flounder was one of the best seafood dishes I've had in the Charlotte area.  It was very moist cooked perfectly with great flavor. On top of that, it was a very generous portion.

QlaYnNt-6sJcvc_UfgCcdQ.text: Fried chicken and shrimp & grits was good. Mac & Cheese, collards and biscuit were amazing! The folks working here are super patient, knowledgeable and helpful. My friend ordered and glass of wine, but then changed her mind and they didn't charge her for the first glass. Great food, great service.

C67gc_pd_AMd9NyiGd2NnQ.text: I was in Charlotte for a conference.  We ate at Kings Kitchen Wednesday night.  The food was good and we were all pleased with what we ordered.  I thought the portions were small for a "Soul Food" place but none the less it was filling.  We did not have desert because there was nothing that appealed to us.  Why no cobbler, sweet potato pie or even Red Velvet cake was odd to us but maybe they are not known for those offerings.  Where it went bad was the SERVICE!  I gave it 3 stars only for the food The service was terrible.  We had an older gentlemen who acted as if were bothering him asking questions about the menu.  He took his time taking our order and was very slow on bring the drinks.  My friends ordered  wine and it was poured in a beer glass??? He never brought us water until we reminded him on his third trip to the table.  When he brought the food he smelled of cigarette smoke which meant he took some sort of break while our food was cooking.  Not exactable.  Makes me wonder if he even washed his hands upon his return.  Since his service was mediocre at best his tip reflected as such.  Not sure what was going on that night but they were not packed but full and did not seem to have a problem turning over tables but with that kind of service I will pass on my next visit to Charlotte.

MlGrJnmCqIa1IPb8tvhfiw.text: Looking for old fashioned soul food? You have defiantly found the right place. The fried chicken and cornbread was really good. Lots of sides to choose from.  The service was good. Defiantly a good place for lunch if you are downtown!

Qr3I_aYXRknq8yyv2fkL4g.text: What a fantastic concept for a restaurant. Great cause, great food. Service was incredibly slow, I could have eaten my arm off, but the food was great.

obPOBQA0p3uTE_OEE9zy_g.text: The Kings Kitchen was the answer to my "where to eat after our quickie wedding" prayers. The owner of the restaurant, Jim Noble, has a few other restaurants in Charlotte. I've eaten at one of them. Noble's, and it was fantastic. But a bit pricier than I wanted my new husband to have to deal with. I saw a link to The King's Kitchen, and after checking out the website, I was in love. The food was very southern, but I was immediately drawn to the salmon AND what they do for the community. So, I told my husband about it, made the reservation and anticipated a delicious meal.  After our short & sweet wedding, we headed downtown for dinner. We had reservations, but they weren't incredibly busy, so we probably would have been fine without one. We were seated quickly and our server greeted us promptly. He took our drink orders, came back and we ordered a few appetizers for the table. We ordered the deviled eggs & the pimento cheese. I can't comment on the pimento cheese, since I don't care for it and didn't try it, but the eggs were delicious. He also brought out two plates of biscuits with homemade strawberry jam and cornbread. Everyone raved about the cornbread. I had a biscuit with some jam and it was delicious, but nothing special.  The entrees came out quickly and everyone was more than pleased. I had the salmon with the pea risotto, which was fantastic. The salmon had a lime butter on top and the risotto was perfect. And the color was gorgeous and interesting. I was very pleased with the flavors of this dish (the salmon was some of the best I've ever had).   Several members of our table ordered the pot roast. I had a bite of my husband's and it melted in my mouth. I've never had a roast that was that tender and had such great flavor. My new mother in law had the fried flounder. I had a bite of that and it was incredible as well. Everyone loved their side items (the mashed potatoes, creamed corn & macaroni and cheese were HUGE hits), and almost everyone was pleased with their entrees. My new brother in law ordered the fried chicken, and while it looked delicious, he said their was so much grease it actually became unappetizing the more he looked at it.   Other than the fried chicken, the dinner was a huge success, and a fantastic evening was had by all. And while I loved my delicious dinner, I love what the restaurant does for the community and that just makes me want to go there over and over again. Anyone in Charlotte needs to try it out.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Deviled Eggs
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pea Risotto &amp; Salmon with lime butter

lrIcest3pEt-scOfJQuyFw.text: This place is great--the cooking is great tasting authentic southern style (I grew up in the deep South), the atmosphere is urban/modern--don't let the restaurant's mission fool you: they serve alcohol in an upbeat environment. Also, it was really affordable--to the point I almost felt guilty. If I stayed in uptown Charlotte all week, I would go here almost every day.

duRUe3RxMa-sKzll6B1Omw.text: Amazing place and food.  Being a vegetarian, I knew I was in the wrong place. But the panini I had and deviled eggs were brilliant. Wish they had more vegetarian options, but what I had was just superb!  The service was very good and the waiter was very courteous and pro-active at attending the table.  Must visit whenever you visit Charlotte.

XC0Tjpo7N068povrPiqslA.text: Huge shout out to the King's Kitchen. Great non-profit mission based restaurant that wants to make a difference to the local community and serving some of the best comfort food I have had in a long time.  Today was extremely cold and windy, and really needed a pick me up. the hosts set me up with the Tomato Bisque (best tomato bisque I have ever had) with extra crostini's, and a cup of mac & cheese.   I have dined here in the past, and the atmosphere is pretty great. If you are new to the area, come check it out. Be aware that this place is pretty popular so be prepared for a wait if you arrive during peak hours for dinner, especially later on in the week.   take care, and excited to see what else these guys will do in the future!  -Z.A.K

dsSS2KXeFjSQIy4qd_Qe5Q.text: Love this place!!! The mission, the food...amazing. Fried chicken and all the sides are stellar. Pot roast?  YUM!!! Eat here. You won't be sorry.

g0EPpWqsmKCeZjqUTsRXSg.text: Hands down one of my favorite places to eat in the QC.  Love the food - my standard order is the fried chicken, Mac and cheese, cabbage, and creamed corn with a sweet tea. Best comfort meal ever!  And make sure you save room for sweets after - the banana pudding is to DIE for.  I was a little disappointed last time I went - they changed their menu slightly and no longer had the pimento cheese spread. They had a dip that was equally as good - but I missed the spread!    On top of the wonderful food - I love that this place gives back to the community!

jL5z03-mBrqJEfrHhap_LQ.text: I came here by myself and sat at a bar high top table. The mission and spirit behind the restaurant is great! When I asked what the waiter recommended he told me about the shrimp and grits. I was good but I wasn't thoroughly impressed. The menu might have some other redeeming qualities but I didn't get to try them. Wishing for more selection on the menu as well. Worth at least trying!

1XzTUh961wiZD4UC8RJ-bQ.text: I was lead to this place because of an appearance that I'd saw on OWN. So, the following week I made reservation for this place and specifically (in my reservation notes) asked to be placed far away from high traffic. When we were seated, we just happened to be in a high traffic area. I went to the front and asked to be moved (ironically a manager was the one who placed us) and was advised that we could sit at the bar or wait for another table to open. At this point, I was beyond frustrated because I'd already had a lot of other things going on, and was intentional about my request in the reservation--at the least, I thought I could have been told about the seating upon arrival. A few moments later, the manager came over and offered a free appetizer... pimento cheese. I'm not the biggest fan of the stuff, but didn't want to interact much more because I was already "bothered" by what had happened; however, I didn't want to carry on being a pain in the rear. As I centered myself, I was able to recognize the gesture to "make it right." Even when I shared with him that I thought pimento cheese was "okay," he offered to get me something else if I'd wished. I appreciate this calmness, patience, and willingness to see that I had a good experience. It's not something that he had to do, but he did and that was much appreciated.  Nonetheless, up having an incredible server! She was super wonderful about helping us navigate the menu and make dinner choices. Further, she took time to answer our questions about the establishment in general--helping us to understand how the restaurant was involved in the community, events that take place through the year, and shared how the menu changes with the seasons.   The food, including the pimento cheese, ended up being wonderful as well. My husband had the fried chicken, collard, greens, butter beans, and biscuit. I ended up with the roast, mushroom, collard greens, and corn bread. I recommend all of it. I also enjoyed the fried okra as well. Hubby got the cup of gumbo and found it to be a bit spicy for his liking, but if spice is your life, go for it! I tried my husband's  biscuit and the honey spread... it made me regret that I hadn't just ordered a whole plate of biscuits and honey... so, so, so good.   When I left, I forgot that I was even frustrated when I first arrived. I was grateful that the experience itself and would certainly go back. The atmosphere is great and menu has awesome selections.

pyJyhjb4u-xSHwqPod5j7w.text: I almost never give a 5 star review, but unexpectedly this place deserves it. The beer selection is nice with many local brews on tap, and I had an amazing pork chop with a wonderfully tasting side. What a treat. I enjoyed every bite.

xQSnRUDcej8udQxkxuwWPw.text: I had Jimmys crab cake made with rice. Excellent. Lots of crab and great taste.  Service was attentive. The atmosphere is relaxed. Good twist on traditional dishes

S_D0lTJZIydhI8GihE-2lg.text: I took a group of 20 people here recently for a business dinner.  I primarily chose this restaurant because I work for a not for profit and we believe strongly in community so the King's Kitchen seemed like the perfect place to host our team dinner.  We had a pre-set menu which included the options of Pot Roast, Salmon, Fried Chicken, Vegetable Risotto and collard greens, mashed potatoes and mac n cheese as our side items with the two dessert choices being banana pudding and coconut cake.  First of all my group was really impressed with the selections of beer and wine.  The demographic of my group consisted of a bunch of 23 year olds with a few of us old fogies around to pay the bill.  They are all into different kinds of beer and raved to me about the selections available.  Upon arrival I asked the server for some of the "Starters" from the regular menu and the kitchen staff did their best to accommodate this last minute request.  Although it did seem to be a big deal (I thought restaurants like it when you order MORE food).  Not sure if they only have so many servings available per night but I'm not judging them on this.  The Sweet Potato Fritters were AMAZING, the Cheese Plate was beautiful and the Pimento Cheese was my favorite thing.  My only feedback would be to give more pieces of bread to go with it.  It was a huge ball of cheese with only a small amount of sliced baguette.    We started with the Gumbo  and a Salad which I had never had before but thoroughly enjoyed and those who had the salad said it was so good.    The mashed potatoes were perfect, the gravy was so flavorful, the mac n cheese was absolutely fabulous.  We also had collard greens which I liked but some mentioned that there seemed to be too much smoke flavoring in the greens themselves.  We all agreed that the bacon in the greens would not give the greens THAT much smoky flavor.  But EVERYONE ate them regardless.  I had 2 servings.  YUM.  Now about my FAVORITE thing in the world......FRIED CHICKEN.  OMG this was by far the BEST fried chicken I have ever had.  Not dry at all and so full of flavor.  I think I even dreamt about it that night.  So Good.  My group had the pot roast and the salmon and all said their dinner was amazing.    They served the banana pudding in small jars which was a nice touch.  The coconut cake was really good according to my group but I went with the banana pudding which I was IN LOVE with.  It looked like browned marshmallow on top, layers of fresh bananas, pudding and cookies were so good that I wished I had taken one TO GO!    Our server was a delight and every front of house staff member thanked us and said goodnight.  We felt very welcomed and I personally cannot wait to come back again........and again when I'm in Charlotte on business.  Highly recommended.

lrEHdII1-Z9T6W4eYOpTVA.text: Best southern food I had in Charlotte. The catfish was fried to perfection. Mac and cheese and mashed potatoes with gravy were heavenly. I didn't know I even liked black eyed peas until I had them there. Great sweet tee and the Oreo truffle was delicious. Plus they help feed and employ the homeless. An amazing restaurant

3aHJee24liFdL1lvAVY1KA.text: Excellent service provided by the team. Food (Chicken sandwich, fries, macaroni & cheese, burger) was very tasty all enjoyed a great time.

DQ1d1hOmWuJ1BstZUHntXw.text: I was really disappointed when I took my wife to this restaurant as I had been looking forward to checking it out. I normally don't write negative reviews but we found them seriously understaffed. I thought this was unusual because it was Thursday night. We got sat right away and got drinks, but then a server never came. Ever. We just gave up and left. I am still sad we didn't get to try anything.

UFFl5XZ8uRG9Y-UNHGwuCg.text: Great experience at The King's Kitchen.  The food is amazing!  Hard to beat the pan fried chicken with 3 sides, - Mac & Cheese, green beans and creamed corn.  Love the cornbread - just like Mom's...sorry Mom!  Okra fritters was a great choice for appetizer.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

S7bQ0CyBfv60BfhW__qm5Q.text: Went on a Friday night and sat at an outdoor table. Service was good, as was the food. Price was a relative bargain for Uptown dining.   As an aside: I am sick of Christians who boast of their faith, but who don't live it. Jim Noble lives it, owns it, makes it his mission to help a community which has made him successful. The story of The King's Kitchen reflects well upon this city as it has helped Noble's ministry thrive. I hope this story adds more chapters and successes as the years go by.

GlgT-K53rQBGuqqwfI6rnA.text: Had lunch and enjoyed the pan fried chicken with black eyed peas, collard greens, and mashed potatoes. Also enjoyed the biscuit for desert with a little honey on it. Food was good.... the cause is great.  Will certainly visit again.

71W6WzWy1foiMi6nZSIjAw.text: My favorite restaurant in Charlotte for sure!  A non-profit that employees and trains folks who would otherwise be unemployed. Great mission and incredible food!!!  Southern soul food using fresh ingredients and made the way it was meant to be made in the South. Fried chicken, Mac & cheese, collard greens and black eye peas are a most do.  I'll definitely go back as the pot roast looks great as does the catfish.

_Eri2Gu_WeFFJImRDqbAYQ.text: This place is a-OK. I got the fried chicken and husband got pot roast. His meat was a little dry. My chicken was cooked well but lacked seasoning. The sides were delicious. I had mac and cheese, collards, and mashed potatoes. I chose the biscuit instead of the cornbread...it was okay. Kind of small and hard. I tried my husband's cornbread though and it was pretty good.   The service was okay. Nothing to write home about but also nothing to complain about.   I was impressed at how quickly our food came out. It was probably 5 minutes from the time we ordered until our plates were in front of us.   All in all, I would return because I support their cause. I'd get a southern sides plate with cornbread next time.

U99EhdS-d59bgXOtVqpHDg.text: Second year that we are in town for the ACC Championship and our second trip to The King's Kitchen.  We had another excellent experience here.  Hopefully we'll be back next year.

Z7Sk0bcqO0Ma-99b9Mw96w.text: Was in Charlotte on business last night and decided to have dinner here based on all the positive reviews on Yelp. Once again, fellow Yelpers did not disappoint.   My colleague and I had a wonderful experience from start to finish. The ambience is inviting and well appointed- it was so refreshing to a) have an INCREDIBLE playlist (nostalgic '70's hits -think Stevie Wonder, Jackson 5, James Taylor), and b) be able to enjoy the music AND the dinner conversation at the same time. WHOA....ok, yeah, I just realized how that sounded. I'm old.  Well, if being old means I can enjoy good music, good conversation and a meal so good that if blindfolded I would have sworn my Mamaw were cooking in the kitchen? Then, yeah- go ahead and issue me my AARP card a couple years early.   We started with the pimento cheese spread as a starter. Excellent choice. Came with toasted french bread brushed with olive oil. I loved the fact that when my friend and I got dangerously low in the bread to cheese ratio, the bus boy noticed and brought out extra bread, of his own accord! Who does that nowadays??? It's the little things like that which make a good experience GREAT.   Our waitress, Angela was top notch. Attentive and professional, never once leaving us to want for a thing. In fact, everyone working last night seemed so pleasant. So happy, engaged, productive....the front of the house as well as the back of the house. It was really refreshing.   But I digress, back to the food.   We both ordered a "meat & 3" w/ fried chicken. The sides ranged from creamed corn, mashed potatoes, green beans, black eyed peas & collard beans.  Everything tasted like you hoped/dreamed/prayed it would. I swear.   We finished off the meal by splitting a piece of the homemade lemon merengue pie.   I cannot recommend this place enough. Not only is it on point in terms of its gastronomic prowess from an American comfort food standpoint, but the folks working there are doing so for reasons other than just putting food in our mouths. It's an organization that helps individuals learn skills to assist getting back on their feet after experiencing various challenges in life.   Not only did I leave last night with a full belly, but I just felt like all was right in the world- somehow good chicken = good karma.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pimento Cheese Spread w/ Toasted Baguette
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Chicken w/ creamed corn &amp; green beans
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lemon Merengue Pie w/fresh Strawberry Coulis

mxrhM9f7Vw8oTyw_bq5f3A.text: Wonderful meal!  Shrimp and grits were so good with a hint of ham and the scallops were awesome. Don't forget to try the coconut cake!!  To die for and I don't even like coconut that much!

soxAOLMCcGDn24_BitNuDg.text: My first time here for a private banquet. They put us in a private area and gave us a menu to select our main course. The sides are served family style. I chose the fried chicken and it was very good made southern style. The sides were mashed potatoes, Mac and cheese and coleslaw. I loved the potatoes! My kids loved the Mac and cheese with a panini which was pretty standard. The sweet tea was delicious. Our server was filled with humor and hospitality. The kitchen helps homeless learn the job trade so it was also a great feeling supporting the community. They have a covered patio that is huge and inviting. Large bar in the center. Wish I would've looked at the standard menu. Next time!

V_EecSD5k_Z-5gDyK1_HCQ.text: The best comfort food! The Mac n Cheese is amazing, the lunch bbq chicken is my favorite on the menu, I love that my money is going towards helping the homeless.

9ljoJ1YGEa4JVwrlmfDp0g.text: I have been twice and will be back.  This place has an amazing mission, but even without that, the service and food are exemplary.  If you want great, upscale comfort food, this is the place.  Highly recommend the fried chicken... great wine, cocktails.  Kudos to King's Kitchen.

hgJLp8dt9Q_wQTRZQewsVg.text: The apps and entrees is where it's at here at The King's Kitchen.  We got the sweet potato fritters and pimento cheese.  Both were nice and fresh and filled with flavor.  I also got a cup of the gumbo which was pretty stellar.  I ordered the Southern Risotto and the Hubby got the pork chop.  Both were the perfect combo of savory with a hint of salt.   My cousin got the shrimp and grits.  She's a pretty particular eater, and being from up north, was not sure what grits was all about but low and behold, she loved it!   The staff could not have been nicer, and truth be told, I really appreciate their mission.  I would certainly come here more often if it was a bit closer to us.    We did get two desserts to try at the end- brownie cheesecake and banana cream pie.  Really fun looking, but both were lacking in flavor for this girl.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sweet potato fritters, southern risotto, pimento cheese and pork chop! All were out of this world!

jCYPfkgkc1rDcsTGpQrlOw.text: We did take-out. The food came out fast. I did veggie plate, the veggies were good and my spouse had big house salad.  The salad was small,  especially for price. The portions on veggie plate for $14 bucks were small. Tried the okra fries, they were greasy.

5lJJ1x-UsZKMJoc5o-1k9A.text: Very good southern food!! Big portion sizes , tasty and full of flavor- I was impressed. Yes kind of higher cost but quality and going to a great cause. I've seen their ministry in action- feeding homeless, ministering to poor and offering jobs to persons in recovery. Just go!

WqEV7fALH3ftNIw7XNb-FA.text: Very well done Southern comfort food. The pot roast was moist and fork tender. Collards were sweet and smoky and the creamed corn was out of this world. This is what your grandma would feed you for Sunday dinner, if your grandma had been to culinary school. Portions were sensibly generous. I left very satisfied, but not overstuffed. Service was warm, sincere, and fast. Menu changes frequently. One tiny complaint: the cornbread was bland. Not bad, but not as delightful as the rest of the meal. Chef Noble and his staff have blessed Charlotte many times over with The King's Kitchen. Go hungry, enjoy richly, tip generously, and maybe even find inspiration at KingsKitchen.org

5gy2Y0v5sfaMs15PFWnWVA.text: I am not big fan of soul food so the menu was a bit limited for me. My friend who enjoys soul food wanted to go.   I got the deviled eggs and chicken fingers which were really good. Their garlic buttermilk dressing was really good and great to dip your fries and chicken in.    My friend got the salmon dish and said she has had better salmon but really enjoyed the mac and cheese she got as a side dish.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken tenders.
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Deviled eggs.

ERWDKlnEwKkCNgKAP2BMHA.text: Decided to give this place a try after reading reviews about the great food and their mission as a nonprofit organization. The restaurant appearance was upscale and the atmosphere was nice. The wait service was good and the food was great; however, the napkins were low budget. There were four of us dining there from Cincy. At the end of our meals, we all had lint all over our laps and my husband had lint in his mustache and beard!

m6O3nO5rAYnRnUb-mKcYTw.text: Myself and a group of friends came here for dinner on St. Patty's day. I understand they must have been packed during the day but they ran out of fried chicken which was a bummer.  My husband and I ordered the shrimp and grits and sides of mac and cheese and black eyed peas. Food was average, nothing amazing. Service was not great either. I would debate giving this place another try.

C6YzdBPEW3PowJ-ADw1UZg.text: In town for work and had lunch here. The food was the perfect southern comfort food I was looking for. Fried chicken had a nice crisp while juicy inside. Sides were fantastic: rich/cheesy  mac and cheese, flavorful green beans, and some of the best mashed potatoes with gravy.  Ice tea helped wash it all down.  The perfect southern food for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Aunt Beuts Fried chicken (dark meat) with a pillowy soft biscuit

xkc3maU8_YhT1O5oXCIbNA.text: We came with a graduation party of 23 tonight. The evening manager came out and said that even though there was adequate seating he could not seat us because it would back up the kitchen. He was not very welcoming either. The waitresses seemed confused by his decision as well. We kindly decided to go to McCormick and Schmick's where they happily took our money. It's a shame, I hear this place is really good.

_JkdD_QhnNQFqR24uzEm3A.text: I love the concept of this non profit restaurant and food was delicious.  I am in Charlotte for work and came here with 3 coworkers.   We shared 3 appetizers - lolla rose cabbage salad what an odd description but delicious. The dressing was perfect and I love the combination of stuff in it - sweet potato fritters.  Tastes yummy more like a donut dessert - crab cakes.  It's only one piece for $15.  But it's made with mostly crab.  Really awesome.  Highly recommended.   Then I had the grouper entree.  The fish was perfectly cooked.  Wasn't a fan of the farro though. Over seasoned.   They were kind enough to remake but still over seasoned for my taste.  Maybe I just prefer most things light on salt  Overall a great experience and the food came out fast which was great since we were hungry.  Definitely worth trying and the price was right.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab cakes full of crab.  Highly recommend
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grouper

iXSeMDrJBhDcApf7DUVmjA.text: I have been to The King's Kitchen on several occasions and most of my experiences have been good but one of things that I noticed as a result of this visit is that there is a pattern of this restaurant either not having in stock various items on the menu. This has happened more than once at The Kings Kitchen. On this particular visit they were out of both lemonade and creamed corn. I seem to always enjoy the BBQ Baked Chicken which on this visit it was rather dry. This was my first time trying the potatoe salad it wasn't the worst but was on the equivalent to a restaurant wholesale brand. Will not be doing that again. The collards were tasty but the black eye peas were not bland. Our host was very personable but was disappoint that he was not the actual waiter. No personality.

OwERNqwvzhqTB3gmwHRj1g.text: A business with such a great cause.  The service was excellent!!! Went in there, and was a packed house...but gave us an ETA, and we decided to stay since it was our last night in Charlotte. Soon enough- we were seated.  Food: sweet potato fritters were good, but too sweet. The local honey was on point.  Ordered the pan fried chicken- it was the best I've ever had!!!!  Creamed corn was heavy on the pepper.  Mac and cheese was very good.  Cornbread was disappointing.... too bad.  Let's talk- Dessert.....  Coconut cake- I'm drooling thinking of it. It was full of coconutish-butterish heaven!!! Chocolate ice cream - wow.....I wanted to keep licking the spoon from that goodness.   This place is a must try- service, food, atmosphere and best of all... the unselfish approach that's put forth.  God bless this establishment, and the hands and people behind such a great belief.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

mnEqdj9f4rMFkCJawsT2KA.text: The food looks a lot better online than it actually is. It was extremely hot inside. Waiter informed us the AC is broken. Not a very good dining experience in my opinion.

O80lyt4oCPoTQKB3DZ7Osw.text: Food is Delicious. Service was great.  We started with the Crab Cake, It's a must have! When for lunch.  The is a 3 side with a meat dish. Selected Fried Catfish with gravy mash, Mac and Cheese, cream of corn and cheese cornbread.  Catfish was perfectly cooked with a great light crispy batter.   If your in the area it's a must try.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Catfish.  Cream of Corn, Gravy Mash and Mac&amp;Cheese
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab Cake

DcBDvgzep2GHNMuYA1cAXg.text: Delicious soul food! Fantastic and friendly staff! The fried catfish was awesome! The biscuits are mind-blowingly good. Check the hours, wiggle around the construction and visit this gem! You won't regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yummy menu!

LGfAyQY3h7rRYTo3XLo5DQ.text: I should probably update my review. I have gone two more times and have not had good experiences. The food was cold and dry. On one visit the waiter forgot my drink, even after being reminded. I won't be back.

VarlpnLdk3i4IWlpbCh7Mw.text: This is my new restaurant that I recommend to out-of-towners looking around in the city. It's in a great area Uptown on Trade and walking distance to hot spots like the EpiCenter. The environment is fantastic. Sleek, trendy, but laid-back and casual at the same time. They have a great drink list.  The food is also delicious! We had pimento cheese (Yankee friend in town) and then I had their pasta/mushroom special. All of it was delicious. She had the beef brisket and didn't regret a single bite. Between their mission, their hiring model, the food, and the atmosphere, you can't go wrong with dinner at The King's Kitchen.

BgghyV7rXY4G19VvFEY6Og.text: Came here for my friend's birthday.mentiomes this to our waiter and he was kind enough to bring her a complimentary banana pudding with a birthday candle. We had the pimento cheese yum and fried chicken and sides. Macaroni and cheese is so good no lie. Green beans were so yummy. Really nice setting.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

vzXadk1dIi8FF8OqSDrEMA.text: This place is delicious. Simple food, easy cooking freshly made. We were here for lunch on a Tuesday afternoon and it was not as crowded. Actually it wasn't crowded at all. The one thing you have to understand is that this place is  nonprofit, which means it is on buy a minister and all the profits go to helping the homeless and what I assume is the church. The music playing is all about church-related and there is a cross by the kitchen. If you can look past that enjoy the food have an appetizer and a wine and you'll enjoy some nice North Carolina cooking.

f6NcVC9hEOpbFS1pLdG9UA.text: Excellent meal! Fried chicken,  black eye peas, cream corn, mash potatoes and gravy! As we sat down the host said enjoy your supper. Only in the South would you hear that

B8Xd2XlSLSUWu1E0bgFlAA.text: The unique thing about the King's kitchen is that it's a nonprofit restaurant. It's goal is to help hire and educate people that are considered 'unemployable'. All profits go towards feeding the hungry and helping to educate their staff members. It's truly remarkable to know as you pay for your meal that you are helping change someone's life.   Now let's get to the review......The interior of this restaurant is great. Very country modern- a look I love! They also have a nice outdoor patio for you to enjoy. If you're looking for a quick lunch try sitting at the bar area too!   I've been here twice for lunch and it's always been pretty busy. The service isn't amazing, but the food has always been delicious! I've had the deviled eggs for an appetizer which is a must. I haven't ventured out of the menu too much, but the chicken panini is great. It's comes with pimento cheese, arugula and a marinated tomato. The sandwich is a little messy since the tomato is marinated, but it will do with a knife and fork.   Plus, they have a large selection of southern sides including mashed potatoes, collard greens, fried okra, creamed corn and more! Actually they have 15 daily sides. Holy cow!!!! My favorite side I had was the daily special-yellow squash and zucchini (with tons of butter of course!). You can even get a "veggie" plate which includes your selection of 4 sides if you want to try a little bit of everything.   I've heard their dinner menu is amazing so I'll definitely have to check it out again! Stay tuned!

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken panini and squash

6dcQ0izx-0l2zdibkQYcvA.text: I was taken to lunch to celebrate my birthday and t,he first word that comes to mind is "Excellent" from walking in until leaving. Our server was friendly and attentive, I had gumbo which was cooked and seasoned perfectly and a little gem salad with pears& pecans the vinagrette dressing was complimentary it let The vegetables shine without overpowering the dish. My friend had the Kale salad she really enjoyed the salad especially the chick peas. I can't wait to go back and try more. Two different people raved about the pot roast.

rItrYYz2ifWz0eApsANxFA.text: So I yelped this place before coming to Charlotte on business and liked the idea that all the profits go to feed the hungry in town. When I went it was early in the night around 5 right when they open. I was the only one there and my server took the time to explain the whole story to me and provide recommendations for drinks and food. I could tell he was really passionate about the place and whether you're into the religious piece of it or not, it's a really great cause regardless. Then to top it off, the food was perfect. I started with the sweet potato fritters with honey and they were hot, crispy and perfectly fried (definitely sweet so if you'd prefer to start savory maybe start with something else, but they were great for me!) For my entree I got the fried chicken and three sides (collards which were awesome, black eyes peas and Mac and cheese). If I had to pick, I'd say I could have gone without the Mac and cheese but it's also because I ordered so much food!   I would definitely recommend this place if you're in Charlotte looking for some high quality Southern food... And last, but most importantly, the homemade biscuits are worth going back for on their own and they offered me extra to take on the road.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tryon Street
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Homemade Biscuit to start with butter and a local draft beer
Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sweet Potato Fritters with Honey

JBUMK0P0Hb0LEzrmxFLHhA.text: I'm a fan of the restaurant's mission. Food is excellent. Fried chicken is cooked old fashion in a cast iron skillet. Side dishes are delicious.   At lunch, they used to serve you biscuits and corn bread before your meal. The cornbread is now served with the meal. So, I don't understand why they still give me a side plate.   The prices are reasonable for dinner, but they're a bit steep for lunch. $15 for fried chicken plate, and $19 for salmon plate.

GsT5D2woC3x8rPdxwjXFIw.text: Really yummy southern cooking and friendly service. Had the ravioli and squash puppies. Hubby loved his spicy gumbo and pork chop. They had a kid's menu with chicken tenders  that were not processed but had a nice fried chicken batter.  Would come back here if we were back in this area.

J1eMpDs5_VkPYVET8C-C_w.text: Good, but not great, casual restaurant with abundant Southern fare, reasonable prices, and an admirable social mission to give Charlotte's homeless the chance to turn their lives around. I SO wanted to like this place more than I did ... but my order of fried chicken was dry, and the side of mashed potatoes lacked flavor. I'll pay King's Kitchen another visit sometime, because I believe the owners are doing a good work. They deserve all the support they can get.

G3vrJFCi3z16mY_7g8siGw.text: Veggies were yum. I didn't love the gumbo. Tomato Bisque, YUM! I would for sure go back. Great place. I love their mission, the service and the Food! Go, eat and enjoy!

-9_wnhMrnYHpCH73nAD1Cg.text: Greeted right away by someone who explained their philosophy to us. My boyfriend couldn't care less, but I didn't mind since we had to wait a few minutes anyway. He was super friendly and our waitress was also. The food was DELICIOUS. I'm from PA so fried food isn't normally my thing, but the fried chicken with Mac and cheese and collared greens was life changing. Good for you? No. Worth it? YES.

Bmq8mDkMkI3_EQrstWDP-g.text: Soul food at its finest. I live in the neighborhood and have passed The King's Kitchen time and time again, so a few weeks ago I finally came in for lunch. It's in a great Uptown location just off Tyron and nestled on the corner across from the park. We sat along a window and ordered iced tea, received a variety of bread (love some cornbread!) and ordered our lunch entrees. I got flounder with a choice of 3 sides- I opted for mac and cheese, green beans and cole slaw. Y-u-m!   The best part about King's Kitchen is that it's for a good cause- from the website:  "We're a not for profit restaurant serving up southern cuisine made with fresh, local ingredients from right here in our community. And the proceeds go back to the community, helping to feed those in need. So, come on in. Because when you dine, the whole community thrives."  I'm a big fan of supporting those in need, so King's Kitchen gets an extra star for this alone. Looking forward to my return!  Fun tip: they have great pastries in the morning. My boyfriend got a spiced muffin and scones on his way to work- they should definitely advertise this, because they'd knock the competition out of the park.

3izFjvSyD_m3uekBlQXEiA.text: Love their mission. They are a non profit restaurant and their profits they make go toward the less fortunate (i.e. "the homeless, the poor, troubled youth, rehab graduates and other members of our community who are in need of employment")

hdlBGriEEG1ch37R1YmjyQ.text: Underwhelming. This is coming from a New York girl who came thinking she would finally indulge in some great southern cooking. Boy was I underwhelmed. This place was packed and I could not understand why. The portions were extremely small. The Mac and cheese was extremely bland. The catfish was extremely cheap and from the frozen food aisle of your local grocery. I don't recommend this place for any reason. Not one thing about this restaurant is good.   I had better southern cuisine in my beloved New York City. :(

hMmlhdjfCYFApB5Kl-YZzA.text: So it was time to pay this place another visit.  I was CRAVING their fried chicken in addition to their deviled eggs for which I partook of both.  I threw in a pecan pie a la mode for good measure........and all was right in the world.  FYI...they are opening a bakery next door (on Church Street) that from the street and peering through the windows will serve baked breads and sandwiches for the lunch crowd.....another great reason to patronize this place for all the good it does.

z1mIrnN0-_fizngAtgDB8Q.text: the pan fried chicken is great! For side, green beans, creamed corn and mashed sweet potato are all good.  I dont like the corn bread, it is salty, not sweet.

beLgh6xxmLWrJ4P7vt7dLQ.text: My friend and I went here last night (2/10) and the food and service were good. We both got the fried chicken (dark as they were out of white) I got potato salad, Mac and cheese, and black eyed peas. The black eyed peas were to die for. I've never had any that good from a restaurant, the Mac and cheese was also pretty solid. And I'm very critical of Mac and cheese. The potato salad was just alright. My friend got the greens, creamed corn and potatoes and gravy. She said they were all very good as well. My only gripe would be to offer your vegetables without pork as well. As someone who doesn't eat pork I had to get a salad instead of greens or green beans because both contain ham. The only other complaint would be the lack of liquor. I do enjoy wine. But sometimes a good crafty cocktail and can take a meal over the top. Other than that it was great service. Very reasonably priced and a nice place. Definitely will come back with my family!

GkvrL52y78NDKy9U59X0Fw.text: Visiting The Kings Kitchen, I had very high hopes. By the end of the night, my hopes were let down a tad bit. We had 8:30pm reservations, but by the time we were seated, it was around 8:45pm. We did not receive drinks(water) until 9:20pm, and our food around 9:35. We waited almost an hour before eating, and I know it was busy for a saturday night, but an HOUR!?! Come one people, do better! The food was ok, the waiters were nice but ALWAYS on the go. The bbq wings we received for an appetizer were not cooked all the way thoroughly, and although they replaced them with more, it left a bad taste in our mouths of the cook. How can you serve bloody chicken wings at a restaurant?! Also,  I was very disappointed when I found out they did NOT serve liquor, only a few beers and a few selections of wine. 2 thumbs down in my book.  We all tried the "corn bread" and only 2 out of 5 enjoyed it. I felt it was a little too "wet" for my liking.  I ordered the fried chicken, mac & cheese, and collard greens. The chicken was juicy and delicious. The mac&cheese was ok, but the collard greens had a little too much vinegar for me. I did not like them at all. My sister had the fried chicken, mac&cheese, collard greens and carrots, she loved it all. My mother had the fried chicken, black eye peas, mac&cheese & collard greens. She liked it all except the black eyed peas, which she thought were a bit mushy. The rest of the table tried cabbage and corn as a side, which they thought were delicious, while a friend also had the tilapia and she enjoyed it alot.   Would I go again? Maybe, but not for a very long time.

trxBimIU1jSzUcNodeA5rA.text: We almost made a huge mistake and walked right past this GEM of an establishment. When we walked in, we were warmly greeted and seated right away in a quaint booth in the corner. We each ordered the post roast.... DO NOT pass on this! I had the mac and cheese, creamed potatoes, and green beans with mine. He had the mac n cheese, mushrooms, and creamed potatoes with his. Everything was amazing. Everything. I'm so glad we came in. Service was great and the food was even better. Thank you, King's Kitchen, for an amazing first experience!

eMrsLCZi6C-jq48UYoQZXA.text: Based on the giant cross over the kitchen, I am guessing that the King in King's Kitchen is the one True King.  Very nice.  Coming into this place it looked very much in its element, which means that it is very elegant, with a open bar, simple clean tables with very upscale silver, china, and stemware.  Very fitting for being at the end of the block down from Trade and Tryon.  The menu is also simple and elegant, with choices for the not-so-hungry and the very hungry.  I had seen the reviews on Yelp, so I had the Fried Chicken with 3 sides.  Everything was just perfect.  The chicken was perfect, mac and cheese perfect, stewed tomatoes perfect, creamed corn PERFECT.  One thing I did not notice until "checkout" is that there is a place to put an additional donation at the bottom of your receipt, which will be added to your (credit card) bill.  Even without an additional donation, I suppose a nonprofit would be a preferred location if you want to help out.  O-O I'll be back !!

4Yd0Qy_-6f87Lqs6eMNHjQ.text: not sure the strong rating is warranted. sat down ordered the fried chicken + sides of mac&cheese, green beans, and mash potatoes.  asked for a local IPA. before i could take 2 sips, a warm plate of food arrived. must have been premade and on warmers. tasted fine, but not impressed.

j8QWR83-PpzG1nsdcfODIw.text: After reading all of the previous reviews about Kings Kitchen I finally made my way over today. I ordered a veggie plate with Mac n cheese, creamed corn, black eyed peas, and cabbage. The food was ok, lacked seasoning and portions were skimpy. Don't think I'll return here.

Y8BGiHOq7HdeWCpFX1F-7g.text: This restaurant was recommended by a local. It helps the homeless with funds and jobs. I would support the mission even if the food and experience were average.  However there is nothing average about this restaurant.  The food is exceptional, the decor has a nice edgy yet comfy / casual feel, and the service is top notch.  Try the gumbo, spicy good! This will be my lunch spot from now on.

lwBjeLxDsGCnVY_2WHR-WA.text: This was one of the first places we went out to when we arrived in Charlotte and I'm spoiled rotten.  My whole family ate dinner here.  My mom, who has a million allergies, was given special attention by the manager and her meal, she said, was amazing. I had probably the freshest crab cake I've ever tasted and the BISCUITS! Oh they are delicious and the jelly, however you pronounce it, was like nothing I've tasted.  Everyone in our party loved it.

6R6o0I_2heyWwiAk8229Cg.text: Quiet Friday in the Banking Megatropolis of the US.  This establishment lived up to the billing as the Fried Chicken was hot and crisp. I would highly recommend the collard greens and mashed potatoes.  Sides of the day were grilled Okra and squash.   I would definitely recommend this as the real deal having lived in Charleston SC and Atlanta.   They do not however offer pecan pie as a dessert option.

mntXv1gQalDyIb7yPjoN7Q.text: You want me to do what? Eat delicious fried chicken for a good cause? Well, don't mind if I do!   For San Franciscans, The King's Kitchen is like the Delancey Street Foundation. They help those in need in the community by providing job assistance and hope. They get people back on their feet and back to becoming contributing members of society. I can definitely get behind that, especially with the food they serve!  I've only ordered a Fried Chicken plate at lunch with JUST DARK MEAT (YUM), but I'd definitely revisit if I'm in Charlotte again.

8Bc23FZZb2MZlwgxeQ4FsQ.text: One of the best meals I've ever had. Started with the arugula salad and my entree was the white meat fried chicken with collard greens, mac n cheese, and mashed potatoes and gravy. Fried chicken with 3 sides is only $14, which seems reasonable to me.

photos.caption: Photo of The King's Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Arugula salad

2EQZ-bJJhKHiVXx4M0ceFA.text: Great concept. Limited menu choices and typically one daily special which merits your strong consideration.  They stick to a few classic favorites and do them very well.  Reasonably priced.  Nice atmosphere.  Friendly service.

aTCSXEbF2dlDlDZ9nzZ4jA.text: Had dinner here with another couple. The manger was great and helped us choose a wine that paired well with our dinner. Enjoyed the vegetable plate and salmon. Very cool concept, and laid back place to have dinner with friends.

OEBZzdewZadatp5em4rjtA.text: I went there with a friend to check out this place again! OMG how can you mess up a chesseburger and it was cold I could have used it as a hockey puck for the rye ranger! Than after this very bad meal I did not eat the wait staff asked me did I want to give money to the homeless! I said no I want to get out of here and here just take this money goodbye! Yes I was very rude not the first time here come on to charge these prices give me some good food! Ok as for the homeless they were begging me before I came in to eat close this place down!!!!! Is this place a scam for something eles?

pC471gCTYLjFIyDXl0Qbkw.text: For a person that never finishes all of any meal, I was more than content to stuff my face until I had to be rolled out of the restaurant.  Luckily, it did not come to that.  The flounder was absolutely delicious.  It was fresh and light and the batter was delicious and crispy.  The macaroni and cheese was just the right balance of crisp cheese and well-cooked pasta.  Please do not get me started on the collard greens and cornbread.  Suffice it to say, deliciousness.  My boyfriend gave me some of his ribs and they were also an awesome option.  Overall, our server was fantastic, the food was great and the prices were reasonable.  All four people in our party were beyond pleased!

uItks9r0ZXqCH1HIDNYS_g.text: Awful!!! Will never come back to this place again  cornbread was so dry sucked up all my saliva - okra nasty, collard greens had zero seasoning, fried chicken was bland...even the damn biscuit was dry.  The ONLY thing that was decent was the Mac and Cheese. Gumbo sucked cheap with the meats! If you want some REAL REAL GOOD Cajun food: Cajun Queen is your place!!! Anyway so we paid and left The Kings Kitchen and we are now here at Rock Bottom to eat...AGAIN...so pissed!

UPzBJ2nnZBg58Eczgz5yig.text: I am between Meh and A-ok. Mostly leaning towards Meh, but rounding up simply because I love the concept and was excited since we love Roosters and they are owned by the same people had high expectations.   Had made a reservation, but were still seated at an awkward table at the front of the restaurant where I had to actually change seats with my husband since there was a giant light that was shining directly down on my face. He said it didn't bother him since he is taller, but I think he may have just been trying to make me feel better.   We decided to start with the cheese plate which was tasty, but never comes with enough crostinis so I had to ask for some more, which is not a big deal except for the fact that within a minute of bringing them out, our entrees arrived. This is a big pet peeve of mine at a restaurant. I order an appetizer to enjoy before my meal arrives. I don't like to be interrupted halfway through with a big plate of food. Something always ends up getting pushed to the side and that feels like such a waste to me. (I know I could have sent it back and said we weren't ready yet, but our service was already iffy, at best, and didn't want to risk being served a cold entree since they were annoyed with me).   Both the hubs and I ordered the skillet chicken and found it to be pretty tasty, though I would have liked to see a little more seasoning in the skin. The mashed potatoes were my favorite part. I found it to be disappointing that we had to ask for the biscuit and cornbread that were ordered with our entrees and then equally disappointed with the quality of the biscuit when it arrived (though husband thought the corn bread was pretty tasty).   All in all, I left feeling a little disappointed and even though I think it is a great concept, don't think I will be heading back or recommending it to anyone any time soon.

fimIA9u3r5j1wXdUowbCnA.text: I went to the King's Kitchen with my boyfriend. The service was great and we were attended by the waitress and manager. We ordered two local beers, the pimento cheese appetizer, the pot roast and fried chicken entrees. Although the did mix up my boyfriend's order, we enjoyed mostly everything we ate (he didn't like the black eyed peas). I was surprised about the religious sayings in the restaurant, my boyfriend told me it is normal in the south. We would definitely come again.

tKzjMVa23z4TpXczWcX5aA.text: Come for the food, the fried chicken or other home cooked dish, or the story that makes this restaurant what it is. The point is that it is a must. I dare say the gem of Charlotte. Out of town guests? Don't tell them the fact that this is a non-profit giving a few great people a chance at learning a new skill in this upscale restaurant setting. Tell them as they enjoy their meal.   The bakery is fantastic. Take some home. Try to dessert. You'll be glad you did.

4jWPltcaZNsytnO5WtCj_A.text: What a wonderful concept!  I was really excited to come here and it did not disappoint!  Reservations - We were here for March Madness and were thankful that we made a reservation.   Parking - Plenty of parking lots around the city.  Service - Friendly!  Food - For the most part, very good. 1.  Pimento Cheese and Toasted Bread - Love it!  Big portion to share. 2. Pork Chop - Avoid.  Dry and bland. 3. Shrimp and Grits - Very light and delicious.  However, the portion is a bit small. I walked away hungry. 4. Scallops - Cooked very well, flavorful and moist.  But again, small portions. 5. Banana Pudding - Very very good.  Made with real banana's, not that yellow store bought banana flavored pudding.

UHMTEDELBWMNh7P5VPbc1Q.text: What a great place!  We loved our pimento cheese dip appetizer.  My shrimp and grits was fabulous!  But perhaps best of all, was my banana pudding.

LzSYF9I1EIFfu-QG4JWDqw.text: My best friend and I were headed uptown to see the Book of Mormon at the Belk Theater and decided we had just enough time to grab a quick dinner.  I used the Open Table app to get us a table for just as we would arrive at 7pm.  We were greeted and seated quickly.  The restaurant was fairly full so we were quite happy to have gotten a table.  Knowing the show was to start at 8pm, we ordered and bottle of wine, the Pimento Cheese appetizer and each got a cup of the Noble's Tomato Bisque.  Our waiter was so understanding of our tight dinner window; the wine was brought immediately and the food followed shortly thereafter.  The pimento cheese was some of the best I've had and was a perfect compliment to the tomato bisque, which was a lovely balance of tomato without the heaviness of cream.  Although our visit was quick, we thoroughly enjoyed and I look forward to another full meal at another time.

4S9J_P3IRJdbWmpotI6-8Q.text: Great Food.  Wonderful Atmosphere, can carry on a conversation and hear eachother., Service is Wonderful and it is for a Great Cause

BVMZcr6huD8ETuT60_zGBw.text: Good southern food with an even better purpose! We sat outside and besides the noisy city sounds, it was delightful. The staff was attentive and helpful. The food was unique and delicious. I can't wait to go back for their grits they offer at dinner.

61zKVB-hRJQqxD4puQLGbg.text: I really, really wish that our meal deserved four or five stars. I am a passionate fan of Rooster's and Rooster's Uptown so I was excited to eat at the King's Kitchen. If you are craving authentic southern food, you must eat here. I, however, am more of a modern southern cuisine girl so the food did not sing to me. The fact that my food also came out of order and sometimes 2 plates at the same time (nope, I am not kidding ... ) might have confused my palate a little bit. I thought the food was incredibly over-salted (and I consider salt a food group) - even my wedge salad was salted. Heavily.   I was pleasantly surprised when I blindly ordered a glass of Riesling (no mixed drinks here!) and was presented with a local NC wine. And, yes, it was excellent!   My husband is on a quest for the best banana pudding ever (is that even what it's called? you Southerners need to set me straight ... banana pudding, vanilla wafers, etc.) ... and he said that this definitely makes the top of his list.   Check out the King's Kitchen. Jim Noble is doing some amazing things over there. But maybe check it out mid-week or perhaps for lunch where the service might be a little bit less harried.

z_gUYfc-O1wU00ph2ocZGg.text: They are vegetarian-friendly.  Staff is knowledgable and helpful.  Food is fresh, local and interesting.  Lots of diner dishes with new variations that make the upscale price worth paying.

pk53wp6dUuI9L7-PmqTjjw.text: I finally had the pleasure to experience TKK!  For those who enjoy fresh ingredients prepared to become unique spins on comfort food & the knowledge that your patronage directly assists those within the community who have had their extra share of difficulties -- look no further.  I hosted a co-worker event, using one of the semi-private rooms.  The staff was extremely organized, prepared & professional from beginning to end.  Choose this experience for not only food with soul, but a restaurant with an inspired mission to be more than just itself.

-RdJ3Cnf9SPvFuv3uRuB3A.text: A colleague introduced me to The King's Kitchen for lunch this week. The biscuits and cornbread was home style.   Although the fried chicken looked fabulous, I needed something a little lighter. So I ordered the chicken salad which came out on a crusty, thick crescent roll; they called it a croissant but it is not the light French pastry you might anticipate. It was accompanied by shoestring fries sprinkled with what might have been pepper. My colleague's lunch was the panini which she enjoyed.    The place gets five stars for its commitment to the homeless and for its overall mission.  The place is clean and the service is also five star.  The food was good and very reasonably priced.   Bottom line: Go. Give back to the community and get a little something for your tummy while you're there.

YLSy0ovVR5hrxmWiAlqzAA.text: I ordered the salmon and sides (potato salad, fries, slaw and biscuit).  The sides were delicious.  The salmon was dry and on the small side.  The sides made the meal (southern cooking - what was I thinking ordering salmon?).
